loans.name: Ermetania

texts.en:
Ermetania is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like beans, fish, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Ermetania has been in this business for 30 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Ermetania has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like beans, fish, meat, vegetables, etc. for her food production/vending business

loans.name: Janvier

texts.fr: Janvier est un homme de 48 ans, fiancé et père de trois enfants dont l'âge varie entre 11 et 16 ans. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère depuis quelques années. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Janvier is a 48-year-old, engaged father of three, ages 11 to 16. He is in commerce and opened a small food shop, which he has been running for several years. Thanks to this business, he meets the needs of his family. Thanks to his warm welcome and his good relationship with his neighbors, he won over and made loyal a clientele that has grown over time. He is currently unable to totally satisfy his clientele, which is why he needs this loan for his business, so he can augment the stock of his daily needs products. This will increase sales and thus his profit margins. Part of his profits will be reinvested into his business to make it grow, and he rest will allow him to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to augment this stock of his daily-needs products

loans.name: Marsiyah

texts.en:
This is the story of Chasanah, daughter of Marsiyah:

"My father works as a laborer, while my mother did not work but was at home taking care of the family. My father's income every month is uncertain, because of the energy and health factors that are not well for my dad. My father suffers from cataracts and to date, he has not been able to check with a doctor, while he is required to work because he is the only one in the family that is relied on to make a living. I live with my grandparents. They are very old, so my dad is given a load to make enough for two families. Now my father works as a laborer in Jakarta, but he said he was very tired, because the work is so heavy with meager wages. Due to the poor health condition of my father, his work should not be heavy, but the economic demands mean that he has no choice. I really want to help but I have not been quite able. I can only pray to profess my father is given health and my family can be a family gathering as before."

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Akofa

texts.fr: Demeurant à Lomé précisément au quartier adidogomé, AKOFA est âgée de35ans, célibataire et mère d’un enfant, elle fait le commerce des amuses gueule qu’elle achète au  grand marché de Lomé et revend par la vente ambulante.  AKOFA  s’approvisionne 2 fois par mois au  grand marché de Lomé. AKOFA  sollicite un microcrédit pour augmenter  son activité de revenu afin de participer à la charge du foyer et aussi avoir beaucoup plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Living in Lomé, specifically in the Adidogomé neighborhood, Akofa is 35 years old, single, and the mother of one child. She sells appetizers, which she buys at the grand market in Lomé and sells it door-to-door. Akofa stocks up twice a month at the grand market in Lomé. Akofa is seeking a microcredit loan to grow her business and profits in order to participate in the household expenses in addition to having more earnings.

loans.use: to buy ten bundles of coconuts and one carton of milk

loans.name: Nancy Estela

texts.es: Nancy tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 15 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Nancy Estela is 42 years old and she has been selling shoes for the last 15 years. Her business is located in the municipal market in a zone with much foot traffic.  For this reason, she has many customers. With the sales she makes, Nancy Estela manages to cover her household costs as they arise. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children.

Nancy Estela is requesting a loan to purchase shoes at wholesale in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale to sell in the public market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, refreshments, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: grow his business a bit more to be able to keep getting ahead and improve his economic situation.

loans.name: Lutfullobek

texts.ru: Лутфуллобек 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Лутфуллобек успешно окончил среднюю школу. В школьные годы он был одним из лучших учеников. Он данное время является студентом 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Лутфуллобек учится хорошо и отлично. Он учится по специальности Аудит и бухгалтерский учет. Лутфуллобек любит такие предметы как информатика, математика, родной язык и т.п. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Lutfullobek is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents. He successfully finished high school and was one of the best students in his class. He is now a junior at Tajik State University of Business and Politics. Lutfullobek is an A and B student, learning to be an accountant and auditor. His favorite subjects are computer science, math and Tajik language etc. Lutfullobek must pay for his college tuition, but has no money. He hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 38 years old, married and together with her spouse she has been blessed with five children. She does dairy farming and has been in the farming business for 10 years.

She plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow. This will enable her to get more milk to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analie works hard to support her family.

She has a pig raising business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Analie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pig raising business.

Analie has sustained her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her achieve her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sinceridad

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sinceridad works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Sinceridad is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more baskets of fish for her fish vending business to sell.

Sinceridad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Norma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an income from a general store. Norma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish for her fish vending business to sell.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 57 years old and a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Lilian has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Lilian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Veronica successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell. NWTF is re-listing Veronica's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is in an agricultural business, farming fruits in the Philippines. Josephine has been farming fruits for 15 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. Evangelina has been in this business for 3 years now.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Amivi Enyonam

texts.fr: AMIVI âgée de  54  ans est de nationalité Togolaise. AMIVI est  mariée  et mère de 2enfants tous scolarisés habitant  à Lomé  dans le quartier adidogomé. elle est revendeuse des produits cosmétiques et s’approvisionne 3 fois par mois au  marché d'Assiyéyé.Elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son  commerce et faire plus de bénéfices. AMIVI ne disposant pas de foyer à gaz et les moyens nécessaires pour prendre soins des enfants, ce crédit sera très utiles au bien être  de toute la famille.
texts.en:
Amivi is 54 years old and from Togo. She is married and the mother of two children who attend school, and they live in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé.

Amivi is a reseller of cosmetic products and procures her supplies 3 times per month at the market in Assiyéyé. She is requesting a loan which will allow her to grow her business and earn more profit.

Amivi does not have a gas stove or the necessary means to provide for her children; this loan will be very helpful for the well-being of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 dozen hair extensions, 5 dozen conditioners, and 3 dozen perfumes

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly is a hardworking woman, 54 years old. She lives with her son in a small house and without hygienic latrine. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and husbandry, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
José de 31 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que ya asiste al kínder. Tuvo la oportunidad de preparase académicamente, es un profesional en ciencias jurídicas, su esposa es enfermera y trabaja en un hospital. Con él viven sus padres,  su esposa y su hijo.

José es empleado, tiene 10 años trabajando con cargo administrativo en la corporación policial de la ciudad, trabaja 4 días seguidos se levanta a las 5:00am para tomar el autobús a la 6:00 am y viajar 30km hasta llegar al lugar de trabajo, para luego salir de su trabajo a las 4:00 pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar joyas de enchape, ya que su esposa edemas de ser enfermera también se dedica a la venta de este tipo de mercadería con sus compañeras y con clientela particular. José espera que con su esfuerzo y el de su esposa le puedan dar a su hijo el estudio para que tenga la oportunidad que sus padres le dieron a él.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old, he is married and he has a 6 year-old son who is already going to kindergarten. He had the opportunity to study at university, and is a professional in the field of law. His wife is a nurse and works in a hospital. He lives with his parents, his wife and his son. 

José is employed. He has been working in an administrative role in the police unit of his city for 10 years. He works four days in a row, getting up at 5 am to take the bus at 6 am and travel 30 km to get to his job. Later, he leaves his job at 4 pm. 

The loan will be used to buy veneer jewelry, since his wife, in addition to being a nurse, also sells this type of merchandise to her friends and private customers. José hopes that with his and his wife's efforts, they will be able to give to their son an education so that he has the same opportunities that José was given by his parents.

loans.use: to purchase veneer jewelry

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is thankful that she was granted a 23,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through this loan she was able to recover the loss her store incurred during the typhoon that occurred in their area, and it also helped meet their daily needs.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and other grocery stuff. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings.

Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Marjorie dreams of having a bigger General Store and of leading a happy and quiet life. She also wants to give her child the best education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 59 years old and married, and she has four children. All of her children are married and live on their own. She earns money for her family by raising farm animals and selling their meat and wool at a local bazaar. She has been working in this area for 10 years, and her monthly income is 220 AZN. Kamala's husband helps her in this business.

Azerbaijan's people have been raising sheep and selling their wool from ancient times. They use their wool for sewing warm jackets, blankets, gloves, etc. These items made from sheep wool are very warm and soft. Sheep meat is used to cook such delicious dishes as kebab. People like eating kebab during holidays and at parties.

Kamala wants to expand her business. Though raising farm animals is a good source of income, unfortunately her income is too low to cover the life demands of her family. She has applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy additional farm animals (cows). She plans to produce and to sell milk and dairy products. Let’s help Kamala to reach her aim.

loans.use: to buy additional farm animals (cows)

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Unidas” está integrado por 21 señoras ellas tienen cada una sus actividades respectivas, en las que trabajan y con lo cual ayudan a sus familias. También hacen actividades en conjunto que les permitirá poder ir mejorando sus vidas y las de sus familias.
Es admirable y responsable una de las integrantes, y esa persona es Maria, quien tiene una despensa, tiene muchos productos que ofrece a sus clientes, con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar y hoy día ya es más que conocida en su barrio.
Maria es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que se está esforzando para poder salir adelante. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, bebidas, productos a granel y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando a la vez por mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (Women United) communal bank is made up of 21 women.  Each of them has their own business, which each works in to help their respective families.  They also do activities together, which allow them to keep improving their own lives and their families' lives as well. 
One of the members of the communal bank is admirable and responsible; that is Maria.  She has a general store,with many products to sell to her customers.  With a lot of work, she was able to open the store, and today she is more than well-known in her neighborhood. 
Maria is a very hard-working and enterprising person.  She is putting forth a lot of effort to get ahead.  She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, beverages, bulk products and other items for her store.  This way, she will be able to continue working, as she has been, and fighting to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, beverages, bulk products and other items.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 54 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines, and has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Evangeline has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Evangeline would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 54 years old, married, and has eight children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Luzviminda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Luzviminda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yrysbubu

texts.ru: Ырысбубу 42 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. У Ырысбубу среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она с 2004 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Ырысбубу есть 3 козы, также земельный надел, мерою 0,50 ГА, где она ежегодно сажает кукурузу и табак для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Ырысбубу, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание детей. Однако Ырысбубу не унывает и ищет источники развития ее бизнеса. Поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ырысбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 коров. Доходы от кредита Ырысбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, что позволит ей в будущем улучшить финансовое состояние семьи.
texts.en: Yrysbubu is 42 years old, a widow and a mother of three. She has a high school degree. Since 2004 the main source of income for the family has been farming, which Yrysbubu started with 10,000 som (KGS). She now owns 3 goats, as well as 1.5 acres of land where she grows corn and tobacco. Her hard work provide the family with 10,000 som (KGA) a month. This is nowhere near enough to have a decent life and raise children. But Yrysbubu does not despair and is looking for new ways to expand her business. She has now turned to "Bai Tushum" bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), so she can purchase four cows. She plans to invest the profits from this expansion to continue growing her business and to improve the financial well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows for fattening and resale, in order to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 33 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 6 years. 

Dolores requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and has eight children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Wilma has been raising pigs for 6 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Wilma requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es:
María de 26 años de edad, se dedica al comercio y agricultura sus estudios culminaron hasta noveno grado, ella creció con su padre, ya que su madre la abandono fue quien le enseño esta actividad su familia esta conformada  por su esposo quien le apoya en los trabajos y cuatro hijos que van a la escuela y conviven con ella. 

María se dedica a comercializar granos básicos (Maíz, frijol, frutas) en su vivienda y en el mercado de la ciudad donde obtiene mayores ventas de los productos que ofrece.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maíz, frijol, maicillo y frutas  para incrementar la mercadería para su negocio que posee,  le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos.

María planea que con los ingresos que obtiene  del comercio de granos y con ayuda de su esposo, piensa en un futuro construir una vivienda digna para sus hijos ya que actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old; she is in sales and agriculture. Her studies ended in the ninth grade. She was raised by her father, since her mother abandoned her. He was the one who taught her this trade. Her family is made up of her husband who helps her at work and four children who go to school and live with her. 

Maria sells basic grains (corn, bean, fruits) in her house and in the city market where she makes the biggest sales of the products she offers. The loan she is requesting is to buy corn, beans, sorghum, and fruits to increase the merchandise at her business. It will help her increase her earnings. 

Maria plans for the earnings she gets from her grain sales and from her husband’s help are she hopes to build a home in the future worthy of her children since the one she lives in now is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sorghum, and fruits to increase the merchandise at her business. It will help her increase her earnings.

loans.name: Mabkhot

texts.en:
Mabkhot is a 42-year-old married man with nine children, living with his family in one of Haja's areas in Yemen. He is an educated man with a diploma certificate. 

Over time, he was able to save an amount of money and build a small house. That business cost him a lot of money. Unfortunately, he doesn't have the enough money to complete the building and renovating of that house to make it ready for life. As a result, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase iron, steel, and cement to complete the building of the house and to renovate it from the inside.

Mabkhot hopes to make a spacious house for his children to let them live in a better condition.

loans.use: To purchase iron, steel, and cement to complete the building of the house and to renovate it.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is 38 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her seven children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Sakeena is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods, such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil and etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a loan from Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Sakeena is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix the drainage system as soon as possible, in order to continue working on clients in her salon and not lose her income.

loans.name: Solikhoma

texts.en:
Solihoma is a 45-year-old resident of a small district called Yavan. She is married, and her husband is 55 years old. The husband has a small furniture shop where he sells various furniture and appliances. In their marriage they have two children. Their sons are 16 and 19 years old and they are in high school. 

Solihoma was previously engaged in baking cakes to order. She loves to cook and thought that it was her calling in life, but 7 years ago Solihoma understood what she wants to do. She was determined to do business. Now, for the last 7 years, Solihoma has been working in the furniture business with her husband.

Solihoma loves her job and she likes to spend time with her husband. They don't have a big shop and there are not a lot of goods for sale, and Solihoma decided to bring in new goods to sell in order to attract more customers and increase revenue. With such intentions she applied for a loan. 

She hopes for your help and expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and home appliances to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Julia

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene 3 maravillosos hijos que son su principal razón en la vida para salir adelante y por quienes lucha para poder sacarlos adelante, vive en Lima junto a ellos. Por iniciativa propia pudo abrir una bodega, y ofrece diversos productos como abarrotes, productos de uso doméstico, entre otros, ella cree que le está yendo bien por su gran desempeño y dedicación y sobre todo porque es muy amable y trabajadora.
Nancy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá hacer remodelaciones a su casa como reforzar y pintarrajear las paredes, con esto ella espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarle mayor comodidad. Más adelante espera poder terminar de construir toda su casa para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nancy is a very entrepreneurial woman. She has three marvelous children who are her main reason for wanting to get ahead in life and for striving to succeed. She lives with them in Lima. She was able to open a bodega on her own. She sells a variety of goods such as groceries, household products and more. She believes it is doing well because of her great execution and dedication and above all because she is very friendly and hard-working.

Nancy is appreciative of the KIVA lenders because with the support they've provided her she will be able to do some remodeling on her house, such as reinforcing and finishing the walls. With this she hopes to improve quality of life for her family and offer them better comfort. Later on she hopes to be able to complete the construction of her whole house for her family's well-being.

loans.use: to make improvements on her home for better comfort.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman whose face is blurred is 28 years old, and she lives in a high-risk area. She sells clothes for a living as a street vendor, working in different markets. This young woman has regular clients because of the quality of her clothes and good prices. She lives in her own home with her husband and her two children. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes in bulk to be able to continue with her business and to be able to have better earnings.

loans.use: buy more clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business.

Julieta has been in this business for four years. Julieta earns additional income from rice retailing and raising pigs.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy and sell more animals and vetiver in the community.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 36 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Chita has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a bakery.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bales of new clothing for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas trabajan y se ayudan y trabajan en equipo. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, a través de los 50 indicadores de la pobreza.
Elizabeth, una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, tiene  muy buena venta, en especial los fines de semana. Tiene buena demanda ya que se está aproximando la temporada más calurosa del país.
La Elizabeth solicita de este préstamo para la compra de sus productos tales como: gaseosas, cervezas, jugos, etc. entre otros lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas group is its third cycle under the women's communal bank program, where each of them are helping one another and working as a team. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey by means of the 50 poverty indicators. 

Elizabeth, one of the members of this group, sells drinks of all kinds and has very good sales, especially on weekends. She has good demand as the hottest time of the year in the country is approaching. 

Elizabeth is requesting this loan so that she can buy her products such as soft drinks, juices, etc., and other items that will help her make her business plan a reality,  and help her to improve her income.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, beer, juices, etc.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Unidas, se formo en la ciudad de Paraguarí,  está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una ha trabajado incansablemente para poder ir pasando ciclo tras ciclo, y con su trabajo unido lo han logrado.
La Sra. Ludilia es la presidenta del grupo, una persona humilde, y que sueña con un mejor futuro, para ella y para su familia. Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de semillas de: maíz, mandioca, poroto, etc.- y también para preparar la tierra para la siembra. Esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Unidas was formed in the city of Paraguarí. It is in its 9th cycle of the Women's Committee. Each one of them has worked tirelessly to be able to go cycle after cycle and with their work together they have achieved it.

Ludilia is the president of the group. She is a humble person who dreams of a better future for her and for her family. She is asking for this loan to buy corn. manioc, bean and other seeds to prepare for planting. She is very grateful for eh opportunity she is receiving, it will be a big help for her.

loans.use: to buy corn, manioc, bean, and other seeds, etc. to later plant.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna, 55 years old, is a resident of Roxas, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman, and the fish he catches are sold in the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already.  

Because Edna wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for resale at the market. Both she and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to request an earlier loan to buy fishing nets. She has now applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fish for resale. 

Edna hopes that with Paglaum’s help and her husband's patience and diligence she will become a successful vendor and someday own a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is thankful that she was granted a 23,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her loan she was able to recover the loss from her store during the typhoon that hit their area last November 2013. The loan also helped meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 26,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda and rice noodles to increase her store's supplies. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help sustain her family's basic needs and help pay for the schooling of her three children.

Merlita dreams of having a bigger General Store and to have a better life. She aims to give her children the best education and prays that they will always lead a happy and quiet life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is grateful for the financial assistance that was granted to her because she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 28,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Flordeliza still wants to have business expansion and she desires to meet her regular bank savings. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a computer shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy another computer set.

Jenelyn has been in this business for three years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy another computer set

loans.name: Ma. Catherine

texts.en:
Ma. Catherine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Catherine requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from her cafeteria.

In the future, Ma. Catherine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anne Jane

texts.en:
Anne Jane works hard to support her family. Anne Jane is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy meat, vegetables, eggs, etc.

Anne Jane has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Anne Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, eggs, etc

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is 30 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Luna works very hard to provide for them.

Luna runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Luna has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Luna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Xiomara Del Rosario

texts.es:
Xiomara de 25 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica debido a que su familia era numerosa y sus padres no podían darle el estudio completamente, además tenía que viajar hasta la ciudad para llegar a la escuela más cercana; su esposo es agricultor y es quien lleva los granos básicos a la casa. Con ella solo viven su esposo y su hijo.

Xiomara es comerciante, tiene un negocio de venta de frutas de manera ambulante, compra la fruta, la prepara y luego sale a venderla, tiene cerca de 4 años trabajando de la misma manera, empezó con su madre quien le preparaba la mercadería y luego ella salía a venderla. También trabajó haciendo oficios domésticos ajenos y en la venta de ropa.Diariamente recorre cerca de 2 km, desde las 7:00 am hasta las 5:00 am, cundo su esposo no está trabajando la apoya con la preparación de la venta.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ropa, 5 docenas de camisas y 3 docenas de pantalones y con ello variar su actividad económica. Xiomara ir aumentado la inversión en su negocio y obtener las ganancias esperadas, pero por lo pronto quiere estabilidad ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 25 years old, has a life partner and has one 5 year-old son. She has studied up to 9th grade of basic education; this was due to her large family size and the fact that her parents weren't able to finance her entire studies. Furthermore, she had to travel to the city to get to the closest school. Her husband is a farmer and it is him who provides the basic staple foods in their household. She only lives with her husband and her son. 

Xiomara is a vendor, she has a mobile fruit stand. She buys the fruit, prepares it, and then goes out to sell it. She has worked like this for around 4 years, she started with her mother who prepared the merchandise for her and she would then go out to sell it. She has also worked doing other domestic services and selling clothes. She walks around 2 km every day, from 7 am to 5 pm. When her husband isn't working, he helps her to prepare her sales. 

The loan will be used to buy clothes, five dozen shirts and three dozen pairs of pants, and thus vary her economic activity. Xiomara will increase the investment in her business and obtain the expected revenues, but for now she wishes for stability, since it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase five dozen shirts and three dozen pants

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en:
Mary Lou, a 55-year-old married mother of six, has been raising livestock in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Mary Lou is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Chantheng

texts.en: Chantheng is a 22-year-old student at an institute in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Due to a lack of financial support, Chantheng would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees for four years. With this loan, she will graduate successfully with a skill to build her future. In the future, she is going to find a good job and she wants to save some money to own a proper house.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La  Sra. Susana es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 3 hijos, por quienes está luchando para poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella se dedica a la compra-venta de productos varios de manera ambulante, hace 8 años que trabaja en esta actividad, empezó con un pequeño capital, y haciendo su venta en una moto, luego fue creciendo poco a poco y hoy día ya hace reparto en un camión y con una buena clientela.
Este préstamo invirtió para terminar un salón que esta construyendo y que usara para poder tener sus prductos para la venta, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Es una señora muy emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Susana is from the city of Santaní. She has three children for whom she works hard in order to be able to give them a decent life without deprivations. She works buying and selling various products as a mobile vendor. She has held this occupation for 8 years; she started with a small capital base and made her sales from a motorcycle. Then, her business grew bit by bit and today she is distributing her goods in a truck and has a good clientele. 
She will invest this loan to finish a salesroom she is building and which she will use to hold her merchandise and in this manner continue with the work that she has been doing so far. She is a very entrepreneurial woman with a drive to succeed.

loans.use: to finish the construction of a showroom

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Guapa   está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cristina quien se dedica a la venta de jarras forradas, teniendo su propio ingreso, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de jarras y cueros para poder forrarlas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called Kuña Guapa, is receiving its first loan as a women's committee. Everyone is working and helping themselves to move forward. They are currently completing the poverty elimination phase.

One of the members is Cristina, who makes a living by selling wrapped jars so that she can earn her own income. It is also important to note the work of the advisers, who do follow-up work with training and verification that challenges and motivates the women to overcome poverty.

The woman requesting the loan will use the money to purchase jars and cords to cover the jars, which will help her to finalize her business plan, helping her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase jars and cords to cover the jars, which she will sell.

loans.name: La Amistad 2 Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este grupo se unieron para poder trabajar juntas, capacitarse, y por medio de esto poder conocer cuales son sus puntos a mejorar para trabajar mas en ellos.
Todas son muy entusiastas y quieren progresar, donde se destaca la Sra. Myrian , quien vende prendas varias, y a la vez tambien hace tortas que sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una mujer que hace todo para poder salir adelante e ir creciendo. Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas variadas, como así también de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus tortas.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The members of this group came to gather in order to be able to work together, train one another and through this be able to determine where they need to improve so that they can work on them.  They are all very enthusiastic and want to succeed.

Syrian works selling assorted clothing as well as making cakes that she goes out to sell in the streets.  She is a woman who does what ever it takes to get ahead and continue growing.  She is seeking this loan in order to purchase assorted clothing as well as supplies to continue making cakes.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving that will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of clothing and supplies to make cakes.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, están en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, cada una con un trabajo con lo que quieren ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cinthia, ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de bebidas, está trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia, está saliendo adelante por medio de este trabajo digno y humilde.
La señora solicita de este préstamo para la compra de cervezas, gaseosas, vinos; entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
There are 18 women in this group. They are in their first cycle of the women's committee program. Each of them with her work wants to help her family. 

One of the members is Cinthia. Through her continuous effort and hard work and by selling beverages she is working to help her family. She is getting ahead by this humble and dignified work. 

She is asking for this loan to buy beer, soda, wine and more. This will help her to cement her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda, wine and more.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a simple rural woman of Huroson district at the age of 47 years. She has no higher education, because her parents did not have financial opportunity that time. Sanavbar got married early and bore five children. Her children are adults. Sanavbar's husband makes a living providing taxi services, and Sanavbar is the cattle breeder. 

Now one of their sons is a student. He is studying in the first year at the Tajik National University with the Medical and Pharmaceutical Faculty. He chose this profession himself because he wants to help people. And he studies hard. The annual contract for his university education is more than $1,500. 

Sanavbar and her husband have accumulated a little savings, but they still need $1,000. Therefore Sanavbar decided to take a loan. She hopes that they will be supported and they will be able to successfully pay the tuition for their son.

Your help is important to them.

loans.use: to pay the tuition for her son at the university

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en: Tessie, 59, is married with three adult-aged children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. The business helps her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. Her plan is to increase her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She has already taken out loans previously to purchase additional stock and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store to increase sales and inventories.

loans.name: Germán Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Germán Antonio, es padre de seis hijos, y labora como Guarda de Seguridad en una de las universidades de la Ciudad de León, se dedica a esta labor  desde hace un año,  su jornada laboral es  por turnos variados, realiza esa labor para la mantención de sus familia. 

Don Germán Antonio,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizara en la  compra de cerámica y cemento, dando mejor condición a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Germán Antonio is the father of six children. He works as a security guard in one of the universities of the city of León. He has done this work for a year. His work schedule is varied and he does this work to support his family.  

Germán Antonio approached Ceprodel to ask for a loan which he will use to buy ceramic tile and cement to do some home improvement.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tile and cement.

loans.name: Carlos Salvador

texts.es: Carlos tiene 32 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, elabora puertas, balcones, rejas entre otros, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a este negocio y tiene mucha experiencia que le ayuda a mejorar cada día su labor, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, por los precios accesibles pero sobre todo porque siempre realiza el trabajo al gusto del cliente; el solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 32 years old and lives with his wife and their three children.

He has a metal workshop and makes doors, balconies, and gates, among other products. He has been working in this business for 12 years now and has plenty of experience, which helps him to improve his work each day. He is sought after for the quality of his work, affordable prices, and, above all, for always doing the work to his customers' liking. For these reasons, he has many customers.

He is asking INTEGRAL for a loan, which will enable him to purchase iron, metal, tools, and the like, so he can generate a better income.

loans.use: to purchase iron, metal, tools, and the like.

loans.name: Jeondry

texts.en:
Jeondry's transportation services business has been doing well. For over five years, he has been able to support his family and had also bought some house improvements from his income. He had successfully repaid his previous loan, which was used for buying tires.  

He helped his wife in their cosmetic buy-and-sell business and was able to sell products in other villages. He took out a new loan recently to buy more cosmetics and to cover motorcycle repair, in order to sell more cosmetics and offer safe transportation services. In the future, he wants to see his children's success.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and to cover motorcycle repair, in order to sell more cosmetics and offer safe transportation services

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 47 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 5 children. She sells tea leaves and has been in this business for 3 years. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of green tea leaves to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of tea leaves to sell.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to have a successful business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: Adalia

texts.en:
Adalia works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Adalia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, etc., for her food vending business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou, a 59-year-old married mother of two, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has operated a clothing retail business in the Philippines for 20 years.

Marilou has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items such as pants, blouses and curtains to offer for sale. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like pants, blouses and curtains to offer for sale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.  Wilma has been in this business for ten years now.

Wilma has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Wilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen is 26 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Arlen is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Arlen has been in the pig fattening business for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 45 years old and married, with two children. With two children currently in school, Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell, like soy sauce, vinegar, coffee, sugar, juice, and soft drinks.

Nora has been in this business for four years and she sells a variety of items, such as soy sauce, vinegar, coffee, sugar, juice, and soft drinks. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like soy sauce, vinegar, coffee, sugar, juice, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Edna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly works hard to support her family. Sherly is married and has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Sherly requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Sherly has been in this business for 15 years now.

Sherly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 57 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marissa has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Marissa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rizalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rizalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food-vending. Rizalinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit-vending business.

Rizalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is married and she has 5 children. She has been involved in business activities since 2009. She started with her own working capital of $300. 

She is requesting a loan of $800 because she has a kiosk and she wants to have more and additional supplies in her kiosk such as sugar, coffee, milk,  noodles, sardines, cigarettes, lighters, candles, soaps, cooking oils, soy sauce, biscuits, eggs and other things to sell Including soft drinks. 

She is very interested in her business, so she will take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve the management of her business and she wants to increase her future income.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, milk,  noodles, sardines, cigarettes, lighters, candles, soaps, cooking oils, soy sauce, biscuits, eggs and soft drinks.

loans.name: Geyner Emiliano

texts.es:
Su dedicación e inteligencia ha llevado a Geyner a conseguir muchos logros en su vida desde, entre ellos casi culminar sus estudios Administración de Empresas a sus 21 años de edad. Este apasionado agente de ventas desde hace nueve meses, decidió entrar en esta carrera con tan amplio mercado laboral debido a que desde en un inicio le inspiro y se enamoró de esos estudios.
Geyner cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, su mamá como ama de casa y su papá como guarda de seguridad. Además su espíritu emprendedor lo llevó a ganarse una beca de la universidad para estudiar. Sin embargo, solicita de un préstamo para comprar un equipo tecnológico que no cubre su beca y que es importante para realizar sus tareas universitarias sin ningún inconveniente.  Entre sus planes está estudiar inglés y un posgrado en agronegocios.
texts.en:
Geyner’s dedication and intelligence have led him to achieve a lot in his life, including nearly completing his studies in business administration at 21 years old. He hs been a passionate salesman for the past nine months, and decided to enter this career with such a broad labor market because it inspired him from the start and he fell in love with these studies. 

Geyner is supported by his parents: his mother is a housewife and his father is a security guard. Aside from this, his entrepreneurial spirit led him to win a scholarship to college. However, he is requesting a loan to purchase technological equipment that is not covered by his scholarship, but is important to complete his college assignments without any problem. Among his plans are to study English and to earn a post-graduate degree in agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy technological equipment.

loans.name: San Blas 1 Group

texts.es:
Las 16 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas están esforzándose para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo y esfuerzo en conjunto.
La señora Maria es integrante de este grupo, es además la presidenta, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas e insumos para comestibles que ella misma hace y que sale a vender de manera ambulante, es una persona muy trabajadora que se está esforzando.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de bebidas varias e insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus  comidas varias para la venta.
texts.en:
The 16 members of this group pursue different occupations. Each one of them is working hard to be able to help her family through their work and joint efforts. 
Señora Maria is a member of this group, and in addition its president. She sells beverages and uses ingredients to make foods that she sells as a mobile vendor. She is a very hardworking person who is making great efforts. She is requesting this loan to purchase various beverages and ingredients in order to be able to continue making her various foods for sale.

loans.use: to purchase various beverages and ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry esta luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de pobreza, todo esto por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sara, quien ademas es la directora de este grupo, se dedica a la costura, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia, buscando los medios para poder darles una vida sin privaciones, ella se destaca por ser una persona con mucho carisma y ganas de salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones, y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo y que le permitirá poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Katupyry" group is fighting to improve their financial situations through the poverty elimination program. One of the members is Sara who in addition to being the director of the group works as a seamstress by which she helps her family in order to provide them a life without hardships.  She stands out as a very charismatic person who is eager to get ahead.

She is seeking this loan to purchase fabrics and thread so that she can continue making clothing and completing her customers' orders.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving that will allow her to continue with her work.

loans.use: purchase fabrics and thread to make clothing.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas jefas de familia, que decidieron unirse para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Cada una tiene su emprendimiento y se esfuerza en su trabajo, pero una persona que realmente se destaca es la Sra. Daiana, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas de estación, y por medio de ello puede ayudar a su familia, dándoles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella es una mujer muy optimista que siempre busca poder capacitarse y crecer.
Ella pide este préstamo para comprar frutas frescas de estación, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por crecer.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 17 women all of whom are heads of household and decided to join to gather in order to provide their families with everything that they were not able to have themselves.  Each of them has a business and they work hard in them.  However, one of the women who truly stands out is Daiana who works selling fresh seasonal fruit.  Through this work she is able to help her family and give them all that they need to have a dignified life with out hardships.  She is a very optimistic woman who always seeks ways to learn and grow. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase fresh seasonal fruit so that she can continue with her sales and fighting to grow.

loans.use: purchase fresh seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Nora de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 4 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y posee muchos clientes por los buenos precios, Nora esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más frutas y verduras por mayor para obtener mejores ingresos y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nora is 42 years old and she lives in her own house with her mother and her two children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for 4 years, her shop is locate in the main market and she can count on many customers thanks to her fair prices. Nora is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale price, in order to improve her income and reach a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale price.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama mujeres emprendedoras, están en su primer ciclo, todas ellas tienen la mayor predisposición para poder crecer, capacitarse y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
Leticia es una de las integrantes, es vendedora de ropas, y comenta que aunque tiene mucha competencia, lo que hace es por su familia, para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
Ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Emprendedoras" (Entrepreneurial Women).  They are in their first cycle, and they all have a great willingness to grow, learn and improve the living conditions of their families and themselves.  Leticia is one of the members.  She sells clothing and states that although she has a lot of competition, she does it for her family so that she can give her loved ones a dignified life.  

She is seeking this loan in order to purchase assorted clothing so that she can continue with her sales.  She is grateful for this opportunity she is being given, which will be very helpful.

loans.use: purchase assorted clothing.

loans.name: Mahmanazar

texts.en:
The man shown in the photo is Mahmanazar. He is family man aged 42 years. He is married and has children. Mahmanazar lives with his family in Khuroson district near the town of Qurgan-Tyube.

Mahmanazar decided to open his own grocery store. He had already found a premises and made ​​repairs there and put in shelving. It remains left only to buy goods but, for the reason that he does not have enough initial capital, Mahmanazar cannot buy groceries and sees a way out in getting a loan. He will add borrowed money to his capital, and buy groceries with it. Please support Mahmanazar in his endeavours!

loans.use: to purchase food and open a grocery store.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas es un hombre de 61 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de doce años, y su negocio es la construcción.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, constante, buen padre, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes construcciones en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’; una comunidad campesina que agrupa a restaurantes que se especializan en comida típica y donde se elabora la ‘chicha’ (bebida fermentada de maíz).
Tomas es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la venta de comida  y su hijo que estudia en la escuela, toda la familia vive en una casa propia en obra gruesa que cuenta con luz y agua de pozo. Su trabajo es la construcción y lleva en el negocio 23 años, comenzó como ayudante de albañil hasta adquirir experiencia y convertirse en maestro de obra, la ubicación de su trabajo varía de acuerdo a la ubicación de la obra y generalmente es muy lejos de su casa. Durante casi toda su vida viene construyendo su casa, poco a poco y ladrillo a ladrillo; logró construir dos habitaciones una cocina, un baño y lavandería, el siguiente paso es la instalación de agua potable, actualmente recoge agua de un pozo manualmente con un balde atado a una cuerda. Su sueño es ver terminada la construcción de su casa, y desea realizar una inversión en la instalación de agua potable para su cocina, baño y lavandería para darle a su familia una vida segura. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución.
Es por esos motivos que Tomas solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su casa y brindarle un hogar seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 61 year old man. He is married and has a 12 year old son. His business is construction. He is entrepreneurial, decisive, stable, a good father, responsible, and very hardworking. He works in different construction areas in the town of ‘Sacaba’. It is a farming community where there are several restaurants that serve traditional food and where chicha, a fermented corn drink, is made.

Tomas has dark skin, short black hair, is of medium stature, his mother tongue is Quechua and he speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his wife who sells food and his son who goes to school. The whole family lives in their own home which has electricity and well water. He has had his construction business for 23 years. He started as an assistant bricklayer until he acquired experience and became a master builder. His job place is wherever the works are and generally it is far from his home. He has been building his house almost his whole life, little by little and brick by brick. He has been able to build two bedrooms and a kitchen and a laundry room. The next step is potable water. Right now he gets water with a bucket tied to a rope. His dream is to finish construction on his house and he wants to invest in installing potable water for his kitchen, bathroom and laundry to give his family safe life. This is his first loan cycle with the institution. 

That is why Tomas is asking for a loan to install potable water in his house and offer a safe home to his family.

loans.use: to install potable water in his house and offer a safe home to his family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 46 years old, married and has six children. Her spouse is a farmer. Three of her children are still studying. Maria gets income from her retail store. She sells grocery items and wants to continuously offer good merchandise. 

She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, breads, eggs, coffee, sugar and soap to sell in her store. This will help achieve good profits for revolving capital and for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, eggs, coffee, sugar and soap to sell in her store.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en: Raul is 59 years old and from Ilagan City, Isabela. He is married and blessed with five children. The family earns income from their piggery and farming. Even though they are earning they find it difficult to send their son to college. That is why they want to seek PHP 15,000 financial assistance from the KIVA lenders. Their son Rolando is taking up BS Agriculture and he is hopeful that he will finish college and help his parents to improve their life.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Rizalita

texts.en: Rizalita has signed up her membership with PMPC and gained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful that the capital extends to a small time loaner like her. Rizalita is able to turn the tide in her favour and has made promising sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took out a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, noodles,eggs, and sugar to increase her inventory and to be able to generate more income. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, soy sauce, noodles,eggs and sugar to increase her inventory and be able to generate more income.

loans.name: Nevesia

texts.en:
Nevesia is preparing for the next planting season. She wants to prepare well, especially the much needed land and seedbed preparations. She wants to buy a supply of plant fertilizer, for which she has applied for a loan from the Cooperative. 

Nevesia hopes to save enough money for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Jun Mark

texts.en:
Jun Mark is single. He lives with his parents and raises pigs, work that he has done since he was young. He gets up early and goes to the piggery to oversee his pigs before going to work.

Jun Mark is requesting this loan to purchase feeds for his pigs. In the future, he wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to have a stable job. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for his pigs.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia owns and operates a jeepney unit. She has been successful in this business for 12 years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her direct selling business and their farm business.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for the vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 19,000 for the maintenance of the jeepney unit and to buy other materials needed in her business.

In the future, Eufemia wants to buy another unit of jeepney for additional profit and she also desires to help her children finish their studies.  She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to find strength and encouragement from the word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance on her Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Lilybeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lilybeth works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  

Lilybeth is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.

Lilybeth hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 52 years old and married.  She has four children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Elda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elda has been farming rice for 16 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more stylish ready-made women's clothes and accessories to resell to the customers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A loan of $800 is offered to Maria to improve her business. Maria lives in Dili and she is a businesswoman. Most of her daily income is from her store so she is still happy running her business. 

She opened her business in 2010 with her own working capital of $280. She needed to add money to her principal amount to buy additional supplies to keep in her shop, such as detergents, milks,  noodles, candles, cigarettes, eggs, soaps, candies, cooking oils and other things to sell, including both soft drinks and hard drinks. 

It has become her main activity and she is happy to do this work every day. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. With this loan she will be able to continue the management of her business.

loans.use: To buy detergents, milks, noodles, candles, cigarettes, eggs, soaps, candies, cooking oils and other things to sell, including both soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman; she lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Amina operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in his business.
 
With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.
