loans.name: Jean Renauld

texts.en:
For Jean Renauld, proprietor of Croissis Production, gardening is his livelihood. Having been trained in technical agricultural production, the owner of CPA has been doing crops production since 2005. 

Jean Renauld is one of the farmers who strongly believe that agricultural development can improve the social and economic conditions of the rural populations. He invests in agriculture inside of Saint Jean, the area where he has been living since his childhood. 

Thanks to tillage, the proprietor of CPA ensures personal needs and those of his family. He wants to invest more in gardening and continues to supply local products to the population. Hence, he is soliciting a loan to purchase more seeds to sow during the next season.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pay for leasing and operating costs.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.en:
Olinda, a married mother of four, lives in Dili where she has been selling soft drinks since 2013. Olinda started the business with her own working capital of $1000.00. She earns a good income everyday because many people like to purchase her soft drinks, so she is very happy with her business. 

Olinda is now requesting a loan of $800.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She would like to buy more soft drinks to sell such as aqua,  Gresh, Sprite, Coca Cola, Fanta, green tea, etc. She hopes that with this loan, her business will be even more profitable in the future.

loans.use: To buy aqua, Gresh, Sprite, Coca Cola, Fanta, green tea and other soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is an agriculturist, selling vegetables , She is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. And she will used this loan to buy more vegetables in other places, after she buys, she will bring them to the market to sell. She started selling vegetables in 2009 with her own working capital of $300. Now she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more vegetables such as papaya fruit, papaya flowers, leeks, onions and other things to sell. Everyday she sells vegetables because she is earning a good income from it.

loans.use: to buy papaya fruit, papaya flowers, leeks, onions and other things to sell.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is 46 years old ,married and she has two kids.  Arzu has been working in agriculture since she was very young and she loves this activity. Since she was born and raised in a village, she doesn't have a higher education and getting a decent job without an education is very difficult. She works hard every day to earn a living and offer better living conditions for her children. Her husband is a master but he is helping her in this business.

At the moment though, she is having some financial difficulties, which is the reason why she has decided to turn to Aqroinvest Cu for a  financial support. Crop prices are very low right now, so Arzu cannot count on her earnings from her harvest to buy seeds towards a future harvest. For this reason, she has decided to take a loan to buy seeds. She is hoping that Kiva will support her.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Hokima

texts.en:
Hokima is a good, responsive and very hospitable girl. She is 26 years old. She is not married and lives with her sister. Hokima has no higher education, and she makes a living by providing services as a dressmaker. She takes orders for sewing women's clothes. Each day she sews 2 dresses. For today it is her only source of income and she does not want to lose her job. 

Hokima has problems with her sewing machine, and it is hard for her to continue to work with it. She hopes to get a loan to buy a new sewing machine and not lose her source of income. Please, help Hokima because she believes in you.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and not lose her source of income.

loans.name: Luyến

texts.en:
Luyến works in agriculture, farming food.  Luyến has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Luyến is 26 years old and she is married with two children.  She lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Luyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Luyến has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to date.

The main hardship that Luyến faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Luyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Concepción Lorena

texts.es:
La Joven Concepción Lorena, es madre soltera de tres  hijos,  se dedica al comercio desde hace dos años, donde su negocio actual es la venta de granos básicos,  ella inicia a ofertar el producto a su clientela desde las cinco de la mañana y cierra a las nueve de la noche,  realiza esta labor para ayudar a su esposo a los gastos del hogar.   

Concepción , solicita este crédito a Ceprodel  el que utilizara para incrementar su inventario  con productos tales como: pollo, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas, jugos entre otros productos,  lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ventas  logrando  mas ingresos para un  mejor  nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
The young Concepción Lorena is a single mother of three children. She has been working in retail for two years. Her current business sells basic staple goods. She starts offering products to her clients at five in the morning and closes at 9 pm. She does this work to help her partner with the household expenses. 
Concepción requests this loan from Ceprodel and will use it to supplement her inventory with products such as chicken, rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks, and juices, amongst other products. This will allow her to make better sales, and receive more income, to reach a better standard of living for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks and juices

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 22 years old, married, and had a young child. She is a retail store owner while her spouse works as a merchandiser. They both earn income for living. 

She is aspiring to better profits; that is why she is now asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, soap, and shampoo to sell. This will help improve sales capacity, thus giving her additional earnings for her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, soap, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a freezer and a tricycle

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Thoa is 51 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Thoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Thoa faces in her life is not having money to repair the latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Thoa hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 26 years old and a single mother of two children. She runs a barber shop in Kapsabet town and has been in this business for one year. She also supports three members of her family.

She plans to use this loan to buy shaving machines and mirrors, hair shampoo and towels for use in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to support her children by paying for their school fees and providing the basic needs.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to have a successful business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy shaving equipment for use in her business.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is managing her retailing business in order to sustain her family's needs. She wants to provide her family with a safe and comfortable living space. She applied for a loan with PMPC amounting to PHP18,000 to purchase nails, sticks and amakan (bamboo ply) for wall-making. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Mila was very thankful when all her financing needs were supported by PMPC. Someday, she deeply wishes to live a happy and hassle-free life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase nails, sticks and amakan for wall-making to provide a safe and comfortable living space for the family.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Robel

texts.en:
Robel is managing his barbecue stand in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. He mastered the business when he and his wife were in the early years of their marriage. This business has been doing well in supporting the needs of the family. Robel has local customers and will also accept orders for added income. 

Recently, he took out a loan to purchase more kilos of meat, chicken meat, packs of hot dogs and spices for his barbecue stand. He wants to expand his business and would be very happy to open a small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a mother of four children, ages 3, 12, 15 and 17 years. She and her family live in Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells items like soap, bread, noodles, canned goods, and beverages. Her husband is a laborer. 

Arlene has been operating the sari-sari store for a year now. To have additional capital, Arlene is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy more merchandise like sugar, coffee, cereals, toiletries, and canned goods. With a larger variety of items to offer, she hopes to attract more customers and earn a higher yield. She can now purchase good food and continue send her children to school.

Arlene dreams of expanding her sari-sari store for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like sugar, coffee, cereals, toiletries, and canned goods.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet does poultry farming and has been in the business for two years. She is 49 years old,married and together with her spouse has been blessed with six children. 

She plans to use this loan to buy poultry feed and more chicken broilers for rearing. She will use the anticipated profits to buy timber, wire mesh and iron sheets to build a bigger poultry house. 

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid back her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to have a better life and educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and more chicken for rearing.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is very thankful for the 10,000 PHP loan assistance granted to her because she was able to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seed and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresa wants to renovate their house and she also desires to buy a car for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 68 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lilia is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 8 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dianalyn

texts.en:
Dianalyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Dianalyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods like bags, blouses, t-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers.

Dianalyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods like bags, blouses, t-shirts, etc., to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amisa

texts.en:
Amisa is a married woman with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, operating from the market where neighbours and passers-by are potential customers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, needles and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, needles and repair her broken sewing machine.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old, married, and has two school-going children. 

For the past twelve years, she has been in the agricultural business. She raises goats in the Philippines. Josephine is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her goats. She has previously serviced eight loans through NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her goats

loans.name: Alcides Bernardo

texts.es: Alcides Bernardo, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltero,  vive con sus hermanos y padres, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de repuestas originales de buena calidad para hacer la reparación de su vehículo ya que el mismo es de suma importancia para hacer el traslado de los materiales utilizados en los trabajos de la finca. Con esta compra espera poder realizar una buena reparación del vehículo y poder tener los materiales a tiempo en la finca y así los cultivos tendrán su asistencia en su momento requerido. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alcides Bernardo is 21 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents and siblings, who are his biggest priority. With this loan, Alcides will buy the spare parts his needs to repair his vehicle. This vehicle is very important to him because he uses it to carry farm equipment out to the fields. With this purchase, he hopes to repair his vehicle so that he will be able to have his equipment on the farm when he needs it. This will help him to take care of his crops when they need attention. 

This is Alcides' first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has never had any other loans through  national banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered this loan to him with better terms and a much lower interest rate than banks offer.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for work.

loans.name: Justracia

texts.en:
Justracia is 60 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising cattle in the Philippines. Justracia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle.

Justracia has been raising cattle for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Delta

texts.en:
Delta is 59 years old and married with two children.

Delta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Delta has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from a cafeteria and pig fattening.

Delta aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa es viuda y se quedo a cargo de un hijo Ella y su retoño viven en la casa de sus padres en El Alto Vanessa es empleada de un local donde se sacan fotocopias, el negocio ha llamado su atención que quiere un prestamo para pagar un curso de reparación de fotocopiadoras, en el futuro Vanessa espera ser independiente e incluso tener su propia fotocopiadora, ella quiere su ayuda
texts.en: Vanessa is a widow who is raising her son. She and her little one live in her parents' house in El Alto. Vanessa is an employee of a copy store, where she has developed an interest in the business. She is requesting this loan in order to pay to take a course on repairing photocopiers. In the future, Vanessa hopes to be independent and even have her own photocopier. She wants your help.

loans.use: to pay for a course on repairing photocopiers.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, es un grupo nuevo que tiene muchas ganas de poder salir adelante por medio de la ayuda que podrán recibir por medio de las capacitaciones ofrecidas por la fundación paraguaya.
Cada una de ellas es una persona muy trabajadora, una en especial que se destaca es la Sra. Lorena, de profesión manicurista, es muy buena en lo que hace, y es por eso que ya tiene muy buena clientela, a cada persona que atiende queda muy conforme.
Su sueño es poder tener su propio salón, y poder atender a mas clientes, pide este préstamo para poder invertir en su emprendimiento, en la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, alicates, limas, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Trabajadoras “Working Women,” it is a new group that is eager to move forward with the help that they may receive through the training offered by Fundación Paraguaya. 

Every one of them is hard working, one that stands out is Mrs. Lorena, a manicurist, she is very good at her trade, and that is why she has a good clientele. Every person that she works on is very happy. 

Her dream is to have her own salon, and to serve more customers. She is asking for this loan to invest in her job, buying nail polishes, nail polish remover, nail clippers, files and more in order to continue with her work.

loans.use: buy nail polishes, nail polish remover, nail clippers, files and more

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel es dueña de una tienda de barrio, ella esta casada con un electricista  Maribel quiere un credito para comprar mercaderia (refrescos, mantequilla, arroz) para la tienda  Maribel tiene que ayudar en la manutención de dos hijos La familia vive en El Alto, la clienta goza de buena salud y su marido es una persona responsable, esperamos que puedan recibir ayuda por parte de ustedes
texts.en: Maribel runs a corner store. She is married to an electrician. Maribel requests a loan to purchase merchandise (soft drinks, butter, rice) for the store. Maribel needs to help support two children. The family lives in El Alto. She is healthy and her husband is a responsible person. We hope that they will be able to receive help from you.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (soft drinks, butter, rice) for her store

loans.name: Carmen Valentina

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos,  uno de 8 años y un bebé de 3 meses, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en la localidad. 
Doña Carmen es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer con su mercadería más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora su hijo está en la escuela y puede salir con más facilidad ya que solo lleva al más pequeño, ella deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva 3 años en este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y otras prendas de vestir que ella vende, lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos, sus sueños son tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
“Por Un Nuevo Amanecer” (For a New Tomorrow) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.
Here is where Carmen lives. She is 29 years old, she is married and she has and 8-year-old child and a 3-months-old baby. The older child goes to school. Her husband works in a factory of their community.
Carmen is a good mother and a good wife who engages in selling every kind of clothes in order to help paying for her household’s expense. She sells door to door, and she mainly goes out selling her products in the morning, as at this time her son is a school and it is easier for her to leave her house taking only the little one with her. She sells her products on credit and collects money every fortnight. She has been engaging in this activity for 3 years, and this has helped her earning a living for the wellbeing of her family.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy trousers, blouses and other items of clothing that she sells. She has been a member of this Communal Bank for 3 years, and she likes it for the support she receives thanks to the loans. She dreams of having a shop where to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy trousers, blouses and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 100 plastic chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his cosmetics stall to resell.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
This is Felix. He previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase farm inputs needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Felix would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan that he will use to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other tools for maintenance of the farm. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Felix is also involved in processing and selling meat like "longganisa" and he wants to try supplying other products of the like. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of his life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds, and other supplies for his farm.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Catalina is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Catalina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Catalina has requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Catalina has been in this business for 14 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Bernadina

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Bernadina works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns income from selling rice. Bernadina is borrowing 18,500 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more items like rice, canned goods and other groceries for her general store.

Bernadina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 39 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like rice, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 51 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Librada farms coconuts and mangoes in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Librada has been farming coconut and mango for 10 years now, and she has taken six previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Librada would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a retail business selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. Lolita has been in this business for 16 years now.

Lolita has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell.

In the future, Lolita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 38 years old and has four children.  Cristita is married and all of her children are in school.

Cristita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cristita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cristita has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to bolster his capital and buy many cases of beer for resale in order to earn more so as to support his family.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charito is 44 years old and has one child, who is currently in school.

Charito has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients and materials like bamboo sticks, meat, and seasonings for her business.

Charito has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and materials like bamboo sticks, meat, and seasonings for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many different kinds of foods and items

loans.name: Mirima United Farmers Group

texts.en:
Fred is 42 years old. He is a hard-working man who lives in Masindi, Uganda. He does crop-growing, especially maize, for both home consumption and to sell. He started farming, so as to support his family's needs. He has hopes of increasing his crop production. 

Fred is affected by price fluctuations and he wants a loan to weed his garden and pay for labor. He is a member of Mirima United Farmers Group, where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to weed his garden and pay for labor.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is applying for a loan of $800. She has a kiosk and she is a business woman.

She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including aqua (water), noodles, sugar and other things to sell including soft drinks.  She started her business in 2010 with a working capital of $450. She hopes to open a big store in the future, so she will use this loan to improve her business. She is happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy aqua, noodles, Gulan and other things to sell including soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase incense materials to make different types of local incense

loans.name: Mahyoub

texts.en:
Mahyoub is a 29-year-old, married man with only one child, living with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. Mahyoub is a talented and responsible, respected young man. He studied up to Elementary education, but he couldn't complete his study. He started as a tailor with one of the dress-making stores in the capital city. In time, Mahyoub could save good amount of money and opened his own business selling different kinds of furniture in a small store. He started his business many years ago with small capital. He thinks that his business goes well because he loves what he does. He earns good profit from this business. Unfortunately, most of what he earns goes to the cover the expenses of his family.  He wants to face all the demands of his customers but he doesn't have enough money to do. For this reason, Mahyoub applied for a Youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more furniture for his store to resell to the customers.

Mahyoub looks forward to purchasing a vehicle to transport the goods from the merchants to his store or from the store to his clients with his profits.

loans.use: to purchase more furniture for his store for resale for the customers.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hard-working woman, she needs a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell. 

Betty lives in Masindi-Uganda and has got two children to look after. She started a retail shop to earn a living. She desires to educate her children to University level but is challenged by competition that hinders her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Pojoaju Group

texts.es:
“Kuña pojoaju” quiere decir en castellano “Mujeres con manos unidas “están en su Segundo ciclo del comité, además también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una persona que integra este grupo es la Sra. Mercedes, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe seguir esforzando, lo cual solo podrá conseguir a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa. Ella se dedica a las ventas ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida. 
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con bebidas, comestibles, frutas, verduras, fideos, productos a granel, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su microemprendimiento, y luchar por su familia.
texts.en:
"Kuña Pojoaju" means "Women Joining Hands".  They are in their second cycle of the program and they are also participating in the poverty elimination survey.  One of the members of the group is Mercedes who in her survey demonstrated a poverty level within the first category, which means that she must continue striving in order to achieve what can only be reached through effort and continued work, as well as the essential behaviors of a successful woman.  

She works in sales and she has a well-stocked store.  She is seeking a loan in order to stock her business with beverages, groceries, fruits, vegetables, noodles, bulk products and other items to keep her small business going and continue fighting for her family.

loans.use: purchase beverages, groceries, fruit, vegetables, noodles, bulk items and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sadeddin

texts.en:
Sadeddin is 53 year old, married, and has three kids. Sadeddin is a taxi driver but his salary not enough to cover family demands. Because of that, he is raising fruits and vegetables in his own land, then selling them at the local bazaar. From this business his monthly income is 170 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

Sadeddin’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. 

He applied for a 600 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise. This is going to be his first loan, so please support him.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 64-year-old married woman and a mother of eight grown-up children. Zenaida lives with her family in the town of Dulag, Leyte. She earns a living through her hog raising business. Zenaida has raised pigs for more than three years now. 

She wants to improve her business. Because of this, she has requested a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. This loan will help Zenaida in her dreams of a more successful hog raising business.

In the future, she wants to make her hog raising venture more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoo, scissors and other needed tools for her hair salon

loans.name: Glecy

texts.en:
Glecy owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of 19,000 PHP for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of a franchise agreement/permit so she could continue her business operation.

In the future, Glecy wants to buy another tricycle unit for business purposes. She also hopes to give her child a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena sells timber to several carpenters and constructers and has been in this business for 4 years. She is 32 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. Her spouse also provides additional income.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of timber to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also repay the loan.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace brakes and a tire on his motorcycle

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is grateful for the loan assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy spare parts and accessories and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help with her family's personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 11,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to meet the family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta dreams of remodelling their house and she wants her child to finish his studies. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 58 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, chips, etc., to sell.

Clarita has been in this business for seven years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future Clarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, eggs, chips, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ma. Nita

texts.en:
Ma. Nita is 60 years old and married with eight children. With two children still in school, Ma. Nita works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Nita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, beer, soft drinks, coffee, detergent, soap, and shampoo. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

In the future, Ma. Nita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Union Des Femmes Progressistes De Desgrottes (Unio

texts.en:
In the year 2002, Marie Jeanette gathered a group of dedicated women to form UFPD:  Union des Femmes Progressistes de Desgrottes (Union of Progressive Women of Desgrottes). Those women understood their responsibility in the development of their community. 

Therefore, Marie Jeanette encouraged them to launch an agricultural products storage business in 2011. Regular contributions of members were used as capital to start this activity. The leader, along with the team, decided to use profits earned to support the financial activities of the members, particularly the purchase and sale of shrimp. 

Because of its high profitability, Marie Jeanette is seeking a loan to increase the means of vulnerable women inside the association, and to increase shrimp purchases.

loans.use: To invest in buying shrimp from fishermen.

borrowers.first_name: Union Des Femmes Progressistes De Desgrottes (Unio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vetiver bales to resell.

loans.name: Denise

texts.es: Denise es una joven  madre soltera de una hija Ella y su hijo viven en La Paz en la casa de los padres de Denise, la vivienda es propiedad familiar y tiene todos los servicios básicos Denise se gana la vida como comerciante y quiere un prestamo para invertir en la compra de focos navideños al por menor con el fin de conseguir ingresos extras para Denise no recibe ayuda de sus padres, puesto que ellos ya le dan la vivienda pero ella goza de buena salud y el negocio que se ha planteado tiene buenas posibilidades considerando la temporada
texts.en: Denise is a young, single mother of one child.  Her and her child live in La Paz in her parents' home.  The home is owned by the family and has all of the basic utilities.  Denise earns a living as a saleswoman.  She is seeking a loan to purchase Christmas lights with the goal of earning extra income since she does not receive financial help from her parents since they provide her with a home.  She is in good health and her business has a lot of potential because of the season.

loans.use: purchase christmas lights.

loans.name: Elanie

texts.en:
Elanie, 37, is a resident of Dulag, Leyte. She is married and has three children, ages 11, 13, and 15 years. Elanie operates a small store and sells shorts, t-shirts, and ladies' accessories like headbands, bangles, hair clips, and many other items. In addition to that, she also raises and sells hogs. 

Because of very limited capital, Elanie is asking for a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy a greater variety of stocks for the store and pig feed. The loan will allow her to raise and sell more hogs while at the same time filling her store with various stocks that she hopes will bring in higher earnings. With increased profits, Elanie can continue send her children to school and provide them with nutritious meals that are essential as they grow up.

Elanie hopes that, with an additional capital investment, she can continue to earn better profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stocks for her store and pig feed

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is 57 years old and sells tea leaves. She has been in this business for 20 years. She is married and, together with her spouse, has been blessed with 10 children. Her spouse is a farmer who also provides additional family income.

Rosaline plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of tea leaves to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of tea leaves to sell.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to have a successful business and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of tea leaves.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been selling fruits, vegetables, fish, and meat products for years, and she earns well from this business. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She and her spouse work hard with the determination to have a better income in order to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Alma would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables. With the requested PHP 17,000, she could expand her inventory. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Alma hopes to grow and expand her business so she can give her children a good and quality education. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Huấn

texts.en:
Huấn works in agriculture farming food. She is 36 years old, and she is married with 2 children.

Huấn lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province in Vietnam. Huấn has been involved in farming for more than 10 years.

In 2013, Huấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Huấn has already successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Huấn faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business's profit, Huấn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 18 years old and is 4th of 7 children in her family. Her mother, Helen, supports the family through her copra retail business in the Philippines.

Gladys is studying Programming NC IV and is currently in the 2nd year of this 2-year course. She is borrowing PHP 7,300 to pay for tuition fees for the 2nd semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

When she graduates, Gladys plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 5 hijos de 6 años de edad, 12 años de edad, 13 años de edad, 15 años de edad y 18 años de edad, 3 de ellos están estudiando, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela pero se las a arreglado para iniciar su propio negocio, su pareja es agricultor empleado de gobierno. Con ella viven solo su pareja y sus hijos y solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

María es comerciante, tiene 8 años de administrar una pequeña tienda de donde obtiene lo suficiente para cubrir algunos gastos de la casa y el estudio de sus 3 hijos; además de su tienda, cuenta con una venta de bocadillos típicos como yuca fritan pasteles de carne y papas, papas fritas, enchiladas y demás.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar golosinas, bebidas, arroz, azúcar , granos básicos y demás para abastecer el inventario de la tienda y también comprar leña, harina de maíz papas y demás para seguir elaborando los bocadillos y mantener estable las ventas de sus negocios.

Con esto María espera prosperar para sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarle el estudio completo por lo menos a los que están estudiando.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old, married and have five children ages 6, 12, 13, 15 and 18.  Three of her children attend school.  She did not have the chance to go to school but she managed to start her own business.  Her husband is a farmer who is employed by the government.  Only her husband and her children live with her, and only her children are dependent of her.  María is a saleswoman and she has eight years of experience running a small store that allows her to earn enough to cover some of her household expenses and the education of her three children.  In addition to her store, she also sells traditional snacks like fried yucca, meat and potato pies, french fries, enchiladas and other items. 

The loan will be used to purchase snacks, beverages, rice, sugar, basic grains and other products to stock her store.  She will also purchase firewood, corn flour, potatoes and other ingredients to continue making her snacks and keep her businesses stable.  With this, María hopes to succeed so that she can get her children ahead and at least provide them with a complete education.

loans.use: purchase snacks, sugar, basic grains and other items for her business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is single and has a business  raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Milagros has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

In the future, Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Víctor Hugo

texts.es: Víctor Hugo, tiene la edad  de 40 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo tanto del cultivo como la cosecha, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo de la variedad inverniz para realizar resiembra y asi poder mejorar la dencidad de plantas por área y de esta manera aumentar la producción y también la calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de este cultivo. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Victor Hugo, 40, says his wife and two children are his top priority.  He is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to buy fertilizer and other supplies for growing coffee.  He will use another part of the loan to buy a variety of winter copperwood that will complement and strengthen his existing planting and the rest to pay the farm laborers who help him with the business.  He wants to make the most of the excellent land and climate here to maximize his yields and says that he has many years of experience behind him to succeed.  The loan will provide the funds he needs to buy the best inputs and get the best result.  Victor Hugo will use the income he earns from selling his crop to support his family and grow his business.  He's never borrowed from a state bank and this is his first FUDECOSUR loan.  He likes FUDECOSUR, he says, because its application process is simple and its interest rates are reasonable.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Monica has been in this business for 5 years now.

Monica has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

In the future, Monica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Saratu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saratu can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Saratu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees and food and farm loan repayments by eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Kargo village. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yakubu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees and food and farm loan repayments by eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Josefa esta casda desde hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos Ella y su familia viven en una casa de adobe que es de su propiedad, la casa tiene solamente luz y agua  JOsefa se dedica a la agricultura y a la produccion de leche y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera que le permita incrementar su producción, el esposo de Josefa es muy colaborador le ayuda en el cuidado del ganada y en la agricultura, la pareja produce cebollas pero en poca escala JOsefa goza de buena salud y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Josefa has been married for 20 years and has four children. She and her family live in an adobe house, which they own. The house has only electricity and water services.

Josefa makes a living working in agriculture and milk production. She is requesting a loan to buy a dairy cow, which will enable her to increase her production.

Josefa's husband is very cooperative. He helps her to take care of the cattle and with the farming. The couple grow onions, but on a small scale.

Josefa is in good health and needs your help.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, which will enable her to increase her milk production.

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.es: Jacobo es un carpintero que vive en El Alto, Jacobo ha estado trabajando en la elaboración de ataudes de diversos tamaños y costos, se ha convertido en una buena actividad debido a la constante demanda y a la facilidad con la que puede vender este producto Jacobo quiere un prestamo para comprar mayor cantidad de madera Jacobo vive y trabaja en la casa de sus padres, espera poder tener su propio taller en el futuro
texts.en: Jacobo lives in El Alto.  He is a carpenter and operates a business making and selling coffins.  He makes different sizes of coffins and says that demand for them is strong.  Jacobo is applying for a loan that he will use to buy bulk supplies of wood for making coffins.  He adds that he lives with his parents now and works from a space in their house, but would like to have a shop of his own one day.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of wood for his coffin-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to sell beverages and plant fruit trees in her garden.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio es un hombre soltero y sin hijos que trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada pero tambien tiene habilidades de carpinteria, las cuales aprovecha en su tiempo libre para ayudar en la carpinteria de su padre Julio quiere un prestamo para comprar madera que le sirva para elaborar todo tipo de muebles. Julio vive con su padre en la ciudad de El Alto, goza de buena salud y espera poder mejorar sus ingresos con su ayuda
texts.en: Julio is single and has no children.  He has a paid job, but does carpentry work on the side.  He learned carpentry from his father and is applying for a loan that he will use to buy supplies of wood for making furniture.  Julio lives with his father in El Alto.  He is in good health and says your loans will help him to grow his income.

loans.use: to buy supplies of wood for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorbike and pay tuition fees for his sons

loans.name: Toshbiby

texts.en:
Toshbiby was born in 1966. She is a hardworking woman from north Tajikistan. She lives in the country and there is a great opportunity to develop an animal husbandry business there. 

Toshbiby, like many local people, has been busy with animal husbandry. She has been raising cows and sheep for 13 years. She buys cattle, feeds them for some months, and then sells them in a local market. Her husband helps her with managing the business. Also, their elder son sends money from Russia, where he works. 

Toshbiby and her family live in an old house. Little by little, they are building a new house for their children and their families. Toshbiby has a small income so she has been unable to finish building the house for some years now. She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy building materials such as wood, windows, doors, etc. She awaits your mercy and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood, windows, doors, etc.

loans.name: Omina

texts.en:
Omina is 61 years old, and she is married. She is a very enterprising woman. She constantly struggles to offer good living conditions for her four children who are the motor of her life. 

For more than 39 years, Omina has worked as a teacher. She works in a local school and has a great experience teaching. Her honesty, responsibility and punctuality have been the reasons for her job promotion, and she believes she is doing well because she always gives the best of herself. 

Omina is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their support, she will be able to make improvements to her house, such as painting the walls and finishing building it. In this way, she and her family will have a better quality of life. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy paints, wallpaper, cement, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy paint, wallpaper, cement, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 30 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. 

Eunice is a farmer and has been in the farming business for three years. Besides farming as her primary activity, Eunice also sells clothes and it has been profitable. 

Eunice will be using this loan to buy stock of clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is thankful that she was granted a 35,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise like sportswear and children's wear. Through her earnings she is able to support herself and her family.

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy more sportswear and children's wear. Her store is known for selling quality but reasonably priced clothes so people prefer to buy from her. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings to help her meet her family's everyday needs. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.  

Ruby dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise like sportswear and children's wear.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 29 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with 3 children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for 2 years.

Norah plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful in life.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 55 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Melodia has a lamination business in the Philippines. Melodia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her lamination business.

Melodia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Melodia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her lamination business.

loans.name: Dexyrel

texts.en:
Dexyrel is 31 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Dexyrel works very hard to provide for them.

Dexyrel runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned goods, and other groceries. She hasrequested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Dexyrel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Salvadora Del Transito

texts.es:
Salvadora de 35 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudio porque sus padres no creían conveniente a que ella estudiara y mejor le enseñaron a trabajar para que ayudara con los gastos del hogar.

Esta acompañada y es madre de 7 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 11, 9, 6 y un año de edad, de los cuales solo cuatro viven con ella. Su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura mientras que Salvadora se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace mas de un año, trabajo que lo aprendió de su madre quien toda la vida se ha dedicado a esto y también lo aprendió para ayudar económicamente a su esposo para darle a sus hijos el estudio y una mejor calidad de vida, Salvadora no viaja porque el negocio lo tiene en su casa, su horario es de 10:00 am a 1:00 pm todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar maíz, cal y bastante leña, para elaborar mas tortillas y poder satisfacer a todos lo clientes de la comunidad, así ella tendrá mas ingresos y podrá aportar un poco mas para los gastos.

El sueño de Salvadora es mejorar el negocio de tortillas, que sus hijos estudien mucho para que tengan un mejor futuro y pagar el crédito sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en: Salvadora is 35 years old and is a home-maker. She did not go to school because her parents did not think that it was useful for her to study, and preferred to teach her to work so that she could help with the household expenses. She lives with her partner and is the mother of 7 children, whose ages are 20, 18, 16, 11, 9, 6, and 1. Only four of them live with her. Her partner works in agriculture, while Salvadora has worked for more than a year selling tortillas. She learned this work from her mother, who has done it all of her life, so that she can help her husband financially and pay for her children to study and to have a better quality of life. Salvadora does not travel to work, as she works from her home. She works from 10:00 am to 1:00 pm every day. The loan that she is requesting is to buy corn, lime, and enough firewood to be able to make enough tortillas for all of her customers in the community. In this way she will have more income, and be able to pay more of the bills. Salvadora's dream is to improve her tortilla business, to enable her children can study so that they can have a better future, and to repay her loan without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and enough firewood to be able to make enough tortillas for all of her customers in the community.

loans.name: Haladu

texts.en:
Haladu is a maize farmer from Katsalle village. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haladu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haladu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Haladu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees and food and farm loan repayments by eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es:
Margarito de 62 años de edad, es un señor muy emprendedor, ya que se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de producto como carnes, lácteos y hortalizas. Actualmente vive solo en su casa y aunque todos los días visita a su esposa y a sus 2 hijos para ayudarles en lo que necesiten.

 Margarito se ha dedicado al comercio desde muy pequeño, ya que sus padres siempre se dedicaron a este rubro, dependiendo de la época así es como trabaja, ya que en el verano comercializa carne de vaca, cerdo y de cabra, ya en el invierno comercializa Frijoles frescos y elotes. Siempre ha tenido la oportunidad de ayudar a su familia a través de sus ingresos y es por eso que en cada época se moviliza para comprar productos y venderlos a un mejor precio.

El préstamo será utilizado para cancelar unas deudas, ya que le surgió una necesidad de inversión en productos de comercio y no pudo cancelar el crédito anterior. Se le ayudara  a refinanciar, ya que dos cuotas son muy difíciles de conseguir y con una sola seria lo ideal.

 Margarito quiere extender un poco mas su mercado, ya que el negocio es muy rentable y quiere que le genere un poco mas.
texts.en:
Margarito is 62 years old. He is an entrepreneurial man who has experience in all kinds of businesses such as selling meat, dairy products, and vegetables. Currently, he lives alone in his house although every day he visits his wife and two children to help them with whatever they need. 

Margarito has been working since he was very young. His parents make a living in this way, working in the appropriate manner for the season. In the summer, Margarito sells beef, pork, and goat meat. In the winter he sells beans, juices, and corn. Margarito has always had the opportunity to help his family through his earnings. For this reason, he seeks out products to then sell at better prices each season.

The loan that Margarito is requesting will be used to pay off some debt that he acquired while increasing his inventory last season. He was not able to pay it off from his profits. This loan will help him to refinance because owing two payments is difficult, but consolidating them into one loan will be ideal for him. 

Margarito wants to expand his market because his business is profitable and he hopes to increase his income a little more.

loans.use: to pay off debt that he owes.

loans.name: Meta

texts.en:
Meta is a 24-year-old student in his third year. His major is Rural Development. 

Due to a shortage of financial support, Meta would like to request a loan to pay his university fees for his third and fourth year. This loan will help him graduate successfully. 

For his future job, he wants to work for any private or public institution.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Doña Rosibel esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le ha brindado en este tercer crédito que le están dando. ella tiene construida parte de la vivienda , pero en esta ocasión necesita comprar materiales para la instalación de Cerámica ella tiene la cerámica pero le falta, cemento, arena, Piedrin, Bondex. gracias a este crédito su vivienda dará mejor presentación y tendrá mayor higiene para el bienestar de sus hijos
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosibel is very thankful for the support Kiva and Afodenic have provided her with on this third loan that they are giving her. 

She has part of her house built, but on this occasion she needs to buy materials for the installation of the ceramic tiles. She has the tiles but is missing cement, sand, Piedrin, Bondex. Due to this loan her house will have a better appearance and it would be a benefit  for her children.

loans.use: to buy the materials for the installation of ceramic tiles at her home

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda, a teacher in her community, had a motorcycle transportation business to provide additional income for her family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for vehicle repair. 

With the income she generated, Belinda has started another business, growing and selling flowers in her community. Taking care of flowers was her hobby, and she decided to make it a business. Belinda recently took a new loan to buy more pots and assorted flower seedlings to expand her flower gardening. Her future plan is to make some home improvements to provide a safe and comfortable living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more pots and assorted flower seedlings

loans.name: Michael Antonio

texts.es:
Michael es un joven muy emprendedor, responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por iniciativa propia empezó su negocio de venta de ropa de manera ambulante en su ciudad natal, Lima. Por la falta de recursos económicos en su casa no pudo estudiar una profesión, por ello empezó a trabajar desde abajo y hoy cree que le está yendo bien por que siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y lucha para poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Michael está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar ropa de temporada para poder implementar su negocio, de esta manera sus ventas mejorarán y más adelante espera tener una casa propia para mayor comodidad de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Michael is an entrepreneurial young man. He is responsible and wants to get ahead. By his own initiative, he opened a business selling clothing in an ambulatory manner in the city where he was born: Lima. Due to financial hardship, Michael was not able to study a profession. He began working early and believes that it is going well for him because of the dedication he shows each day as he fights to pull himself and his family ahead. 

Michael is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this loan will help him to buy seasonal clothing for his business. This will help him to increase his earnings and eventually he will buy his own house so that his loved ones will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy clothing to improve his business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Teresita has a bicycle taxi business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy an additional trisikad.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (bicycle taxi).

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is 43 years old and married with eight children. Six of her children are in school; she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Marietta has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Marietta requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Marietta has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Cristela

texts.es: Cristela aprovechará el fin de año, para incrementar sus inventarios, ella y su esposo conocen muy bien su tienda pues él antes trabajaba en una de ellas como empleado. Hace 5 años decidieron iniciar su propio negocio y generar ingresos de manera autónoma. Hoy su meta es lograr tener un local de su propiedad y comprar si vivienda para aumentar el bienestar de sus hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 5 y 14 años. Arroz aceite, café, azúcar, y en general productos de la canasta familiar en porciones , pesos y medidas pequeñas, es lo que vende  a los vecinos de su barrio esta pareja, trabajando diariamente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, todo esto con el fin de fidelizar sus clientes existentes y aumentar el nuúmero de potenciales compradores. En la actualidad  Cristela está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, ranchos y refrescos, con esta inversión su negocio mejorará, porque incrementará sus inventarios en una temporada tan comercial como navidades y año nuevo, en la que venderá mucho mas que de costumbre y así mismo ganará dinero.
texts.en:
Cristela is taking advantage of the end of the year to increase her inventory. She and her husband are very familiar with this business since she previously worked at one as an employee. Five years ago, she decided to start her own business so that she could generate income on her own. Today her goals are to have a storefront of her own and to purchase a home so that she can improve the welfare of her children, who are ages 5 and 14. Rice, oil, coffee, sugar, and other general household products are portioned by weight into small sizes and then sold to her neighbors in the area.

This couple works each day from 6:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. They do all of this in order to maintain the loyalty of their existing customers and to increase the number of potential buyers. Cristela is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy food products, snacks, and soft drinks. Her business will improve with this investment because she will have seasonal inventory for Christmas and New Years. As a result, she will be able to sell more than usual and also earn more money.

loans.use: to buy food products, snacks, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Aty Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Aty Pyahu está formado por  17 integrantes, están iniciando el 1° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delmira, quien en la encuesta de eliminación que se le practicó esta en el nivel 3. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando sus ingresos ya que mediante el préstamo podrá ampliar su negocio  y diversificar los productos que  vende (calzados, joyas, perfumes). Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y emprendedora.
texts.en:
The group “Aty Pyahu” consists of 17 members. They are starting their first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of them are working and helping one another so that they can move forward.

One of the members is Sra. Delmira. Her latest poverty elimination survey indicated that she is at a Stage 3 level. Through her effort and continuous work, and by applying the vital behaviors of a successful woman, Delmira will be able to improve her earnings. With this loan, she will be able to expand her business and diversify the products that she sells (shoes, jewelry, and perfumes). Delmira is a self-sacrificing and enterprising individual.

loans.use: to buy shoes, jewelry, and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Caledonia Corazon Group

texts.es: ELIZABETH de 32  años de edad  madre de  1 hijo y convive con su pareja,ELIZABETH tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza   ya hace un 1 año. ELIZABETH  día a día va saliendo adelante con la ayuda de su pareja para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia, En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  ELIZABETH  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. ELIZABETH se le distingue por su blusa crema, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old. She has a son and they live with her husband. Elizabeth owns a small business through which she has sold beauty products for the last year. Every day she goes out to help her husband cover their household expenses so that they can have a better quality of life. In the future, Elizabeth would like to have her own store front from which to sell her products so that she can increase her earnings. 

Elizabeth will invest this loan to buy more products for her business (cosmetics). This will help her meet her customers' needs and help her get ahead. Elizabeth and her other group members are grateful to Kiva for the loan offered to them and for the trust that is being put in them. Elizabeth is shown above in the cream colored blouse. She promises to achieve all of her proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Vania

texts.es: Vania es soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive con sus abuelos en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a la familia, afortunadamente, los integrantes de la familia viven comodamente. Vania trabaja como anfitriona de un bus municipal implementado en 2014 conocido como PUMA Katari. Vania cobra y recibe los pasajes de los que suben al bus, evitando de esa manera que el chofer se distraiga mientras maneja Vania solicita un credito para tratamiento medico para su abuela, es que ella tuvo un accidente Vania es el unico apoyo para sus abuelos, por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Vania is not married and does not have children. She lives with her grandparents in La Paz in a house made of brick and cement that belongs to her family. Fortunately, their family lives comfortably. Vania works as a hostess for a new (2014) city bus called PUMA Katari. Vania charges and welcomes the bus passengers so that the driver is not distracted while he drives. Vania is requesting a loan to pay for medical treatment for her grandmother, who had an accident. She is the only financial support her grandparents have. For this reason, she needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for her grandmother who had an accident.

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
El socio Crisologo  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un bazar. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Crisologo still works selling clothes. He sells pants, blouses and polo shirts. He has had this business for several years and it has been going very well. 

His dream is to have a stationary shop. He is requesting this loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.

He is very happy with this loan and promises to comply with the payment of his installments.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
