La socia Celestina se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Celestina continues working at her grocery store and sells staple items such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m.  She has been doing this for 5 years and it has been going very well for her.

Celestina's dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is asking for a loan so that she can buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She is happy to be receiving this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and crackers.

loans.name: Thơm

texts.en:
Thơm is 26 years old and she is married with three children. Thơm lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Thơm works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Thơm has been involved in this business for five years.

In 2012, Thơm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thơm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Thơm is not having an hygienic latrine and water tank. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a latrine and water tank.

With her business profit, Thơm hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a latrine and water tank.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 62-year-old, married, hard-working woman. She has cattle that provide her with milk to sell and she is able to get income for the sustainability of her family. Norah also grows crops, to get more income for her children since cows, alone, cannot sustain her family. Although she is a hard-working woman, droughts are affecting her business, leading to less proceeds from milk production and less earnings.

Norah intends to use the loan to buy pesticide to spray her cows.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to spray her cows.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos de 40 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 12 años de edad, 9 años de edad, 6 años de edad y todos están estudiando. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido a que la escuela más cercana estaba a aproximadamente a  unos 5 km de su casa por lo que sus padres optaron mejor por enseñarle  trabajar. Solo sus hijos viven con ella y dependen totalmente de ella.

Santos es comerciante, tiene un chalet en la escuela de la comunidad con el que inicio este año, vende pupusas, café, golosinas, bebidas y más, en su casa tiene una tienda en la que oferta artículos de primera necesidad. Santos le paga a alguien para que le ayude con el chalet en la escuela, mientras ella está pendiente de la tienda en su casa. Su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 4:00pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción como madera y tejas para reparar el techo de su casa, además pagara los costos de la mano de obra, además una parte será invertida en el chalet y la tienda comprando mercadería para abastecer el inventario.

Santo espera mantener estable su negocio y que la inversión le dé buenos resultados para salir de su compromiso y trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Santos, 40, is a single mother with 3 children, ranging in age from 6- to 12-years old.  All three children are in school.  Santos never had a chance to study because the closest school was too far away and her parents decided that she should learn a practical skill instead.  Santos is now the sole provider for her own children and her businesses support the family.

Santos has a kiosk in a local school where she sells drinks, snacks, etc.  She also has a small shop in her house where she sells the everyday products that her customers buy.  She pays a worker to run the school kiosk while she herself runs her shop.  She normally works from 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m.  

Santos will use part of the loan to pay for labor and materials--wood and tile, for example--to repair her roof.  She will use the rest of the loan to stock her kiosk and store with the products that she sells.

Santos expects to earn a steady income from her business that will allow her to both repay your loans and fund her future needs for capital.

loans.use: to pay for labor and materials for necessary roof repair.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 21 years old and a single mother of one child. She sells milk and vegetables and has been running this business for the past four years. She also supports four members of her family.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stocks of milk and vegetables to sell in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees as well as to repay the loan.

This is Eunice's second loan from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan well. Her future hopes are to grow her business and to be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of milk and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Jorge is a widower and lives with his two children , he works in a mechanic shop and he suffers from cataracts in the eyes.  This eye problem is affecting his vision for quite some time, he has been using glasses for a very long time and now it has become uncomfortable because he cannot perform his job duties.  he couldn't do a surgery and treatment in the past due to economic reasons.

loans.use: to have an eye surgery

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en:
Saodat is a kind and industrious woman. She received her medical education, thanks to the support of her parents. 

For the last 5 years, Saodat has worked in a kindergarden as a nurse. She likes her job and does it with pleasure because she loves little children. Saodat is one of the best workers, and her colleagues know her to be hardworking and smart. 

Saodat is married to a kind man. They have 3 children for whom she and her husband try to provide a high quality education. 

Saodat now needs the financial support of Kiva lenders because her mother is ill and she must take pills daily. Saodat is requesting a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy medicine for her mother's medical treatment.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the treatment of her mother.

loans.name: Hatunchaskas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HATUNCHASKAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila ella es casada y tiene 58 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de  artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia vende diferentes tejidos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de carpintería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our members belong to the HATUNCHASKAS community bank in Cusco.

Our featured member, Sra. Lucila, is 58-years old and married with 3 children.  She operates a crafts business selling hand-made blankets and other textiles.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She has operated the business for 8 years and says that she is happy with her progress.  She would like to grow the business, she adds, and is applying for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise that she will resell.  

The other members of the community bank have a range of businesses: crafts sales, clothing sales, grocery sales, carpentry services, etc.  

Sra. Lucila is grateful for this form of borrowing and is committed to repaying your loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de helados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tienes varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los helados. La socia solicita el crédito insumos para preparar los helados como azúcar y frutas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Karina is still working at her ice cream stall. She works from 8 am to 5 pm. She's had the business for several years now and all is going well. Her dream is to own a store where she can sell the ice cream. Now she is seeking a loan to buy ingredients such as sugar and fruit.

Karina is very happy to have this opportunity to get a loan and promises to pay it back.

loans.use: Buy sugar and fruit, ingredients for icecream

loans.name: Gái

texts.en:
Mrs. Gái is 52 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Gái works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. Gái has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

In 2012, Gái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Gái has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Gái faces in her life is not having an hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Gái hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

Jovita has been in this business for five years. Jovita earns more income from raising pigs.

Jovita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Jovita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una joven madre soltera de dos hijos Ella vive con sus padres en La Paz en una modesta casa de adobe que le pertenece a su familia Silvia tiene dos ocupaciones: mensajera de una empresa publica  y lavandera en sus ratos libres Pero ella ha visto que necesita tomar un curso de capacitación para acceder a mejores empleos por eso quiere un credito para pagar un curso de computación Silvia es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Silvia is a young single mother of two children. She lives with her parents in La Paz, in a modest adobe house, which belongs to her family.

Silvia has two jobs: she works as a messenger for a public company and as a laundress in her spare time. However, she has realized that in order to get access to better jobs, she needs to take a training course. For this reason, she wants a loan to pay for a computer course.

Silvia is the only source of income in her home, and this is why she needs your help.

loans.use: to pay for a computer course.

loans.name: Miriam Esmeralda

texts.es: Miriam de 53 años de edad posee un comedor y venta de pupusas ubicado en su lugar de habitación desde hace 15 años, posee mucho clientes de los alrededores de la colonia, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo va saliendo adelante con los gastos que se le presentan, vive en casa propia con su hijo, Miriam esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar materia prima como maíz, quesillo, carne, pollo, verduras, refrescos, frutas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Miriam, age 53, runs a diner and sells pupusas (a traditional Salvadorean savory pastry) out of a room in her home. She has fifteen years of experience in the business and has a lot of customers from around the neighborhood. With what she earns from her business, she is able to make ends meet and get ahead. She lives in her own home with her son. Miriam is requesting this loan to buy raw ingredients like corn, cheese, beef, chicken, vegetables, soft drinks, fruit, and more. This will help her continue working and earn greater income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make and sell traditional pastries

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es: Cecilia  de 51 años de edad soltera y sin  hijos, Cecilia se dedica ya hace 2  años a la venta de productos de limpieza  en un pequeño  puesto todos los días, nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes lo cual a generando ingresos  para cubrir los gastos de su casa, Cecilia   En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos de limpieza  y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en ampliar su negocio de productos de limpieza y comprar mas productos(escobas,haces,etc )así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez Cecilia se le observa en la foto con una chompa de color marrón lleva un bolso sobre el hombro, se despide con un abraso a Kiva y   diciéndoles que cumplirá todas su metas propuestas.
texts.en: Cecilia is 51 years old and is single with no children. She has worked for more than 2 years selling cleaning products from a small stall every day. She says that she has developed loyal customers, which generates income for her household. In future, Cecilia would like to have a store to sell her products from and obtain more income. With the loan she will invest in expanding her line of cleaning products and buying more products, such as brooms, in order to increase her income. Cecilia is seen in the photo wearing a brown sweater and carrying a bag under her arm. She says goodbye to Kiva with a hug, saying that she will fulfill all of her goals.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en:
Dalmacia, a hard-working mother who was out in the streets to sell food snacks like puto cheese and rice cakes for some money, is very diligent and she works twice as hard as she should. She is a widow from Lopez Jaena. 

Dalmacia has applied for membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she appreciates the programs and services of the Coop. 

Dalmacia is in need of additional capital to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cakes because she wants to display her food snacks in any canteen and eatery in the area to generate more income. She asked for financial assistance from PMPC, in the amount of PHP 10,000, and she is thankful for the financing of her capital needs. 

In addition, Dalmacia wants to expand her business and to build good business management for her loyal customers. With her extra income, she deeply wishes to provide her family with a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients to increase her production of puto cheese and rice cakes.

loans.name: John Loyd

texts.en:
John Loyd is 18 years old and from Anao, Tarlac. He is studying Electronics at St. Paul College Foundation. 

John Loyd's father is a farmer while his mother is a housewife. What his father earns is not enough to send John Loyd to college, especially because he has 5 siblings. 

In order to be able to study, John Loyd is requesting 10,000 PHP in financial assistance from Kiva lenders. 

John Loyd wants to finish college so he can help his family and, in particular, help send his siblings to college.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Mirian Carolina

texts.es: Mirian tiene 22 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Mirian se dedica a la venta de variedad de joyería de acero desde hace mucho tiempo.  Con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos por medio de la venta de joyería a tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de joyería de acero como: pulseras, aretes, anillos, cadenas, dijes, etc. Además, desea invertir en la compra de una vitrina para dar mejor presentación a sus productos. Espera poder contar con este crédito y de esta forma lograr mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirian is 22 years old and she lives in her own home with her family. Mirian has been selling a variety of steel jewellery for a while now. 

She hopes to increase her income by selling jewellery and she has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI to buy a variety of steel jewellery such as: bracelets, earrings, rings, chains, pendants, etc. In addition, she hopes to buy a display case to better showcase her products. She hopes she can count on this loan to be able to improve her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy: bracelets, earrings, rings, chains, pendants, and a display case.

loans.name: Eduardo Jesus

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, desde hace varios años trabaja como empleado de chatarrería en su ciudad natal. Parcona. Lamentablemente por no tener una buena economía en su casa no pudo estudiar una profesión, por eso tuvo que buscar la manera de poder apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y a temprana edad ya estaba buscando. Es un hijo ejemplar, no le importa sacrificarse todo para que su familia viva bien.
Eduardo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un juego de dormitorio para su casa, de esta manera podrá tener noches más tranquilas y dormir mejor porque el colchón que tiene ya está muy deteriorado y es un poco incómodo, por lo cual sus noches no son muy buenas. Con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y más adelante podrá abrir su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a young man with a great desire to succeed.  For the past few years he has been working at a scrap yard in his native city, Parcona.  Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources in his household, he wasn't able to study for a degree.  He had to look for a way to help his parents out with household expenses so by a very young age he had already begun looking for work.  He is a model son and it doesn't make any difference to him that he had to sacrifice everything so he family could live well.  

Eduardo really appreciates Kiva lenders because with their support he'll be able to buy a bedroom set for his house. That way he'll be able to have more peaceful nights and sleep better; the mattress he has is dilapidated and kind of uncomfortable so his nights aren't so great.  Now he'll be able to improve his quality of life and down the line open his own business.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom set to furnish his house.

loans.name: Elbert

texts.en:
In 2012, Elbert learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. He tried his luck doing a business focusing on his farming activities at his young age. He feels he owes his fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used as capital. 

Elbert borrowed another amount to pay for a water pump for his flower garden. This will help give his farming income a big boost. 

Elbert looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others through sharing with them his technical methods in flower gardening.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump for his flower garden

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 55 years old with six children. Alicia personally sells the catch from her fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

Since Alicia became a member of Paglaum MPC almost three years ago, she has been a member in good standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 10,000 for the purchase of new nets. 

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. Alicia already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbours so that she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. 

In the future, Alicia dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets to increase her fish catch

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, a persevering mother, requests a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos and a variety of fruit to sell. 

This way, Rosa will be able to sell more products, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos and a variety of fruit to sell.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 9 años y 3 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestido, blusas, pantalones, etc. Espera poder contar con este crédito y así poder comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir que le permita aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en: María is 32 years old, and she lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children aged 9 and 3. María is a street vendor, and she has been selling clothes door to door for many years. As this activity is her main source of income, she has decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest it in the purchase of more items of clothing such as skirts, dresses, blouses and trousers. She hopes to receive this loan in order to buy more items of clothing, as this will help her increase her sales as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, blouses and trousers.

loans.name: Jardín De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JARDIN DE ROSAS” iniciará el décimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rita es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, Tejido de macramé de mantas, servicio telefónico, venta de cosméticos, venta de llantas, servicio de instalación de gas, costura de prendas militares.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rita es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de prendas de militares; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace cinco años, ya que ella anteriormente fue policía y al salir de este trabajo decidió elaborara las prendas. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en a las unidades policiales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Jardin de Rosas” (Garden of Roses) is starting its 14th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Rita is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various business such as managing a neighborhood store, producing macramé blankets, providing telephone services, selling cosmetics, selling tires, providing gas installation service, and sewing military uniforms.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Rita. She says that this is her first year since joining Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a client of the organization. Rita currently has a sewing business and sells military uniforms. She indicates that she undertook this business five years ago after having worked for the police. Rita left that job because she decided to make clothes.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabric in bulk. She will acquire her supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then use them to make the products that she will sell to police stations. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Rita is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rita said that she enjoys the health services offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy fabrics in bulk for making police uniforms.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como policia,el socio también sigue teniendo su negocio de una empresa de servicio de seguridad, el socio por medio de este negocio y trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de empresa de seguridad. El socio solicita comprar un escritorio para su empresa.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rafael continues to work as a policeman and running a business providing security services.  Through his job and business he wants to be able to get ahead.  His dream is to expand the security business. He wishes to buy a desk for his business. 

He is grateful for this loan and commits to pay back the money according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy a desk for his business.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa de 40 años de edad es una mujer casada que vive junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Ella es una mujer que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo, además su esposo se gana la vida en un reconocido restaurante  de la zona, y es apoyado en ese trabajo que logra sostener la economía de su hogar. Rosa desea darle un poco mas de seguridad a su familia, ya que su vivienda actualmente está hecha de lámina lo que no le da mayor seguridad a su familia,  es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un cuarto y encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and 4 children. She has earned her living as a domestic worker for a long time. Her husband works in a well-known local restaurant, and she supports him in providing for their household. She would like to provide her family with more security, as their house is made out of sheet metal and does not provide them with much security. For this reason, she decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron, to build a room and a cement floor for her house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron, to build a room and a cement floor for her house.

loans.name: Desiree Mae

texts.en:
Desiree Mae wants to fulfill her dreams by completing a degree. She religiously pays attention in order to make good marks every semester she is in school. 

For another school year, Desiree Mae is in need of money to pay for her school fees. Desiree Mae has big dreams to help her family and her siblings as well, which is the reason why she works hard for her education.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Mark Kenneth

texts.en:
Mark Kenneth is 18 years old from Paniqui, Tarlac. He is studying at St. Paul College Foundation. Their family’s income is from his father, who works as a factory worker. 

What Mark Kenneth's father earns as a sole provider is not enough for them, so he wants to access an education loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders for him to be able to go to college. Mark Kenneth wants to finish college and find a stable job to help his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Norlyn

texts.en:
Norlyn is driven by her determination in selling. At the age of 48, a mother of four children in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Norlyn runs a store that primarily supports their family. 

Norlyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously repaid her obligations without records of default. 

Now, with a desire to increase her inventory, Norlyn has taken another loan to restock items for her sari-sari (Small Grocery) store to sell and draw more customers to her store. Having enough inventories would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, Norlyn dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock items for her sari-sari (Small Grocery) store to sell and draw more customers to her store

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Deysi Aydee

texts.es:
Deysi, esta solicitando más capital para invertir en papas, cebollas, chiles, uvas, naranjas, repollos, fresas, etc., continuará fortaleciendo su negocio y teniendo clientes satisfechos.
El préstamo anterior le permitió a Deysi atraer nuevos clientes, tener ingresos para mejorar el estilo de vida familiar y ser responsable en el pago de sus deudas.
texts.en:
Deysi is seeking more capital to invest in potatoes, onions, chilies, grapes, oranges, cabbages, soft drinks, and other items so she can continue to boost her business and have satisfied clients.

Her prior loan allowed her to attract new clients, and earn income to improve her family's lifestyle and pay off debt responsibly.

loans.use: to invest in potatoes, onions, chilies, grapes, oranges, cabbages, soft drinks, etc. so she can continue to strengthen her business and enjoy satisfied clients.

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung, born in 1985, is a Thai ethnic person and a member of Dung's Group. She joined the program in January 2009 and now she lives with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her two sons are smart and obedient. Her eldest son is learning at elementary school and her youngest son is just attending the kindergarten this year.

Dung's family income is mainly based on breeding and cultivation. She tries to work hard and save the money to cover her children’s education costs, but she still encounters many difficulties. This coming school year, she needs to borrow a loan to invest in her children’s schooling.

Dung expects this loan will help her to invest in her children’s education in order for them to have a brighter future and she will work hard to get money to repay M7 Microfinance Institution on-time.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s schooling.

loans.name: Santos Emely

texts.es:
Santos de 36 años de edad, está acompañada su pareja es agricultor  y tiene 2 hijas de 15 años de edad y 17 años de edad que ya no estudian porque le ayudan a ella. Santos solo estudio hasta 4° grado de educación básica debido a que la escuela quedaba muy retirada y antes de ir a estudiar tenía que hacer los oficios de la casa ya que su madre trabajaba en otras casas para ayudar a su padre con los gastos del hogar porque eran de escasos recursos.

Santos es comerciante, trabaja desde hace 6 años elaborando pan, aprendió desde muy pequeña con su madre que por un tiempo también se dedicó a esta labor. Es con su trabajo que santos apoya en los gastos del hogar, en el negocio se involucran sus hijas y su pareja, así es como logran sacar siempre a tiempo los pedidos del día. El horario de trabajo es de las 5:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm.

El préstamo será invertido en su negocio, comprara azúcar, harina, manteca, levadura, jalea y demás para elaborar pan, además comprar otro horno para ofrecer más y mejor servicio a sus clientes ya que la demanda crece cada vez más.

Santos espera algún día tener una panadería grande en la que contrate personal de trabajo y  poner otros locales en áreas específicas de su comunidad, además sueña con tener su propia casa para su familia.
texts.en:
36-year old Santos is married and has two daughters aged 15 and 17 who do not attend school but help her. Her husband is a farmer. Santos only has a grade 4 education as the school was far away and before going there she had to do household chores. Her mother was at work in other houses to help her father with expenses because they were poor.

Santos is a businesswoman and has had her bread-making business for six years. She learned the trade from her mother who also made bread for a while. It is with money from this business that Santos pays for household expenses. Her husband and children also help her which is how she always manages to complete her customers' orders. She works from 5 am to 6 pm.

The loan money will be used to buy sugar, flour, lard, yeast, gelatin, and other items for making bread. Santos also plans to buy another oven so she can provide her customers with better service as demand for her bread is increasing.

She hopes one day to have a large bakery, hire staff to work there, and open stores in other parts of her community. She dreams too of having a house of her own for her family.

loans.use: Buy sugar, flour,,yeast, gelatin, and another oven

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to continue the business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia Margarita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa y negocio de prestar servicio de movilidad, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un bazar. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar  polos, chompas, polos y blusas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Margarita still works selling clothing on a mobile basis. She sells pants, blouses and polo shirts. She hopes to get ahead with this business. Her dream is to have a store. She is requesting the loan to buy polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses. She is happy to have the loan and promises to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina was born in 1984. She is not married and lives with her parents. She is an educated woman. Zarina works in a state organization. She is a hard-working woman and performs her job well. She is ill now. Zarina needs to see a doctor but she doesn't have the money to do so. Her parents also are unable to support her. She thanks KIVA lenders for their support because this loan will help her to improve her health. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es: María de 22 años de edad es una mujer que desde hace 6 años habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que ha sabido ganarse la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, además su compañero de vida le brinda su apoyo económico, gracias a su trabajo como mecánico automotriz, y los fines de semana se gana la vida como albañil. María sabe que las condiciones de su vivienda, no son las más adecuadas para habitar, ya que el techo de la misma se encuentra deteriorado, lo que ha provocado que el agua se filtre, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: María is a 22-year-old woman who has lived in her own house with her life partner and little 5-year-old daughter for the past six years.    She has found a way to earn her living offering maid services.  Her partner provides financial support, too, thanks to his work as an auto mechanic and on weekends as a construction worker.  María knows that her house is not in habitable condition because the roof is dilapidated and water gets in.  She is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to replace the roof.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 34 years of age and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two kids. They have a little fishing business from which to earn a living.  With their business they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Merlinda and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. 

They have requested from Paglaum MPC a Php 20,000 loan to buy new foams, nets, and other fishing accessories for an efficient operation. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Merlinda smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to buy new foams, nets, and other fishing accessories for an efficient  fishing operation

loans.name: Nehemia

texts.en:
Nehemia is a 42-year-old man who is married to his 37-year-old wife, Wasni. Their marriage was blessed with 3 sons: Yesaya, 12, is in his first year of junior high school; Yacob, 9, is a fourth-grade elementary school student; and their youngest, Fenson, is 2 years old. 

As the breadwinner, Nehemia works hard to provide for his family. While he works in a hospital, he has also run a kiosk business since 2007, together with his wife. 

At the moment Nehemia needs to restock his kiosk. He requires more funds to purchase stock for their business. Moreover, Nehemia wants to build a water reservoir for their house. 

Therefore, Nehemia has applied for an individual loan for 4,500,000 IDR from Tanaoba Lais Manekat Foundation. He will use the loan to purchase both stock for his kiosk and materials to build the water reservoir.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his kiosk.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is married and lives in Clarin with her family. She earns better income from her transportation business and she was able to support her child's education. She also bought some home appliances from her generated income. Her previous loan was used for maintenance of her vehicle and it was successfully repaid. 

To make her services more comfortable and safe, Ester recently took a new loan to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and to pay for repair costs. She plans to used her profit to buy a sidecar for improvement of her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and to pay for repair costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair the façade of her house.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 42 years old and married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Juanita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex needs a loan to service his vehicle. He has a taxi for a transport business and this generates income that maintains his family's well being. He desires to build a permanent home for his family but poor roads hinder his business especially during rainy seasons when they are almost impassable.

loans.use: to service his vehichle.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 34 years old and has three children. Michelle is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Michelle is in the agricultural business, fattening pig in the Philippines. Michelle requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Michelle has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marites has been raising pigs for twelve years now and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with three children. Edna is 35 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Edna has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Edna has been in this business for three years. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 32 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Rosie runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for twelve years.  She sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries. 

Rosie requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alodia

texts.en:
Alodia is a 58-year-old divorced woman with four children, ages 24, 22, 20, and 18, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns rentals as her main source of income, although she also sells fresh fruit and practices farming as her side businesses. It is from these businesses that Alodia has been able to sustain herself and take care of her children. She faces the challenge of a high rate of defaulters, however she hopes to expand her business into a renowned, big grocery in her area.

Alodia is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fruit like passion fruit and pineapples to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit like passion fruit and pineapples to sell.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, con el financiamiento Kiva anterior está atendiendo mejor a sus clientes, pues ha puesto a su disposición nuevos productos relacionados con la reparación de bicicletas, los ingresos han mejorado, la familia se mantiene saludable y con el mismo número de miembros.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar cadenas, piñones, grasa, frenos, cables y otros repuestos que sean de ayuda para continuar realizando su trabajo y teniendo clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
José is providing better customer service as a result of his previous Kiva loan.  He has new bicycle-repair products at his disposal, his income has improved, and his family is healthy and the same size as before.

He has decided on another loan to buy chains, gears, grease, brakes, cables, and other parts that will help him keep on doing his job and satisfying his customers.

loans.use: to buy chains, gears, grease, brakes, cables, and other parts that will help him keep on doing his job and satisfying his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an amount of new and stylish women's clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sophannarith

texts.en:
Sophannarith is 28, a married garment factory worker with two children living in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. One of her children attends school. She has been a worker since 2011, and she can earn $4 a day. Her husband is 33 and a motorcycle taxi driver, earning approximately $3 daily.

To find a way to help her husband earn more income, Sophannarith would like to request a loan to buy a trailer to fix to her husband’s motorcycle to run as a Tuk Tuk taxi. This loan will help her husband earn more income. Her future plans include building a toilet and digging a well. She also wants her husband to have a Korean truck for transporting garment workers for fees.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to fix to her husband’s motorcycle to run as a taxi

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina de 45 años de edad es madre de 3 niñas y vive junto a su esposo en vivienda propia desde hace 25 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder contar con un lugar propio para vivir. Ella es una mujer que sabe aprovechar las oportunidades, es por ello que desde hace 2 años decidió instalar un pequeño negocio de venta y reparación de llantas, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia con el apoyo de su esposo. Dina sabe que sus condiciones habitacionales, cada día son peores  esto porque el techo de su vivienda desde hace algún tiempo está presentando filtraciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de cambiar la duralita del mismo, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en duralita y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, y mejorar así sus condiciones habitacionales.
texts.en: Dina is 45 and has three daughters. She lives with her husband in a house they've owned for 25 years.  She is very happy to be able to have her own home.  She is a woman that knows how to take advantage of opportunities, this is why two years ago she decided to start a small business selling and repairing tires. Through this business she has been able to get her family ahead with the support of her husband.  Dina knows that her home conditions are getting worse, as her house's ceiling has been showing signs of leaking for a while.  She has decided to fix it and requests a loan to FUSAI to buy roof tiles and fasteners to change the roof of her home and improve the conditions of her home.

loans.use: to buy roof tiles and fasteners to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel de 48 años de edad es un hombre responsable que ha sabido ganar se la vida desde muy joven prestando su servicios de seguridad en una empresa de su localidad. Él habita junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente muy feliz y satisfecho de contar con este beneficio desde hace muchos años. La vivienda de Ángel es bastante pequeña y su familia es numerosa, y es por ello que él buscando darle un poco más de comodidad a los suyos ha tomado la decisión de construir un cuarto en su vivienda, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda y poder darle un poco más de comodidad a su familia.
texts.en: Angel is 48 years old and is a responsible man who has earned his own living since he was very young providing security for a local business. He lives with his wife and 3 children in their own home, which he is very happy and satisfied to have owned for many years. Because his house is very small, and his family is large, he is hoping to provide them with more comfort, and has made the decision to build another room in his house. For this reason he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a room in his house, and thereby provide a more comfortable residence for his family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a room in his house.

loans.name: William

texts.es: El socio William se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, el socio vende pantalones, blusas y polos, el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es tener un bazar. El socio solicita le crédito para comprar  polos, chompas, polos y blusas.
texts.en:
William continues to manage his business of selling clothes. He sells trousers, blouses, and pullover shirts. William has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. He dreams of having a bazaar.

William is requesting a loan in order to buy pullover shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.use: to buy pullover shirts, sweaters, and blouses.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: La socia Margot se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza platos como rocoto relleno, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como rocoto arroz, verduras y pollo.
texts.en: This member, Margo, has a food business, making dishes like stuffed hot peppers.  She works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM.  She's been in the business for 8 years and is doing well with it.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is seeking a loan to buy ingredients for cooking, like hot peppers, rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking, like hot peppers, rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a weathered farmer based in Kapsumai village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile and therefore good for agriculture. William lives with Mary, his lovely wife who gave him one son and 3 daughters. For 9 years, he has been growing crops and raising dairy cattle for commercial use. 

William is seeking a loan to expand his maize farm. Maize is a seasonal crop grown once annually in most places in Kenya. This means that farmers invest a lot of time and resources throughout the year to produce an abundant harvest that will pay for all the expenses incurred and reward the farmer with profit. 

However, in order to make the investment worthwhile, the size of land has to be significant. With your loan, William will be able to lease more land space and grow more maize to break even. He is unable to put up the whole money required to grow more maize because farm input costs are prohibitive. With the help of lenders, however, his family will be greatly impacted by this loan investment. When William was asked by our loan officer how his family will benefit from this loan, he replied it will help with "Food security."

loans.use: to lease more land space and grow a bigger maize crop

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 47 years old and married with five children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elma has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Elma has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. Elma has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Felex

texts.en:
Felex is a 32-year-old married Ugandan male living in Kagadi. 

Felex operates a retail shop to increase his income. He also earns a salary as a teacher. Because he is of good character, he desires to build a house. 

Felex is challenged by transport due to poor roads, and he is asking for a loan to buy stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap and other items for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap and other items for selling.

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en:
Hieng is a 65-year-old homemaker with four grown-up children who lives in Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. Two of her children are garment-factory workers and two are drivers. Her husband is a 67-year-old motorcycle taxi driver. Together, they can earn approximately $23 per day. 

To improve her family finances, Hieng would like to request a loan for her daughter and her husband to buy small timber to resell. With this loan, her daughter and her husband will be able to have an additional business. For her future plan, Hieng is going to build a new, bigger house.

loans.use: to buy small timber to resell

loans.name: Sudaba

texts.en:
Sudaba is 58 years old, married and the mother of four children who are all independent and have left home.  Now she lives with her husband. The source of the family's income is animal husbandry. Sudaba has been breeding cows for 38 years. She learns a lot from day to day about this area and her monthly income is 200 AZN.

Husbandry has spread in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for milk and meat. She fattens cows and then resells them for a profitable price. Additionally she makes dairy products for sale from milk. Local people buy milk from Sudaba every day because the products she sells are always fresh and tasty. 

She needs money to cover her family's need to pay for her husband's medicines. Beside that she wants to expand her business and build a farm where she can breed not only cows but also bulls, sheep and chickens. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy two additional cows and increase productivity. This will help her to reach her goal and aid her husband.

loans.use: to buy two additional cows

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es: Rosa tiene 65 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos. Rosa es una mujer admirable quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para llevar el sustento a su familia. Desde hace mucho tiempo ha logrado mantener su negocio de venta de variedad de artesanías en barro y madera. Ella desea mejorar sus  ventas por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de artesanías en barro y madera, además, desea comprar una mesa más para acomodar el producto cuando lo exhibe  a la hora de la venta.
texts.en: Rosa is 65 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and children. Rosa is an admirable woman who does everything in her power to provide for her family. For a long time she has managed to maintain her own business, where she sells a variety of products hand-crafted from clay and wood. She wishes to improve her sales, which is why she has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of a variety of products hand-crafted from clay and wood. She also wishes to buy a table in order to display her products on it when she goes to sell them.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products hand-crafted from clay and wood, and to buy a table

loans.name: Oscar Osmin

texts.es: Oscar de 44 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 5 años de edad en vivienda humilde pero propia, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con este beneficio. Él es un hombre que siempre busca lo mejor para su familia, por lo que hace 10 años tomo la decisión de instalar un pequeño taller de estructuras metálicas en su vivienda. Oscar siente que la seguridad de su vivienda es bastante frágil, y es por ello que ha decidido construir un muro de contención en su vivienda, para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Oscar is 44 years old and he lives in his own humble home with his partner and their son who is five years old, for which he feels blessed. He is a man who always looks for the best for his family, which is why ten years ago he made the decision to set up a small metal framework shop in his home. 

Oscar feels that the security at his home is fairly weak, and that is why he has decided to build a retaining wall at his home. This is the reason for him requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a retaining wall at his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a retaining wall at his home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to improve her fruit orchards

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto de 60 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida desde hace 4 años como vendedor ambulante, distribuyendo productos como: manteles, gabachas y bisutería, por lo que se siente muy feliz y satisfecho de poder contar con su pequeño negocio gracias al cual logra salir adelante. Heriberto desea realizar una pequeña ampliación en su vivienda, sobre todo en la parte del corredor para poder instalar ahí el lavadero, para ello ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para ampliar el corredor de su vivienda y poder colocar ahí el lavadero de su vivienda.
texts.en: 60-year-old Heriberto is a hard-working man who has earned a living for the past four years as a street vendor, selling tablecloths, smocks, costume jewellery and other products. He feels very happy and satisfied to be able to have his small business, thanks to which he is able to get ahead in life. Heriberto wishes to expand his home slightly, mostly in the corridor in order to be able to install a laundry; for this reason, he has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, wood and nails to widen the corridor of his home so he can put the laundry there.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood, and nails to widen the corridor of his home

loans.name: Susana Claribel

texts.es: Susana tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar. Susana se dedica a la venta de ricos licuados de frutas de lunes a viernes. La venta la realiza en su vivienda y gracias a su carisma ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Susana desea invertir en su negocio en la compra de dos licuadoras, mesas y sillas para poder dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Espera poder lograr su objetivo de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y de esta forma apoyar de mejor manera a su familia.
texts.en: Susana is 20 and lives in her own house with her family unit.  She earns her living selling yummy fruit smoothies from Monday to Friday.  The business is in her house, and thanks to her charisma she has lots of customers who prefer her more by the day.  She would like to invest in two blenders and some tables and chairs for the business so she can offer her customers better service.  She hopes to be able to achieve her goal of improving sales and income so she can support to her family better.

loans.use: to buy two blenders, and tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Cecilio Sr.

texts.en:
Cecilio Sr. is a father of three who operates a piggery, growing and selling pigs to earn a living. He had been in this business for many years and he earns well for his family. By selling pork meat in their village, he has been able to earn more profit than by selling it whole. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used for buying feed. 

Cecilio Sr. took a new loan recently from GDMPC microcredit to buy feed for his piglets. He plans to build another cage for his pigs as expansion for his piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for his piglets

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar was born in 1983. She has helped her parents to feed cattle since her childhood. Dilbar is married and has 3 children. 

With the need to earn a living, Dilbar began her business in animal husbandry 10 years ago. She lives in the country, so she has a great opportunity to develop her business. Dilbar feeds the cattle for some months and then sells them in a local market. Dilbar’s husband helps her with feeding cattle. 

Dilbar is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. With her profits she is going to provide good living conditions for her children. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle and increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy. This loan will help her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cattle and increase her working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to nurture and maintain her cocoa crop.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 46 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elenita has a general store business in the Philippines. Elenita requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elenita has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 53 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for the family.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Erlinda would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.pt: O Senhor Leonardo é casado vive com a mulher  seus dois filhos.  Ele é comerciante de detergente por si fabricados, vende detergentes, com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir concentrados para o fabrico de sabão. Tem  sonho de ampliar o seu negocio, construir uma empresa com a mesma vocação. Tem como maior desafio ter mais clientes e abarcar o mercado nacional.
texts.en: Leonardo is married and lives with his wife and his two children. He's a vendor who sells detergent, and he makes the detergent himself. With the current loan he wishes to purchase supplies for making soap. His dream is to expand his business and start a company in that same line of work. His biggest challenge is getting more customers and making a name for himself in the national market.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making soap.

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana is a 29-year-old, single gardener. She lives with her parents and the main source of income for the family is growing and selling seasonal vegetables (cucumber, onion, greens, etc.). This brings her 180 AZN monthly but she also gets additional earnings working as a seamstress in her free time.

Growing vegetables is very popular in Azerbaijan because there is a high demand for fresh vegetables. People use these products to prepare delicious fresh salads and national dishes. 

Tarana’s parents are old and they need good care but this isn’t possible with a small income. So Tarana wants to increase productivity, income and provide her parents with a good life, because it’s very hard for refugees to pay for medicine. She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy good, new fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy good, new fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cart and bicycle for his fast food business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz,  adicional a eso también tiene una pequeña tienda, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa el solicita un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Pedro is 57 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and two children. He has had a nixtamal mill located in his residence for six years. He has a lot of customers, especially the women who make tortillas because they go there to grind their corn. In addition, he has a small store where he sells to be able to cover some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy what he needs for the mill, such as bands, discs, blades, etc., so he can have better income.

loans.use: to buy what he needs for his mill, such as bands, discs, blades, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia Martha  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de chicha, la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar jora para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Martha continues to make a living selling "chicha" (a cold drink made with maize or fruit). Through this small business, she wants to get ahead. She has been in this line of work for several years, and she is doing very well. Her dream is to own a restaurant.

She is requesting a loan to buy fermented maize to prepare the "chicha".

The member is happy to be receiving the loan and is committed to meet her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase fermented maize to prepare "chicha" (a cold drink made with maize or fruit).

loans.name: Norga Alejandrina

texts.es: La socia Norga Alejandrina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella sigue teniendo un restaurant, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia hace paltos como pollo al horno, sopas entre otros, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar verduras, pollo y carne.
texts.en:
Norga Alejandrina continues making a living from the business selling food. She continues to have a restaurant. Through this business, she wants to succeed. She makes dishes such as baked chicken and soups, among others. 

Norga’s dream is to expand her business selling food. She is requesting this loan to purchase vegetables, chicken, and meat.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, chicken, and meat.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is 57 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. Mai works in agriculture. Mai has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system. She is requesting a loan to buy a water filter tank and bore a well. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a water filter tank and bore a well.

loans.name: Quyên

texts.en:
Quyên is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. Quyên lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has a service business cutting hair and has been involved in this business for five years.

This is Quyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that she faces in her life is not having a clean water system or a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet. 

In the future, Quyên hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Anna Fe

texts.en:
Anna Fe helps her husband work on their farm to make a living. She has repaid her previous loan successfully, which was used for organic fertilization of her farm. Her budget with her previous loan was not enough to cover the entire farm, so she recently took a new loan to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm. 

She hopes to gain more income from her farm since she has invested more capital in order to improve her farm.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy ejemplar, está felizmente casada y tiene dos hijos mayores que son lo mejor que le ha pasado en la vida, vive en Yarinacocha junto a sus seres queridos. Rosa se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y su esposo vende kekes y refrescos, ellos se conocieron en el trabajo y se enamoraron, a la fecha a pesar de las adversidades ha salido adelante juntos para poder brindar un mejor futuro a su familia. Siempre luchando por el bienestar de lo suyos, es muy amable y alegre.
Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, como cosméticos, cremas para el cuidado de la piel, perfumes, entre otros, de esta manera tendrá más productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y así sus ganancias mejorarán. Más adelante espera ampliar su negocio y convertirse en prósperos empresarios junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa is an exemplary woman. She is happily married and has two grown children who are the best thing that has happened to her in life. She lives in Yarinacocha with her loved ones. Rosa works selling beauty products and her husband sells cakes and beverages. They met at work and fell in love. Today, despite the adversities, they have gotten ahead together to be able to offer a better future to their family. She has always fought for the well being of their family and she is very kind and cheerful. 

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have given she will be able to buy merchandise for her business, such as cosmetics, skin creams, perfume and more. This way, she will have more products to offer her customers and her profits will improve. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and become a prosperous entrepreneur with her husband.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 43 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for ten years. She sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Luisa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tilimbike Credit Group

texts.en:
Jenipher is 50 years old and a single mother of four children and three other dependents. She is an extremely hard worker and, over the past 10 years with the business management training and integrated savings plan from MLF, she has managed to save enough to purchase a small piece of land.  It is her next goal to continue working hard and to start saving to be able to build her own home.  

Jenipher has requested this loan in order to have the purchasing power to buy fish from the lake in bulk and therefore increase her profits. She hopes that with weekly profits, once her family's basic needs of nutrition and school fees are covered, she can start to purchase and gather a small amount of bricks for the house.

Jenipher's dream for the future is to have the business continue to grow so that she is able to meet all her family's needs much more easily and comfortably. She thanks Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to buy  more fish in bulk and increase her profit margins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob, 46, is a charismatic, active, service-oriented person. To be independent was his main reason for working tirelessly day after day. He is always in search of ways to earn a living and to support his wife and their household of 12 lovely, angelic-looking children. 

Jacob is based in Kitale, Kenya. The climate here greatly favors high-altitude cash crops and dairy farming, both of which he practices. He also keeps poultry for eggs and grows vegetables for both sales and his family's consumption. However, the income Jacob makes from farming is not sufficient to sustain his large family. This has forced Jacob to look for other sources of income to supplement the meager income he earns. 

Jacob is seeking a loan to purchase farming equipment. He spends most of his time doing ‘general farm work', as he put it. His biggest challenge is the unfavorable tools he owns. Poor farmers in Africa usually do not have the right tools for their work. This makes work hours on the farm longer and harder. 

Your loan will help to improve Jacob's farm machinery, and hence indirectly protect the investment he makes in his farm. Because they are modern and new, the tools you are financing give farmers confidence in the quality, reliability and safety of the implements they employ. Your loan will help Jacob to acquire tools that improve productivity and yields, plus reduce work time and physical effort. 

You will have also helped Jacob's family's health, since there are health implications from using ineffective traditional tools. 

When asked, “How will this loan benefit your family?” Jacob replied, “Increased food security in my household.”

loans.use: to buy farming implements.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is an ambitious man and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of milk in his area. He's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. Peter lives with his wife and says that they only want to have more children when they are sure that they can raise them without worry of where their next meal will come from, or forcing them to leave school because they can't provide for them. 

Peter owns a small plot of inherited land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for more than 10 years. He grows a variety of crops and keeps dairy cows and poultry. The income he makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses. He needs to improve his income level, and that is why he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Peter passionately loves dairy farming and as he likes to put it “dairy farming is close to my heart”. He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will produce between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan and also towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from cow manure which will be used in increasing the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a biogas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt: O Sr Luis  é casado vive na casa propria pai de 4 filhos e avo de uma neta e todos estes na sua responsabilidade todos  vão a escola,é militar ja a bastante tempo,na conversa com os colegas soube da existencia da hluvuku e dirigindo se para o mesmo solicitar um emprestimo 27.000 para aquisição de mobiliar da sala de visita visto que o salario que tem não é suficiente para satisfazer as necessidades  da sua familia.O seu maior sonho é  ter uma viatura pessoal para trazer mais mobilidade e conforto da sua familia.O seu maior desafio é comprar comida que cabe para o mês todo devido aos preços praticados nos mercados nacionais.
texts.en: Luis is married and lives in a house that he owns. He has four children and a granddaughter, and all of them are in school and under his responsibility. He has been a serviceman for several years. By talking to his coworkers he learned of Hluvuku's existence and went to apply for a loan from them. It is for 27,000 MZN in order to purchase furniture for his living room, since his salary is not enough to fulfill his family's needs. His biggest dream is to have a personal vehicle so that he can provide more mobility and comfort for his family. His biggest challenge is buying an entire month's worth of food due to the current prices in national markets.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for his living room.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 12 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young man's face is pixelated because he is 23 years old and he lives in a high risk area. For 12 years, he has worked in agriculture growing corn. When his crop is ready it is sold in the nearby towns. He already has a lot of regular customers. He lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicides, etc., and to improve the soil shown in the photograph, so he can continue with his crops since this is his only source of work and this way he can have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc., and to improve the soil.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: Maria tiene 57 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas la mayor de ellas trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Maria está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her three daughters. The oldest of them work and helps her economically. She has owned a small store located in her place of residence for 15 years. She has many customers because of the good prices and the courtesy that she shows when she makes sales.

Maria is requesting a loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc., and so be able to have a better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Victoria Secundina
