texts.es: Victoria de 54 años de edad posee un taller de costura desde hace 12 años en su casa de habitación, elabora manteles, bolsas, carteras, etc. comercializa su mercadería en las diferentes colonias y tiene muchos clientes, victoria vive en casa propia con su madre y su esposo, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de variedad de telas, hilos, agujas, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Victoria, age 54, has run a sewing shop out of her home for twelve years now. She makes blankets, purses, wallets, and more. She sells her merchandise in various neighborhoods and has a lot of customers. Victoria lives in her own home with her mother and her husband.   She is requesting this loan so she can buy a variety of sewing supplies, including fabrics, needles, thread, elastics, and more. This will help her keep working and earn more income.

loans.use: buy a variety of sewing supplies

loans.name: Arcangel Gabriel Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ARCANGEL GABRIEL”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alcira ella es casada y tiene 44 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja como profesora del nivel primario, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community bank "Archangel Gabriel," which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco in Peru.  One member is Alcira, age 44, who is the married mother of two children. She works as a primary school teacher from 8:00am until 2:00pm and wants to get ahead in her work. Her dream is to have a clothing store. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a television set for her home.

Other members in the group are in the business of selling books or running internet cafes, grocery stores, or restaurants.
 
Alcira is grateful to everyone who helps her achieve her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments according to the specified terms.

loans.use: buy a television set for her home

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a hardworking man who intends to use this loan to pay school fees for his children. He has been selling spare parts since 2002, and this has enabled him to cater to his family's needs. He has also built rentals to boost his income, since only spare parts selling could not meet all of his needs. He desires to educate his children but does not have enough capital.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a hard-working, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle rearing and selling, alongside farming. Stanley started this business to increase his income and look after his family. He faces hardships of a lack of capital and price fluctuations. However, he has a vision of owning a big, well-known, and advanced farm. 

Stanley is requesting a loan to buy more cows for rearing and selling.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Boneventure

texts.en:
Boneventure is a 42-year-old, hard-working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle rearing and selling, alongside farming. Boneventure started this business to increase his income and educate his children.  He has hardships of a lack of capital and prolonged drought. However, he has a vision of becoming a prominent business man.

Boneventure is requesting a loan to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah lives in Masindi,  Uganda. She has a salon where she generates income to sustain her family. She needs a loan to buy more salon items like braids and chemicals to use this Christmas season. She is affected by competition and seasonal clients,  which can  
cause lower income generation.

loans.use: to buy more salon items like braids and chemicals.

loans.name: Manfredy Gamaliel

texts.es:
Manfredy de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, vive acompañado, su pareja estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, ella es empleada, y son padres de una niña.

 Manfredy se dedica a la venta de pan, a lo cual lleva tres años de dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que por medio de ello lleva el sustento a su familia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cemento, arena y hierro para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que su vivienda se encuentra en muy malas condiciones. El sueño de Manfredy es darle una vivienda digna a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida
texts.en:
Manfredy, 21 years old, studied until the ninth grade. He lives with his partner. His partner studied until the third year of high school. She is employed, and they are the parents of one little girl.

Manfredy makes a living from selling bread, from which he has made a living for three years, since by means of this job he supports his family.

The loan that he is requesting is to purchase cement, sand, and iron for improvements to his home, since his home is in a very bad condition. Manfredy’s dream is to give his family a home worthy of them and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, and sand for improvements to his home.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.pt:
O Senhor Osvaldo vive maritalmente na casa propria, tem 2 filhos menores de idade. Ele é policia e com o presente emprestimo vai comprar cimento, porta, e pedras finas para terminar com a construção da sua residência. 
O seu maior sonho é comprar uma viatura.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is married and lives in a house that he owns. He has two underage children. He's a police officer and with the current loan he will purchase cement, a door, and fine gravel so that he can finish building his house.
His biggest dream is to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase cement, a door, and fine gravel so he can finish building his house.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 38-year-old married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and four kids - one son and three daughters. Samah's husband works as an employee in a local company where he earns a low income. This income is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Samah and her husband would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. Samah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, she will be able to provide clean water for her family. Samah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Vitoria

texts.pt:
A Senhora Victoria vive na casa dos pais com o seu esposo tem dois filhos e responsabiliza-se por mais duas irmães. Ela é policia, com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir material de construção o ferro, o cimento e a pedra para iniciar com a costrução da sua residência. 
Tem como sonho construir a sua residência
texts.en:
Victoria lives with her husband in her parents' house. She has two children and is also responsible for two of her sisters. She's a police officer. With the current loan she'll purchase construction supplies such as iron, cement, and rocks so that she can start building her house.
Her dream is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as iron, cement, and rocks so that she can start building her house.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 29-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a small house. Tamer works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This income is not enough to cover all of the family needs. Tamer would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. 

Tamer took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Tamer will be able to provide clean water for his family. 

Tamer appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is 40 years old. She is a married woman and has a 20 year old son. Her husband works in the beverage industry. Her son is a repairman of apartments. Manzura herself is engaged in sewing and selling large packages of tough oilcloth. She started this business three years ago. Such work is not difficult and Manzura is satisfied with her work.
 
Manzura has decided to expand her activity by buying a large amount of material for sewing packages to increase the goods and thus increase the profitability of the business. But Manzura has not enough money for purchasing that number of oilcloth that she plans to buy. She is counting on the loan amount, and hopes that you will not refuse to help her. Support Manzura!

loans.use: to purchase oilcloth for sewing packages of oilcloth.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. Emma is 34 years old and she is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Emma has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell to her customers.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rwensigyire Tukwatanise Group

texts.en:
George is a fifty-two-year-old hardworking married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a nursery bed of coffee as his main source of income alongside farming where he earns extra income. He started this business to earn more income and have a better life. He faces a challenge of bad weather that affects his produce business. He has a vision of educating his children and having an empowered family.

He is requesting a loan to buy coffee seeds for his farm.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau is a 33-year-old married man with five children, four of whom attend school. He is a hardworking man and runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise like sugar, soap, etc. 

Esau also started farming to add to his income generation. He wants a loan to buy sugar and soap to sell. Esau would like to buy a motorcycle for his business so as to increase on his income, however inadequate capital hinders him.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en: Gilbert is a hardworking, married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He does cattle fattening alongside fishing to acquire income to provide for his family. He intends to use the loan to buy a cow for fattening. He desires to build rentals to get more income because prolonged drought affects his cattle.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Tondon Lup Group

texts.en: “Being in a position to support the family is a blessing,” says 38-year-old Lembi, featured with her hand raised. Lembi is the featured borrower of the group pictured with the group members. To sustain her livelihood, she makes pretty embroidered shawls and wraparounds to sell and supply in the market. One embroidered fabric is sold at the rate of 350 INR and she makes  a little profit out of one wraparound skirt. She lives in a remote village and sends her two sons to a boarding school with the hope of better education facilities in town. In the previous years, she availed a loan from WSDS to buy an embroidery machine, which became the main income-generating source for the household. She is able to provide boarding school fees for the two sons from the income she gets from selling embroidered fabrics. Her husband was a daily wage earner and recently he has been doing poultry farming for job satisfaction, thinking it will be much more productive. Most of their income is used for buying fodder since they are at the initial stage of their poultry farming and no income is derived yet. She is short of money to buy materials needed for her embroidery, leading to a decrease in her production due to inadequate materials for production. They have been facing difficulties paying the household expenses and boarding fees of the children. She now aspires to buy more stock of embroidery materials to recover from her financial deficit. With the Kiva loan, she will buy more fabrics, beads and threads to make charming shawls and wraparounds to attract more customers. She is very happy and sends her thank you to the lenders. The other members of the group are working hard to support themselves. They are engaged in embroidery, weaving, a petty shop, tailoring and vegetable vending to generate income.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials including fabrics, beads and threads to make pretty wraparound skirts and shawls to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a hardworking woman who runs a retail shop selling general merchandise. 

Stella also does farming to add to her income. 

She would like to build a permanent house and trade wholesale only to not be affected by inadequate capital plus constant price fluctuations. She wants a loan to buy sugar, cooking oil and soap for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and soap for selling.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 25-year-old married woman with children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has children who are in school.

Mary Ann has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokha works as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mom works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of them all to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk is 49 years old, a villager with two children from Kampong Speu province of Cambodia. He finds vines (used to make baskets) from the forest on the mountain in the nearby villages and provinces to sell. He has been in this job since 2008. His wife is 39 also works. One of his children is a garment-factory worker and another attends school. Together, they can earn approximately $10.66 a day. Due to the fact that his daughter goes to work far away from home, Uk would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to commute to work. With the loan, he will be able to help his daughter to reduce her traveling expenses. For his future plan, he wants to help his youngest child to get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his daughter to commute to work

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado en la zona donde reside. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, la joven ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y la compra de mas ganado que le permita crecer en el negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman with the pixelated face is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. For several years she has raised cattle in the area where she lives. She has a very good customer base and knows how to gain the confidence of her customers. She lives in her own house with her husband. She has decided to invest in the caretaking of her cattle as this is what her business depends upon. So she is seeking a loan to buy vitamins and buy more cattle which will enable her to grow her business and thus have greater income.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for her cattle as well as additional heads of cattle.

loans.name: Carmen Sonia

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, la joven es madre soltera  vive en casa propia con su hijo y su hermana, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: The young woman with the pixelated face is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She sells clothing for women and men in her business located in the municipal market. She has many regular customers because of the quality of her clothing and good prices. She is a single mother, lives in her own home with her son and her sister. She seeks a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale so that she can continue her sales and thus have greater income.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Gulumnaz

texts.en:
Gulumnaz is 46 years old and married but she has no kids. Her husband is a laborer but the main source of the family’s income is gardening. Gulumnaz has been raising and selling wheat for 26 years and has good skills in this area. Her monthly income is 350 AZN.

People have high demand for wheat because they use it to prepare flour and flour products. They bake pies, bread, lavosh, cakes and so on. The family's monthly income doesn't cover the demands and she needs money for this reason. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers for wheat and increase harvest and income. Please support Gulumnaz

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer for wheat

loans.name: Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Thi works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thi has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thi has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having lartrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet.

In the future, Dung hopes to maintain a successful business, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build toilet

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es: Hector de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el posee un taller de mecánica automotriz ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 24 años, tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Hector esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de una caja de herramientas, micas y sostenes o burros de motores ya que los que actualmente posee están muy deteriorados, ya si poder para seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hector, 48 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and their two children. He has owned an auto mechanics garage located in his residence for 24 years. He has many customers because of his good work. With that which he makes from his work he is able to pay some home expenses.

Hector is requesting a loan for the purchase of a box of tools, auto lights, and motor supports or lifts since those that he currently possesses are very deteriorated, if he is to be able to continue with his business to make better profits.

loans.use: to purchase a box of tools, auto lights, and motor supports or lifts.

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en:
Vibian is 37 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with 3 children. She sells cereals and she has been running the business for the past 10 years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of cereals such as maize, rice and beans. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees and repay the loan.

This is her third loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to grow her business and support her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur is a 38-year-old man married to Florence who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children. Arthur has been operating a metal and welding shop for a period of four years, earning himself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.
  
Arthur was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 10,000. He intends to use this amount to buy a welding machine.

Arthur plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan sells shoes and has been running this business for four years. She is 29 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of shoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and service the loan.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future her hopes are to have a prosperous business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph comes from Nyamasibi village situated in a remote location in the Nyanza region of Kenya. He is a practicing mixed-farmer who makes a living keeping dairy animals and growing commercial food crops such as maize and vegetables. The 57-year-old farmer lives together with his wife, Jane.

Joseph is seeking a loan of only KES 25,000 to purchase farm implements. After years of using the same equipment, the tools wear out and become inefficient. This makes the work of a farmer very strenuous and time consuming. The reason for poor quality of farm output is also often deduced from employment of such tools. 

However, with your loan, Joseph will invest in modern tools that are in a good working condition, easy to use and better overall design. The quality of work will be greatly enhanced and this will be translated into the quality and quantity of the yield at the end of the season.
 
Investment in this borrower will improve his family's economic activity and livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Working on the land is one of the hardest jobs because of the great effort you have to make to progress. However, David is a man who never gives up despite the weather or situations that happen. He always manages to meet the requirements of his family. He gets up very early in the morning to go to his farm where he works. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely 58-year-old wife. They have been blessed with three children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 30 years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business to supplement the meager income they earn. 

From Kiva lenders, David is seeking a loan of 35,000 KES to grow his horticulture business. (Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.) It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford David access to a loan facility that will help him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With this loan, David’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Meridith

texts.en:
Meridith is 39 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Meridith works very hard to provide for them.

Meridith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.
She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Meridith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an amount of goats to raise and sell to provide his family with the necessary needs.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sok works as farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Ham's Group

texts.en: Ham’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ham works as farmer to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as to save time on collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as village coordinator to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau is a thirty-two-year-old, hardworking married man with three children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

Esau operates a butcher shop where he earns his living. However, he also practices farming to earn extra income. He started this business to improve his family's standard of living. 

Esau experiences hardships due to the market's price fluctuations. Nevertheless, he hopes to expand his business, educate his children, and become rich.

Esau is requesting a loan to buy cows for slaughtering and stocking his butcher shop ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy cows to supply his butcher shop.

loans.name: Pao's Group

texts.en: Pao’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Pao works as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Dianah

texts.en: Dianah lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is married with one child who is four years old and attends school. She sells phones and accessories from which she has generated a lot of income. She hopes to expand and grow her business and pay school fees for her child. She will use the loan money to buy more phones for selling.

loans.use: to buy more phones to sell

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is a 41-year-old widowed farmer with six children. All of them live in Takeo province of Cambodia. Four of her children are workers, one is a driver and the youngest one attends school. Together, they can earn approximately $23 per day. 

One of her children is getting married soon so Thim has decided to secure a loan to cover her child’s wedding expenses. This loan will help her have enough money to hold her child’s wedding. In the future, she plans to build a new house in 2018 and support her youngest child's university education. In addition to rice farming, Thim also wants to grow vegetables.

loans.use: to cover her child’s wedding expenses

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt: O Senhor Ernesto é casado vive com a esposa  e um filhos.  Ele é carpinteiro - Marceneiro, fabrica artigos de madeira, tais como portas, arros e diversas mobilias, com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir um torro de madeira que é materia prima para o seu negocio. Tem  sonho de ampliar o seu negocio e melhorar as suas condições de vida. Tem como maior desafio trabalhar cada vez mais e ter financiamento para comprar a máquina de limpar a madeira
texts.en: Ernesto is married and lives with his wife and children. He's a carpenter and a cabinetmaker who manufactures woodwork such as doors, frames and various types of furniture. With the current loan he wishes to purchase a wood lathe which is a supply for his business. His dream is to expand his business and improve his living conditions. His biggest challenge is working progressively harder and getting a loan in order to buy a woodworking machine.

loans.use: to purchase a wood lathe as a supply for his business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 70 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos como: corvos, cuchillo, machetes, también se encarga de afilarlos, ollas, sartenes, recipientes plásticos, etc. tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad y tiene muchos clientes, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Jose, 70 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner. He makes a living from the sale of a variety of products such as: hooks, knives, and machetes, which he also is in charge of sharpening, pots, pans, plastic receptacles, etc. He has made a living from this activity for many years, and he has many customers. 

José is requesting a loan for the purchase of more products and so continue with his work which generates good profits for him.

loans.use: to purchase hooks, knives, machetes, pots, pans, plastic receptacles, etc.

loans.name: Teto

texts.en:
Teto is a 25-year-old single man from Jabalia City. He lives with his elderly parents in a small house. Teto works as a painter in the workshops, where he gets a good income but it is not stable due to the demand. He would like to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Teto took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Teto will be able to provide hot water without using electricity.

Teto appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 63 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Ella  elabora tamales de gallina y los comercializa en las principales zonas de su localidad desde hace 10 años. Carmen  habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea invertir en la mejora del techo de su vivienda. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y pines para proceder a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en: Carmen is 63 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She makes chicken tamales and has sold them in the major areas of her town for 10 years. Carmen lives in very humble condition and wants to invest in improving the roof of her home. Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets, wood and galvanized roof nails to proceed with the improvement as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and galvanized nails to repair house roof.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en:
Sharofat lives with her husband and children in the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan. She is 47 years old. 

Her husband is a farmer who is engaged in growing and selling vegetables. Thanks to his agricultural activity, Sharofat has accumulated savings of about $300. She plans to start her own trading business and has already acquired a retail outlet in the local market. 

Sharofat intends to start selling adult and children's clothing. She believes this business has good potential for profit. However, Sharofat does not have sufficient funds to purchase her stock. So she has applied for a loan and hopes to receive her financing.

With help from this loan, Sharofat will provide a new source of income and thus improve her whole family's economic status.

loans.use: to purchase adult and children's clothing to start her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo,  habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida, el joven  posee un taller de carpintería en el cual fabrica y vende variedad de muebles desde hace 2 años y ya tiene clientes fijos por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo,  el solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 28 years old and he inhabits a high risk zone, lives in his own house with his life partner.  The young man has a carpenter's workshop in which he has been making and selling a variety of pieces of furniture for two years and he already has firm customers because of the quality that he achieves in his work.  
He is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in his business through the purchase of wood, nails, glue, varnish, decorations, and other items with which he will be able to attract more customers and in this way achieve his objective of improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails. glue, varnish, decorations, and other items.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: Mahina is a young and smart woman. She is not married and lives with her parents and sister and brother in a rural area. Her father is a rental worker and her mother is a farmer. They live together poorly. Mahina helps her parents in the household. She was one of the best pupils in a school, so after graduating school she applied to the university.  Mahina studies well. She must to pay for education but she has not enough money. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Kimyo

texts.en:
Kimyo is married and mother of 2 smart children. Her smaller child is school-aged and the elder is adult. Through her own initiative she opened a store, beginning with a few products. Her store has now grown. She is always trying to improve her business. She works every day at her store and believes that it is going well because of her dedication and the excellent service she provides to her customers.

Kimyo intends to use the loan in the amount of 6,000 Somoni to buy merchandise for stocking her store. She will buy groceries, detergents, soft drinks, mineral water, and other items. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because thanks to this, she will help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy food items for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Dịu

texts.en:
Dịu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Dịu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Dịu is 62 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Dong Son district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Dịu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dịu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

With her business profits, Dịu hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet and bathroom.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a 28-year-old man who is married to Rosemary: they are blessed with one child. Kenneth supports his family by operating a motorcycle transportation business. This has been in operation for two years, earning Kenneth a monthly income of KES 8,000.
 
Kenneth is now servicing his second loan of KES 12,000. He intends to use this amount to repair and maintain his motorcycle which has mechanical challenges.

Kenneth plans to use the anticipated income to pay his child's school fees and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: To repair and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her jewelry business.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
Luzvilla owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 11,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of franchise agreement / permit so she could continue her business operation.

In the future, Luzvilla wants to buy another unit of tricycle for business purpose. She hopes to improve their general living condition and to give her children a good and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the renewal of franchise agreement / permit and maintenance of the tricycle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 58 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school

Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Betty has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and earns an income from raising livestock.

Betty aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lebby

texts.en:
Lebby is 52 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Lebby is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lebby has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa used her previous loan to buy timber so that when she receives orders, she has the required materials. She is a 37-year-old, hard-working, married woman with four children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. 

Edisa owns a carpentry workshop and sells furniture like chairs, tables and cupboards. She earns extra income from agriculture. Edisa continues to face the challenges of inadequate capital to fully fund her business and the high prices of timber. However, she hopes to raise money to build a permanent house for her family.
 
Edisa is requesting a loan to buy more timber for her carpentry business.

loans.use: to buy more timber for her carpentry business.

loans.name: Vian

texts.en: Vian is 32 years old and has the responsibility of taking care of three children, two of whom attend school. He deals in produce in Hoima, Uganda, mainly buying and selling maize and beans, among other things. Vian hopes to develop his business and pay school fees for his children. He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a forty-five-year-old, hard-working, married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce alongside agriculture where he grows bananas, cassava and coffee to earn extra income. He started this business because it was so profitable and to have a better life. He faces a challenge of competition, price fluctuations and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of expanding his business and owning a big modern store of produce.

He is requesting a loan to buy more maize, millet and coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize, millet and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is appreciative of her previous loan which helped her improve her living standards. Her business is also thriving. 
With the requested loan of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase cattle for meat to sell. She hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for meat to sell.

loans.name: Seun's Group

texts.en: Seun’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Seun works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these man and women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tolkun

texts.ru: Толкун 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старший сын Толкун учится в техникуме, младшие дочери - дошкольного и школьного возраста. У Толкун - средне-специальное образование, с 2009 года она работает кассиром, получая заработную плату в размере чуть более 13,000 сом (KGS). Супруг Толкун - водитель микроавтобуса. Сейчас семья Толкун живет в доме ее брата, но они очень хотят обзавестись собственным жильем. Поэтому начали строительство собственного дома, однако не хватает средств на его завершение, в связи с чем Толкун и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сомов (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для покрытия крыши дома. Толкун планирует закончить строительство к лету следующего года и наконец обзавестись собственным жильем. А заработную плату она будет откладывать на воспитание и образование ее детей.
texts.en: Tolkun is 39 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising three children.  Tolkun's oldest son is studying in a technical college, one of her daughters is in primary school, and the youngest doesn't go to school yet. Tolkun herself has a specialized secondary education and she has been working as a cashier since 2009, making a salary of just over 13,000 som (KGS).  Her husband is a minibus driver.  The family currently lives with Tolkun's brother, but they are very eager to acquire their own house.  They have actually started to build a house, but they do not have enough money to finish building it.  For this reason, Tolkun has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy building materials to cover the roof of her house.  She is planning to finish building her house by next summer and is looking forward to having her own home.  She will use her salary to take care of her children's upbringing and education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to cover the roof of her future house, so that she can have her own home.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar de 55 años de edad vive solo en casa propia, el se dedica a la venta de cocos desde hace 4 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presenta, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de cocos por mayor y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar, 55, lives alone in his own house.  He has been making a living for four years selling coconuts.  His business is located in his house and he has lots of customers.  With what he earns from his sales, he is able to cover the expenses that come up.  He is requesting a loan to buy coconuts wholesale and thus have more income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Nghĩa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nghĩa is 39 years old, and she is married with three children. Nghĩa lives with four dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Nghĩa has a retail business selling dry food. This is Nghĩa first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Nghĩa has been involved in this business for five years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Nghĩa is not having a good hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to repair the toilet.

With her business profit, Nghĩa hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to repair a toilet

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Mãe solteira de 50 anos de idade, abandonada pelo marido a mais de 20 anos, tem 2 filhos maiores de idade, 1 a estudar no nível superior e outro a trabalhar e ajudar a mãe nas despesas. Cuida de 2 netos menores, estudou ate 4ª classe e vive à base de negocio a mais de 20 anos e esta a repetir o credito pela 5ª vez.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: refrescos, cerveja, vinhos e diversos produtos alimentares para ampliar o seu negocio que faz todos dias numa das barracas dentro do mercado central da vila.
Sua maior esperança é concluir a construção de sua casa que esta ainda numa fase inicial, ampliar o seu negocio  e sustentar os estudos de sua filha que esta no nível superior. 
O seu maior desafio, é a falta de fundos e tendo todas despesas na sua responsabilidade.
texts.en:
Amelia is a 50-year-old single mother. Her husband left her over 20 years ago. She has two adult children, one of whom is in college, and the other child is in the workforce and helps her pay the bills. She takes care of two underage grandchildren. She completed the 4th grade. She has been earning a living through her business for over 20 years and this is her 5th loan.
With the loan she intends to purchase refreshments, beer, wine and a variety of foodstuffs so that she can expand her business. She runs her business from a booth in the village's central market on a daily basis.
Her greatest hope is to finish building her house which is still in its early stages. She also hopes to expand her business and support her daughter's college studies.
Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds and being responsible for all the bills.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments, beer, wine and a variety of foodstuffs so that she can expand her business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives together with his wife, Yunes, in Nyamaribi village, situated in the Kisii region of Kenya. The couple support their children by running a small mixed farm. They keep dairy animals and grow plants for food and fodder. They have also ventured into other agricultural practices, such as poultry farming for subsistence purposes.

Michael is seeking a KES 20,000 loan to purchase more poultry. With a significant number of chickens, Michael will turn this project into a business and start selling eggs, meat, and perhaps even feathers. This alternative source of regular income will bring in more cash for the family and spread their business risk. Michael will use the money that he makes from this investment to educate his children and buy food and other basic necessities for his family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Marnie

texts.en:
Marnie is 36 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marnie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marnie has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 23 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Aiza has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Aiza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 58 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. Vilma runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like feed, rice, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Vilma has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Vilma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like feed, rice, snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 49 years old, married and has five children. Three of her children are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Fozia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Fozia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Fozia  also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Fozia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Zonia Argentina Alvarez

texts.es:
Uno de los negocios característicos de Sololá es la crianza de animales de todo tipo. Desde hace 15 años Zonia de 38 años, quien vive en su comunidad, se dedica a la   crianza de pollos, negocio que genera una satisfactoria ganancia para el beneficio de su familia y para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos. Ella tiene 7 hijos por quienes lucha cada día los cuatro primeros ya son casados y tienen familias apartes y los tres últimos son estudian en la escuela que les queda cerca de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra, venta y crianza de pollos en la comunidad donde ella vive, a ella le genera ganancias buenas porque no tiene competencia en dicho negocio y le ayuda a mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

Hace una solicitud de préstamo para la compra de pollos de granja y criollos y como también la compra de concentrado y vitaminas para pollos y así genera más ganancias para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y apoyar a su comunidad en un desarrollo hacia el futuro.
	
Son sus metas para generar más ingresos y el sostenimiento de su familia y seguir en la crianza de pollos y la compra de un molino de nixtamal y que sus hijos sean profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
One of the business that the Sololá region s known for is the raising all kinds of animals. 38 year old Zonia has been raising animals here for 15 years. She raises chickens, a business that generates a satisfactory income for the well-being of her family and to improve life for her children. Zonia has 7 children for whom she fights every day. The oldest four are now married and have their own families. The youngest three attend a nearby school.

Zonia buys, sells, and raises chickens in her community where she lives. She generates good income because she doesn't have any competition in her business. Her business helps her improve the living conditions of her and her family.

She seeks a loan to buy chickens and also to buy feed concentrate and vitamins for the chickens, resulting in greater profits in order to be able to improve her family's living conditions and support the community in its development into the future. Her goals are to generate more income and support her family, continue raising chickens and buying a maize grinder, and that her children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon lives in Kaplolo village in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has a 37-year-old wife named Ann and four children--two in their infancy and the others teenagers. To support his family and provide for them, Simeon is an adept mixed-farmer who has been doing this work for eight years. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

Simeon is seeking a loan to purchase water pipes for irrigating his crops and for filling tanks and troughs with water. With this investment, his plants will grow green and healthy and his animals will never lack water for hydration. His family will greatly benefit too because they will not have to use much effort to fetch and transport water.

With your loan investment, Simeon's life will be made easier and his activities on the farm will become more productive and profitable. Currently, he needs all the money he can make to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes

loans.name: Buhanda Bakyala Tutunguke Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a hard-working 30-year-old married man with one child. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda where he operates a mobile money business. Although he also earns a monthly salary, he earns extra income from his mobile money business. 

Stephen started this business to improve his family's standard of living. He faces the hardships of price fluctuations and network problems as his business relies on a network. However, he hopes to expand his business and educate his children.

Stephen is requesting a loan to provide the float for his mobile money business.

loans.use: to provide the float for his mobile money business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.pt:
Mãe viúva de 35 anos de idade que muito cedo perdeu marido, tem 4 filhos menores e com acesso a educação e seus únicos dependentes, vive na casa propria é negociante a mais de 5 anos e com os rendimentos do seu negocio cria os seus filhos, esta a tomar o credito pela 1ª vez.
Com o mesmo pretende ampliar o seu negocio na compra de diversos produtos alimentares como: arroz, açúcar, óleo, ovos, farinha, bebidas, etc, os mesmos são vendidos em sua barraca no mercadinho da zona.
Desenvolver mais o negocio e melhorar as condições de vida de seus filhos e da sua casa, é o seu maior sonho.
A falta de fundos suficientes e o facto de ser a chefe da família constitue o maior desafio dela.
texts.en:
Celia is a 35-year-old widowed mother. She lost her husband very early on. She has four underage children who attend school and they're her only dependents. She lives in a house that she owns. She has been a vendor for over five years and she raises her children with the profits from her business. This is her first loan.
With the loan she intends to expand her business by purchasing various foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, beverages, etc. She sells the products in a booth at the local market.
Her biggest dream is to further develop her business, improve her home, and improve her and her children's living conditions.
Her biggest challenge is not having enough funds and being the head of the family.

loans.use: to purchase various foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for the family farm.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Jose de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la comercialización de cereales (maíz y frijol) desde hace 2 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas, Jose esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sacos de cereales asi como muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 53 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and three children. He has been making a living selling cereals (maize and beans) for the past 2 years and has many customers, especially women that make tortillas. Jose is requesting this loan to buy sacks of grain, as shown in the photograph, to continue selling and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cereals (maize y beans)

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comales, ollas y macetas de barro desde hace varios años, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo el cuarto para el baño y un lavadero en el lugar que muestra en la fotografía pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo, por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar ladrillos, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para vivir el lo limpio y ordenado.
texts.en: Francisca, 55, lives in her own house with her family group.  For several years, she has been making a living from the manufacture and sales of griddles, pots, and flower pots of clay.  She would like to improve her residence by constructing a bathroom and laundry in the spot shown in the photo; but with what she obtains from her sales, there is not enough to build it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement, sand, rebar, and labor in order to live in a clean and orderly space.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, rebar, and labor.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce, who is in his late 30s, is single.  He has been running an electronics business for six years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.  

This will be Alphonce's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy products for assembling TV sets, radios, etc. and has managed to pay back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to take care of himself and cover his household expenses. He will use this loan to  buy radios, TV sets, and an up-to-date iron cupboard to resell. He dreams of building his own house.

Alphonce will make sure he pays the loan according to the loan's scheduled repayment period.

loans.use: to buy radios, TV sets, and an up-to-date iron cupboard to resell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 38 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. She owns a farm that is doing well, which helps her earn a good income for her family. Mary Ann has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for fertilization of her farm. With her investment, she has been able to generate more income than before and has supported her children's education. 

Mary Ann took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to improve her rice farm. She wants to improve her farm and her future plan is to renovate her home to create a safe living environment for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is thankful that he was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in his general store. His income from his store helps a lot in meeting his family's daily personal and household needs.

He would like to again apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and other food items at retail. He is positive that more items in his store will yield more sales and thus increase his earnings. His income from his store helps sustain his family's basic needs. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

Jose dreams of building a supermarket and being a well known businessman someday. He prays to be strong and healthy in his old age. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy firewood, corn and propane gas to have raw materials to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Maksat

texts.ru: Максат 45 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Максат - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Максат занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая пшеницу на 2,50 ГА собственной земли. Также в хозяйстве есть 10 овец и 1 дойная корова, экологически чистое молоко и пшеницу она реализует местным жителям. Продукция пользуется большим спросом и количество покупателей растет с каждым днем, поэтому Максат решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян картофеля. Доходы от кредита Максат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Maksat is 45 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She grows wheat on 2.5 hectares of her own land.  She also owns 10 sheep and one dairy cow, and she sells organic milk and wheat to the local residents.  She receives a high demand for her products and the number of her customers keeps growing every day.  For this reason, she has decided to turn to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and potato seeds.  Maksat plans to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.  She is also planning to save enough money to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to cultivate her land, and to buy potato seeds in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 22-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been running her own beauty salon for the past two years and contributing her income with her husband to manage the household.
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics such as creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Irum has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Irum is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon busines.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a maize farmer from Lumu village. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan, and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Nuhu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like child school fees, food and farm loan repayments, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Mãe de 3 filhos menores e todos com acesso aescola, tem 37 anos de idade, estudou ate 3ª classe, vive maritalmente, é negociante ambulante a vários anos, conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador de uma empresa de segurança e esta a repetir o credito pela 3ªvez.
Vai usar o valor na compra de telemóveis de vários tipos e referncias, lencois e bijuterias para ampliar o seu negocio.
O seu maior desejo é crescer no negocio, construir uma casa melhor para sua família e desenvolver tal como as outras pessoas que conseguem se dar bem na vida atravez do negocio.
Diz ter o negocio num bom ritmo, embora algumas vezes seus clientes não tem honrado com o compromisso, mas mesmo assim se sente feliz com o mesmo
texts.en:
Isabel is the mother of three underage children, all of whom attend school. She's 37 years old and completed the 3rd grade. She's married. She has been a street vendor for several years. She gets help from her husband who works for a security company. This is her third loan.
She will use the loan to purchase various types and brands of mobile phones, sheets and costume jewelry in order to expand her business.
Her biggest wish is to make her business grow, build a better house for her family, and get ahead like other people who are able to succeed in life through their businesses.
She states that she maintains a good turnover, although sometimes her customers don't honor their commitments. Nevertheless, she's happy with her business.

loans.use: to purchase various types and brands of mobile phones, sheets and costume jewelry in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Sabiran

texts.en: Sabiran is a 54-year-old married woman who has four children. She is motivated to provide her family a good living standard. She has a small business of milk selling and has been doing this business for many years. She sells milk to people of her community. With this business she has been able to get ahead little by little and has tried to improve her quality of life. She has one buffalo and now she wants to increase her income. For this purpose, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to increase milk production and revenue. This will give her the opportunity to continue sustaining her family.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to increase milk production and revenue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new and stylish women's clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
"Eighty percent of Kenyans are farmers, and by that, I mean that people who make a living off of the land, and 80 percent of the food that people eat comes from people who sell in the rural marketplace,” says Benjamin, a 46-year-old mixed farmer based in Moiben, a remote village in the Eldoret area of Kenya. This charming father of seven lovely angels has been engaged in mixed farming for the past 15 years. He commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers in his village. His main source of income has been eggs, milk, and a variety of food crops that he plants. Taking care of his poultry is an activity he finds very enjoyable. Feeding his poultry is his hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Eldoret. 

Benjamin has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market. However, the demand is so high. Being a visionary man, he has always wanted to increase his poultry. He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for marginalized communities is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising men like Benjamin will achieve their dreams and goals. Benjamin believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding of poultry and taking good care of them. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, he is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry meat, he will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve his living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Ubadat

texts.ru: Убадат, 50 лет, замужем, двое детей. У Убадат среднее образование, она на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день Убадат имеет достаточно большой и прибыльный бизнес, у нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 10 овец, также имеется земельный надел - 1,89 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает пшеницу и ячмень. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Убадат обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 8 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Ubadat is 50 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has the equivalent of a high school education and she has been raising livestock and growing crops for the past 25 years.  She currently has a good-size and profitable farming business which consists of two cows and ten sheep.  She also uses 1.89 hectare of irrigated land on which she grows wheat and barley.  She makes a total monthly income of close to 10,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy eight sheep and increase her livestock headcount.  She is planning to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sheep and increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina is an inhabitant of Rudaki district. She is 21 years old and she lives with her parents and three brothers. Parvina has more than three years of experience sewing national women's clothes. Tajiks basically sew dresses and, for this reason, in Tajikistan many girls become dressmakers. Parvina tries each time to improve her work and sew new styles and new models of dresses.

Parvina decided to buy a new, modern sewing machine to facilitate her work and sew much faster. Her current machine is quite outdated and she wants to buy a new one, so that no obstacle will stand in the way of developing her business. Because of lack of finances, Parvina requests a loan to buy a sewing machine. She relies on your responsiveness.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 56-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. She wants to give her family a better living standard. She has been running a business stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. Currently, she has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy more spools of threads in different colors plus packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing her revenue so she is able to generate a healthier source of income. She is on her third loan with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors plus packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue.

loans.name: Elda Vanessa

texts.es: Elda: Es una señora amable, luchadora. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 7 años estableció una pulpería.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, gaseosas, huevo, pan, chivería entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Elda is a very friendly and determined woman. With the goal of having her own source of income, 7 years ago she opened a convenience store. She seeks financing to buy basic grains, dairy products, soda pop, eggs, bread, and other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, soda pop, eggs, bread, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal [46 kilograms] and lime powder.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 33 years old and married with a daughter and a son. His wife is a housekeeper and they are refugees living in an IDP settlement. 

Ramil has been raising and selling vegetables for 12 years and has good skills in this area. His monthly income is 180 AZN. Sometimes in his free time he earns additional money working as an artisan. Raising vegetables is very common in Azerbaijan because vegetables are always in high demand. People buy vegetables in order to cook delicious national dishes.

Ramil is a very kind and responsible father. He wants to provide his children with a good education and a bright future. To reach this goal he has to increase his income and be able to pay for their education. He has applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to buy good fertilizers and new garden tools.

loans.use: to buy good fertilizers and new garden tools.

loans.name: Jeferson Stalin

texts.es:
Jefferson es un joven de 20 años, nacido en la ciudad de Pujilí, es soltero por lo cual aún vive con sus padres en una zona rural de la provincia de Cotopaxi en Ecuador. Gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres terminó la secundaria pero debido a sus bajos ingresos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios en la universidad.
Actualmente se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de pollos, negocio que realiza hace un año. Jefferson aprendió este oficio de su padre, el se vio obligado a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres a mejorar su economía pero a pesar de su esfuerzo este negocio familiar no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos generados en el hogar. 
El joven está solicitando un préstamo porque necesita construir un galopon más grande para los pollos con esto podrá tener un lugar más amplio para sus pollos y así tener más fuentes de ingresos económicos.  
Jefferson  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Jefferson is a 20 year old young man, born in the city of Pujilí. He is single and lives with his parents in a rural area of the province of Cotopaxi in Ecuador. Thanks to his parents' efforts he finished high school, but because of their low income, he was not able to continue with college studies. Currently, he works raising and selling chickens, a business he has done for a year. He learned this job from his father. He had to work in order to help his parents improve their finances, but despite his effort this family business is not enough to pay for household expenses. The young man is requesting a loan, because he needs to build a bigger coop for the chickens. With it he will be able to have a bigger place for his chickens and have more sources of financial income. Jefferson is grateful to the Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making possible the growth in his work and personal life.

loans.use: to build a bigger coop for his chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheeses for her business.

loans.name: Sonia
