texts.pt: A Sonia  vive na casa propria,é mãe solteira de duas filhas uma frequentando a faculdade e outra o ensino secundario, todas estão na sua responsabilidade,ja tentou estar no lar mas não teve sorte e o casamento arruinou se,ela trabalha como secretaria  ja a bom tempo mas pelas dificuldades que tem enfrentado  em garantir boa alimentação os estudos das suas filhas  devido  ao  baixo salario que ganha mensalmente, ela  sentiu se obrigada a fazer  negocio,juntou salario de alguns meses e começou a fezer negocio de blocos para constução civil e atraves de uma vizinha soube da existencia do Banco Hluvuku que dava emprestimos na Vila do Distrito de  Marracuene,foi solicitar o sue 1º emprestimo para aumentar o volume do seu negocio,hoje ela tem um negocio evoluido e nunca tem falta de clientes conta com ajuda de alguns trabalhadores sazonais .Recentemente teve um financiamento de 20.000mt e com este  valor do emprestimo vai  comprar comprar material de conferragem como pranchas,chapas de conferragem  e prumos para estes materiais servirem de aluguer.O seu maior sonho é tornar melhor cliente da Hluvuku e conseguir outros emprestimos para  abrir estaleiro de venda de materiais de construção e assim vai  garantir a formação academica das suas filhas.O seu maior desafio é  afalta de meio de transporte para caregar e fazer entrega do seu produto.
texts.en: Sonia lives in a house that she owns. She's a single mother of two daughters, one of whom is in college and the other is in high school. Both of them are under her responsibility. She tried to be a homemaker, but she had no luck and the marriage fell apart. She has worked as a secretary for a long time. However, since she has been having a difficult time providing food and education for her daughters because of the low salary she earns monthly, she felt compelled to start a business. She saved a few months' salary and started a business making bricks for construction. One of her neighbors told her about Hluvuku and how they provided loans in the village of the district of Marracuene. She went to apply for her first loan so that she could increase turnover in her business. She currenty owns a successful business and she never lacks customers. She gets help from a few seasonal workers. She recently got a loan for 20,000mt and with this amount she will purchase formwork supplies such as planks, formwork sheets, and plumb-bobs. She will rent out these supplies. Her biggest dream is to become Hluvuku's best customer and get other loans in order to open a warehouse to sell construction supplies. That way she'll ensure her daughters' college education. Her biggest challenge is not having a means of transportation for carrying and delivering her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase formwork supplies such as planks, formwork sheets, and plumb-bobs.

loans.name: Omar De La Concepcion

texts.es:
el señor Omar, es un hombre luchador cada día el busca la manera de salir adelante junto a su esposa y tres hijos, el labora como guarda de seguridad.
este crédito lo solicita para la compra de Materiales de Construcción ya que desea ampliar su vivienda para tener así mayor comodidad el y su familia, comprara bloques, cemento y hierro para completar los materiales que necesita. El agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado con este cuarto crédito ya que quiere seguir trabajando con nosotros para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Omar is a man who struggles every day to find a way to get ahead with his wife and three children.  He works as a security guard.
The loan he is requesting is to buy construction materials since he wishes to expand his residence to have more comfort for himself and his family.  He will purchase concrete blocks, cement, and rebar to complete the materials he needs.  He is thankful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic offer to him with this fourth loan since he wants to continue working with us to improve his life conditions.

loans.use: to add on to his residence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, galvanized laminate, and wood to plaster the walls of her home and to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 23-year-old single man from a village near Tulkarm City. He lives with his elderly parents in a small house. His father works as a construction worker with an unstable income. Eyad is also a student at the university. 

Eyad decided to open his own business so he can help his father with part of the family expenses. Eyad has a store for selling clothes. It is a good business and provides a good income to the family.
 
Eyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a winter collection for his store to resell. This will increase his sales and also the family income. 

Eyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a winter collection for his store to resell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  de 55 años de edad quien vive en Sololá, casado con tres hijos. Quien se ha dedicado al trabajo de la tierra como campesino por muchos años pues es el único oficio que le genera ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos de Manuel pues es la actividad que el realiza es agricultor y le gusta  trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de semilla de cebolla y fertilizantes ya que desde un tiempo ha venido trabajando por ello para poder cultivar la tierra con estos productos agrícolas para tener un mejor ingreso económico para sostener a su familia.

Las metas de el es pagar sus deudas con que el cuenta y en un futuro comprar más terrenos para sus hijos y que ellos sean profesionales en la vida en los diferentes campos laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Manuel is 55 years old, he lives in Sololá, and is married with three children. He has been working on the land as a farmer for many years, since it is the only profession that generates an income to support his family.

The land has been blessed by Manuel's hands, because he is a farmer and he likes to work and take care of the land. The work is worthy of admiration, because men devote many years and their entire lives to it. Without the labor of dedicated farmers to cultivate it, the land would not produce the results that are usually maintained by each generation.

The reason for getting the loan is to buy onion seeds and fertilizers since he has been working hard to be able to farm the land using these agricultural products to have a better income and to support his family.

His goals are to pay his debts with what he has and in the future, to buy more land for his children so that they become successful in life in the various fields in the community.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 42-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and six children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years, and he is the only one responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Yasmeen's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, laces, needles and a sewing machine with accessories), but due to some financial constraints he is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purposes. Therefore Yasmeen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to get these tailoring accessories listed above to fulfill his business needs so that he can earn more profitable income.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy tailoring machine and other accessories for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 40-year-old woman, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Shaheen is providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband's to manage the household.

She needs a new sewing machine for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase a sewing machine. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase a sewing machine and is also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María Ester: Es una señora amable, originaria de Waspam, con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 28 años se trasladó a Puerto Cabezas, para vender comida y accesorios de acero. Formo parte de grupos solidarios por dos años, gracias a los créditos otorgados por PANA PANA y a las ganancias percibidas, le permitieron construir dos tramos en el mercado, en uno ofrece venta de comida y en el otro accesorios para mujeres y prendas de acero. Solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de créditos individuales para comprar en Managua cadenas, pulseras, brasaletes, anillos, aretes entre otros productos de acero y venderlos a precios accesibles. Su sueño es establecer una tienda de ropa usada.
texts.en:
María Ester is a friendly woman originally from Waspam. With the goal of creating her own source of income, for 28 years she moved to Puerto Cabezas to sell food and steel accessories. She has been part of a group for two years. Thanks to the loans granted by PANA PANA and the profits generated, she has been able to build two stalls in the market. In one she sells food and in the other women's accessories and items made of steel.

She seeks her first loan in the form of an individual loan to go to Managua to buy necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings and other steel products and sell them at accessible prices. Her dream is to establish a used clothing store.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, rings, earrings and other steel products and sell them at accessible prices.

loans.name: Davis

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Davis. He is a 23-year-old smallholder farmer from Cheboin village in the South Rift region of Kenya. Despite being single with no kids, he still has a family with eight siblings that he helps to look after. Davis started farming on a four-acre piece of land soon after his secondary education. He grows crops and keeps dairy animals on the farm. The land also has 50 trees and a well. 

Davis is seeking a loan of 35,000 KES to purchase poultry. With this amount, he can purchase a significantly large number of chickens that will produce eggs, meat and feathers for sale. He will also collect manure that will replace a portion of the inorganic fertilizer used on the farm. Income from the investment will help Davis meet his basic needs. Additional profits will go back into the business to enhance growth.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Kumushoy

texts.en:
Kumushoy is a smart and hardworking girl. She is not married. Kumushoy lives with her parents. Her father is a rental worker and her mother is a farmer. 

Kumushoy has applied to the pedagogical faculty with the aim of getting a higher education. Kumushoy is a first course student, and she is one of the smart and successful students.

She is asking for a loan to pay for her university tuition as her parents are poor people and have a small income. She awaits your mercy. She dreams to be a good specialist in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Yanira Elizabeth

texts.es: Yanira tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de  17 años y 13 años de edad. Yanira se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de sandalias y  ropa. Yanira desea construir una pila para almacenar el agua potable dado que la pila que tiene actualmente se encuentra agrietada y el agua se filtra. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales como: arena, cemento, ladrillo, grava, etc. para construir la pila.
texts.en: Yanira is 43-years old and lives in her own home with her two children, who are 17- and 13-years old respectively.  Yanira earns her living selling a variety of sandals and clothing.  She wants to build a basin for potable water storage, as the basin she currently has is cracked, and the water leaks out. To build her new basin, Yanira is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of material such as sand, cement, brick, gravel etc.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, gravel etc. to build a water collection basin.

loans.name: Cecilia Marisol

texts.es: Cecilia de 28 años de edad vive junto a su madre y su esposo desde hace 18 años en vivienda humilde pero propia. Ella es una mujer que se esfuerza cada día por ganarse la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar, además su esposo le apoya con la economía de su hogar apoyado en su trabajo en una empresa cercana. Cecilia tiene el firme deseo de construir un muro de contención en su vivienda, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda.
texts.en: Cecilia is 28-years old and has lived, for eighteen years, with her mother and husband in a home that is humble, but which belongs to them.  Cecilia is a woman who works hard each day to earn a living by offering domestic services.  In addition, her husband contributes to the household finances by working for a nearby company.  Cecilia has the firm desire to build a retaining wall for her house, which is why she made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI.  She will invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build her home's retaining wall.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a retaining wall for her house.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a single 27-year-old photographer. He has been in the photography business for eight years.

With the loan, he would like to buy a photo printing machine, and also buy an extra camera for hire. This is his 2nd loan cycle with VisionFund Kenya. He hopes to expand his photography business and be the ideal choice for photography in his region.

loans.use: to buy a photo printing machine

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: yawa âgée de  37  ans est de nationalité Togolaise. yawa est  mariée  et mère de 2 enfants tous scolarisés habite à Lomé  dans le quartier adidogomé. elle est revendeuse  de produits d'alimentation générale et s’approvisionne 1 fois par mois au  grand marché de Lomé. elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter  son  commerce et les moyens nécessaires pour prendre soins des enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is a 37-year-old Togolese national. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. Yawa lives in Lomé, in the Adidogomé district. She sells staple foods, stocking up once a month at the main market of Lomé. She is seeking a loan which would allow her to expand her business and earn the revenue necessary to provide for her children.

loans.use: to buy 20 baskets of pepper, 25 packs of bouillon cubes and 20 packs of cookies in order to increase her sales and support her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and improve his utilities so that he can have a family in the future.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
La vida le dio una oportunidad para trabajar como empleado de una tienda de consumos diarios.  Era lo que él esperaba, no sólo una puerta abierta sino lo que estaba detrás de esa puerta.  Y lo que encontró fue algo que definió lo que él quería ser. Alberto de 48 años de edad tiene 7 hijos, 3 de los primeros hijos ya tienen vida independiente y los 4 últimos son excelentes  estudiantes en su comunidad y son excelentes estudiantes, el a querido abrir puertas para el futuro para sus hijos para que ellos tengan las condicione de vidas adecuadas en el futuro.

La actividad que el desempeña con todo empeño es la venta de abarrotería en su comunidad dicho negocio a el le a funcionado porque no tiene mucha competencia por el lugar y eso le genera ganancias para poder sustentar a su familia que tanto lo necesitan, para tener una condición de vida adecuada en un futuro no muy lejano.

El uso respectivo que le dará al crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de mercadería de abarrotaría para así tener  surtido su tienda para no perder su clientela con que el cuenta y así obtener mejores ingresos para el beneficio de su familia. Uno de los sueños de Alberto es ver crecer a sus hijos y convertirse en profesionales en el campo de la educación y llegar a niveles importantes en empresas de prestigios.
texts.en:
Life gave him an opportunity to work as an employee of a convenience store.  It was what he hoped, not only an open door, but what was behind the door.  What he found was something that defined what he wanted to be.  Alberto is 48 years old and has seven children.  The three older children are independent adults, and the four younger are excellent students in the community.  He wants to open doors for the future of his children so that they have good living conditions in the future.

He works tirelessly selling groceries in his community.  This business has worked because he does not have much competition in the area and he is able to generate profits to be able to support his family in all that they need.  They will have suitable living conditions in the not distant future.

Alberto is requesting this loan to purchase groceries so that his store is stocked.  He will not lose customers that he counts on and he will earn more income to benefit his family.  One of Alberto's dreams is to see his children grow up, graduate from school, and get important jobs in prestigious businesses.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Most of Kenya’s young people struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment and lack of capital. This is true for Mercy, 24, who is based in the Eldoret area of Kenya and is a mother of five adorable lovely children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years, and she has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal businesses she engages in to make ends meet. She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated “feeding my cows.” Her hobby is milking Sirikwa (the name of her dairy cow). She sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. 

The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will produce between 10-15 litres of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profit and increased income levels. Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying back the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Mercy is very ambitious. In the near future she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling, and she also plans to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Esperanza Concepcion

texts.es: Esperanza de 48 años de edad es una mujer que siempre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija desde hace 30 años en vivienda propia, además su compañero de vida le apoya con la economía de su hogar por medio de su trabajo como motorista, el cual realiza desde hace 6 años obteniendo muy buenos ingresos. Esperanza desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por lo que ha decidido repellar las paredes de su vivienda y construir una pared en la cocina, para ello Esperanza solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para repellar las paredes de su vivienda y construir una pared en la cocina.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 48, is a woman who is always seeking a way to get her family ahead lending her domestic services to the household.  For thirty years, she has been living together with her life partner and her daughter in her own residence.  Furthermore, her life partner supports the household economy through his work as a driver which he has been doing for six years making a good income.  
Esperanza wants to improve the quality of the life of her family so she has decided to plaster the walls of her residence and construct a wall in the kitchen.  For this, Esperanza is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar in order to plaster the walls of her residence and to construct a wall in the kitchen.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and rebar to plaster the walls of her residence and construct a wall in the kitchen.

loans.name: Paulina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Paulina es una joven de 24 años, nació en el cantón Pujilí, de la provincia de Cotopaxi, perteneciente a la República del Ecuador. Es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres en una zona rural. 
Con mucho sacrificio de sus padres pudo terminar sus estudios superiores pero sin embrago la ha sido difícil encontrar trabajo por lo cual se ha visto obligada ha dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pollos. Paulina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más pollos ya que por el momento solo cuenta con una pequeña cantidad, esto ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y sustentar sus ventas para no perder sus clientes. 
Vino a la Fundación ya que es recomendada de un cliente nuestro, para Paulina es muy importante que se le ayude con este crédito ya que de esto vive y puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre.
Paulina agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Paulina is a 24 year old woman who was born in the Pujilí Canton in the Cotopaxi province of the Republic of Ecuador. She is single and lives with her parents in a rural area. Her parents sacrificed to allow her to finish her studies, but it has been difficult for her to find a job, so she has had to raise and sell chickens for a living. Paulina is requesting a loan to buy more chickens as, at the moment, she depends on just a few. This loan will help her increase her income and maintain her sales as to not lose clients. She came to the Foundation as one of its clients recommended it to her. For Paulina, it is very important to help herself with this loan because it is related to the way she makes a living and it would allow her to help with household expenses and follow in her mother's example. Paulina thanks Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making it possible for her to grow in both her personal and professional life.

loans.use: to buy more chickens which will help her to increase sales and keep her customers. Also, this revenue will help with expenses related to her home.

loans.name: Benash

texts.en:
Benash is a 21-year-old young woman. She has been running a beauty parlor business for many years. 

Benash offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. By providing her best services, her business has become well-known in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products for her parlor. For this reason she requires a loan of 30,000 PKR in order to buy hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams as a means to increase revenue. 

With this investment Benash can increase her profits, with which she can improve her business substantially, as well as support her family.

loans.use: to buy hair and skin care products and bleaching and whitening creams.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 29-year-old married man from Rafah City. He lives with his wife and their three sons and one daughter. 

Shadi is an employee in a local company where he earns an income not sufficient to cover all of his family's needs. Shadi and his wife would like to improve their family's living conditions and afford the items they require.
 
Shadi requested a Murabaha-type loan in U.S. dollars from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help Shadi to buy a new water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Shadi will be able to provide clean water for his kids. 

Shadi appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to buy a new water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos de 13 años, 10 años, 6 años y 3 años de edad. Ana se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su familia y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen el equilibrio económico de su familia. Ana desea mejorar las condiciones del piso de la vivienda dado que actualmente es de tierra y no es muy higiénico para sus hijos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and lives in her own house together with her life partner and their four children, ages 13, 10, 6 and 3. Ana has earned a living selling pork for a long time. In this way, she sustains her family, and together with her partner, maintains economic balance for her family. 

Ana wants to improve the condition of the floor in her home, because it's currently made of earth and isn't very clean for her children. Because of that, she's seeking this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to cement the house's floor.

loans.name: Willian Alexander

texts.es: Willian de 28 años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia cada día apoyado en su negocio de elaboración de estructuras metálicas, el cual realiza a domicilio desde hace 4 años. Él es un joven trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad. Willian está tratando de mejorar sus condiciones de vida poco a poco, es por ello que anteriormente solicitó a la institución un crédito para construir un cuarto de lámina ya que el que tenia se encontraba deteriorado, y ya que le gusto tanto la experiencia ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, y lograr así ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Willian, 28 years old, is a man who puts in effort to bring up his family, supporting them every day in his business creating metal structures. He's done this from home for four years. 

He's a hardworking young man who lives in his own home together with his life partner and their little five year old girl. Willian is trying to improve his life conditions little by little. It's because of this that he sought a loan earlier from the institution to build a room made of sheet, as the one he had was deteriorated. 

He liked the experience so much he's seeking a new loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet, poles and pins to change the roof of his home. This way, he'll succeed in improving his life conditions.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet, poles and pins to change the roof of his house.

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.en:
Zebiniso works as a specialist in the Court of Khuroson district. She is 46 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband, like a majority of men from the countryside, is a migrant laborer in Russia. He is forced to work away from his family in order to earn and provide for them.
 
Their son is a student, and he is studying full-time at the Tajik National University in the Faculty of Law. As a future lawyer, he studies the laws and legal issues diligently.

Currently the family needs to borrow money to pay for his tuition. His annual cost for the 2014-2015 year is slightly over $2,000. Therefore Zebiniso has requested a loan. 

Zebiniso hopes that Kiva lenders will support her request, so she will be able to make her son's tuition payments.

Zebiniso wants to see her son become a good lawyer in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's higher education tuition.

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es:
Sandra de 29 años de edad, estudio bachillerato, esta soltera, vive con sus abuelos.

 Sandra es empleada trabaja de promotora y ademas de ello también trabaja en la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de sus abuelos, esta actividad que realiza juntamente con su familia, la distancia del trabajo a su hogar es de unos 15 metros.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y pesticidas para la milpa,  con lo cual espera tener una cosecha abundante.

El sueño de Sandra es seguir trabajando y sacar adelante a su familia, darle una mejor vida a sus abuelos, mejorar sus condiciones economicas.
texts.en:
Sandra is 29 years old, received her baccalaureate degree, is single, and lives with her grandparents. Sandra is currently employed as a sales representative and also works in agriculture, a trade that she learned from her grandparents. She works together with her family about 15 meters away from her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cornfield, from which she hopes to yield an abundant harvest.

Sandra's dream is to keep working and help her family advance, to give a better life to her grandparents, and to improve their economic situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cornfield, from which she hopes to yield an abundant harvest

loans.name: Humay

texts.en: Humay is 42 years old. She lives with her husband, mother-in-law and 2 sons. Humay and her family are farmers. They own a greenhouse where different vegetables are cultivated. She is a very enthusiastic woman willing to improve her family’s condition. This requested loan of 1,500 AZN will help her to renovate the greenhouse and purchase seeds and fertilizer to fight against diseases. As this is Humay's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Aqroinvest CU. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Humay will be very grateful if lenders support her agribusiness.

loans.use: to renovate her greenhouse and purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ana Deysi

texts.es: Ana de 63 años de edad es una persona honesta y responsable que se gana la vida elaborando prendas de vestir por encargo, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive junto a sus 5 sobrinos en vivienda propia desde hace 20 años y se siente feliz y bendecida de contar con un lugar propio donde vivir. Ana tiene el deseo de remodelar el baño de su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez necesaria, es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloques de cemento, arena, grava, cemento, y hierro para construir un baño en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana is 63 years old and is an honest and responsible person. She earns a living making custom clothing, and thanks to this, she has been able to bring up her family. 

She's lived together with her five nieces and nephews in their own home for 20 years. She feels happy and blessed to be able to count on their own place to live. 

Ana has a desire to remodel the bathroom of their home, but doesn't have the liquidity necessary. Because of this, she's seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement blocks, sand, gravel, cement and iron to build a new bathroom in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cement blocks, sand, gravel, cement and iron to build a bathroom in her house.

loans.name: Lionza

texts.es: Lionza: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, desde hace más de una década estableció su negocio de venta ropa usada, ropa nueva, calzados, ropa interior entre otros productos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y diversificar sus productos.
texts.en: Lionza is a friendly woman who is originally from Puerto Cabezas. More than a decade ago, she created her own business selling used clothes, new clothes, footwear, underwear, and other products. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise in Managua to sell at affordable prices. Her dream is to have a thriving business and sell a variety of products.

loans.use: to boys' shoes, girls' shoes, sandals, hats, shirts, pants, and other products in Managua.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is a married woman with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Felicisima is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Felicisima has a meat-vending business in the Philippines. Felicisima has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more meat to sell to her customers.

Felicisima has been in this business for 7 years. Felicisima would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alh.habu

texts.en:
Alh. Habu is a maize farmer from Katsalle village. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Habu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Habu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Alh. Habu said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses like childrens' school fees, food, and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Toka village.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Haruna said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to access a loan to meet urgent expenses like children's school fees, food, and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Habi

texts.en:
Habi is a maize farmer from Tube village.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Habi would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habi can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Habi said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like children's school fees, food, and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed M is a maize farmer from Gwanki village.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ahmed M would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmed M can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Ahmed M said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like children's school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Qizbast

texts.en:
Qizbast is a 28 year old married refugee.  She has a daughter and a son. Her husband is a laborer and they live in an IDP settlement. The family's main source of income is gardening. Qizbast has been raising and selling seasonal fruits and vegetables for 5 years. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. 

Fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People buy fruits to make juice or fruit salad and use vegetables to cook delicious national dishes such as dovgha, doghramajh, and kuku.

Qizbast’s income doesn't cover the family’s needs. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to build a greenhouse and buy good fertilizers. This will increase the harvest and in turn her income. She will be able to provide her children with a good life and an education.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 50-year-old married man and he has 3 kids. The members of his family are refugees and they have lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Murad's wife is a housekeeper and educates girls. 

Murad has been growing and selling seasonal vegetables for 20 years and his monthly income is 220 AZN. He has good skills in this area and knows what his customers prefer. 

Murad sells vegetables at a local bazaar for his regular customers and for restaurants. The restaurant chefs buy their vegetable supplies from Murad all the time because products there are always fresh and clean.

Murad's income doesn’t cover his family’s requirements. He applied for 1200 AZN in order to buy seeds and grow new sorts of vegetables and fruits. This will expand his grocery assortment, increase his income, and also mean that Murad will be able to provide his lovely daughters with a good education and bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and grow new sorts of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Nelson Enrrique

texts.es: Don Nelson tiene 35 años de edad habitante de Ticuantepe, tiene negocio propio, casado. El solicita este crédito para la compra de Pollo, Embutidos y Lácteos como crema, leches etc. ya que en esta temporada sus clientes que le compran al por mayor le solicitan mucho producto, el señor Nelson nos comenta que Agradece el apoyo que Kiva le ha brindado durante 7 financiamientos que ha recibo para mejorar sus condiciones en el negocio y en su hogar ya que con las ganancias obtenidas el ha podido ir construyendo su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nelson is 35 years old and a resident of Ticuantepe. He has his own business and is married. He's seeking this loan to buy chicken, sausage and dairy such as cream, milk, etc. In this season, his customers who buy in bulk are asking for a lot of product. 

Nelson told us that thank to the support Kiva has given him through the seven loans he's received, he's improved conditions in his business and home. With the income he's earned, he has been able to go on constructing his home.

loans.use: to buy dairy, chicken and sausage.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 38 years old and married with four children who are all in school. Aileen works very hard to provide for them.

Aileen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Aileen has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, sugar, laundry soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Aileen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Francisca is 44 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Francisca has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, flour, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Francisca has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like cooking oil, flour, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Eldoret area of Kenya. Pamela, aged 29, and the mother of three boys and one girl, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary source of income has been selling eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. 

Pamela, who is an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early-riser and she wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cow. Although this humble mom has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. 

Pamela is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. Through the loan she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help fully satisfy the demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a Kiva field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en:
Yunusa is a maize farmer from Lado village.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yunusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yunusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Yunusa said: “I would now be able use this extra income to expand my farmland, and eventually, I hope to become the most profitable farmer in my community.”

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses like children's school fees, food and farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices, increasing incomes by up to 37%.

loans.name: Luis Jorge

texts.es:
Luis es un joven ecuatoriano de 23 años de edad, nacido en la ciudad de Sigchos de Ecuador. Es soltero, vive en casa de familiares en un sector rural de la ciudad, donde la gente se dedica a la ganadería. Gracias al esfuerzo de los padres pudo terminar solamente la primaria, ya que desde muy pequeño tuvo que trabajar para ayudar en los gastos de la familia.
Debido a que Luis es un joven trabajador y emprendedor empezó desde hace varios años un negocio independiente  de crianza y yuta de novillos, con esto ha podido solventar un poco sus gastos.
Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar toretes y vaconas, Luis busca formar un negocio estable que le permita avanzar, desarrollarse personalmente e independizarse.  A pesar de que Luis solo estudio hasta la primaria él busca preparase para tener conocimientos sobre negocios de ganadería y así superarse.
Luis  agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Luis is a young Ecuadorian man who is 23 years old and was born in the city of Sigchos in Ecuador. He lives at home with his family in a rural area of the city where people breed cattle. Thanks to the efforts of his parents he was able to finish primary education. From a very young age, he had to work to help with the household expenses. Since Luis is a hardworking and self-motivated young man, he started his own business of raising young bulls a few years ago, which has allowed him to pay for some of his expenses. 

He currently needs a loan to buy young bulls and female cows. Luis is looking to build a stable business that will let him move forward, develop himself personally and become independent. Despite the fact that Luis only finished primary education, he is looking to study so he has knowledge related to the business of raising cattle to improve himself.

Luis is grateful for Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and for Kiva for making this growth in his work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy young bulls and female cows so he can build a business that will let him move forward, develop himself personally and become independent.

loans.name: Jacinto Geremías

texts.es:
Uno de los servicios públicos de mucho contacto con las personas de Sololá  es el transporte público.  Las personas suben y bajan para transportarse cada día.  Cada una de ellos tiene su historia.  Pero también los transportistas o choferes también una variedad de historias personales y vivencias.

Jacinto, de 38 años y padre de 5 hijos, aprendió a ser chofer mientras vivía con su padre y fue como él también lo aprendió, con un poco de ahorro que el tenia  compró un vehículo y se dedicó a este servicio público de transporte el lleva en dicha actividad más de 6 años y le ha ido muy bien y le ha generado un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia.

El ha solicitado un préstamo para darle el mantenimiento requerido por el vehículo y poder servir de esa manera a su comunidad, además que su actividad laboral es una fuente de ingresos para su familia.

Dentro de sus metas es lograr comprar otro vehículo y ampliar su negocio.  Y como resultado darles un mejor panorama económico a sus hijos.  Mientras los pasajeros de suben y bajan en su vehículo llevan sus propias vidas como Jacinto la suya.
texts.en:
One of the public services people from Sololá have contact with most frequently is public transportation. People get on and off to transport themselves everyday. Each one of them has a story. But the drivers or chauffeurs also have a variety of personal histories and lives.

Jacinto, who is 38 years old and has five children, learned to chauffeur while he was living with his father, and this was how he learned. With a little bit of savings he had, he bought a vehicle and dedicated himself to the public service of transportation. He's been doing this activity for more than six years and it's been going very well, earning him an income for the benefit of his family.

He has asked for a loan to give his vehicle its required maintenance and be able to servce his community in this way. His labor is also a source of income for his family.

Among his goals is buying another vehicle and expanding his business, and giving his children a better economic outlook as a result. While the passengers get on and get off of his vehicle, it carries each person's life, as well as Jacinto's.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina comes from Tajikistan, and she was born in the year 1965. Marina is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a business man. Marina is a sewer, and she has been busy sewing women's clothes for 4 years. She sews a variety of women's clothes including dresses, robes, trousers, etc. She provides sewing services from her house. Many of her neighbors and relations are her clients. Marina tries to sew high quality clothes, and she is always in search of new fashions. Marina is asking for a loan to buy an embroidery machine and fabrics to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and fabrics to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, chocolate drinks, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his concrete block machine, which has broken down, so that he can continue working and expanding his business every day

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz has successfully built her general store business with the support from both the Kashf Foundation and Kiva lenders. By now, she has attained a good number of customers, and she makes a good income which contributes to her family's income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva lenders Shehnaz was able to expand her business. Now Shehnaz is on her 8th loan cycle, and she has now applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR so she can purchase packages of salt, sweets, biscuits, juices, grains, and rice to supply her customers’ demands. 

Shehnaz dreams of expanding her business and providing a prosperous future for all her family members.

loans.use: to purchase packages of salt, sweets, biscuits, juices, grains, and rice to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Rasula

texts.en:
Rasula is a 49 year old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She makes enough money to provide for her family. 

She offers a variety of grocery items, at reasonable prices, and has retained many regular customers. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for 40,000 PKR. She will use this loan to purchase stock, such as rice, sugar, biscuits, grains, oil and flour, from the market at lower rates and thereby consistently meet the increasing demand for products.

Rasula wishes to utilize part of her revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as rice, sugar, biscuits, grains, oil  and flour.

loans.name: Maximo Odon

texts.es: Don Máximo nació en Jinotega en el año 1974 y ahí ha vivido toda su vida, asistió a la escuela de su comunidad y culminó sus estudios de primaria y secundaria. Su padre tenía una finca donde él y sus hermanos viajaban los fines de semana para ayudar en las labores del campo, a Maximo le fue gustando mucho el campo y por eso decidió estudiar agronomía. Su padre falleció hace 5 años y le heredó a Maximo la finca para que siguiera trabajando la tierra. Maximo tiene 3 hijos y a ellos también les gusta ir a la finca. En la comunidad donde viven Máximo y su familia no existe la energía eléctrica, es por eso que el desea obtener un pequeño sistema solar para que su familia pueda iluminarse durante la noche, además su familia se levanta muy temprano a cocinar durante la temporada de corte de café, si tiene un sistema solar podrá iluminarse también durante la madrugada.
texts.en: Don Máximo was born in Jinotega in 1974.  He has lived there all his life.  He went to his community's school and finished primary and secondary school there.  His father had a farm, and on the weekends Máximo and his siblings would travel to the farm to work.  Maximo enjoyed the country very much, and that is why he decided to study agronomy.  His father passed away five years ago, and he left the farm to Maximo so he could continue working the land.  Maximo has three children, and they also like going to the farm.  The community where Máximo and his family live does not have electricity, which is why he wants to get a small solar system.  That way his family can have lights at night.  In addition, his family gets up very early to cook during the coffee cutting season, and if he had a solar system, they could have lights in the early morning as well.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan is thirty-four years old and is married with five children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Ivan operates a textile shop of new clothes at retail price and has been in that business for seven years. He also does farming, growing crops such as maize, beans, cotton, and G nuts. Ivan has a dream of growing his business into a wholesale business. However, he is faced with a challenge of thieves who robbed him in 2012. 

Ivan is a hardworking man requesting a loan to buy ready-made clothes, shoes, and other textiles for selling.

loans.use: to buy ready-made clothes, shoes, and other textiles for selling.

loans.name: Keni Yamileth

texts.es: Keni de 31 años de edad es una mujer que siempre da lo mejor de sí para salir adelante junto a su hija de 16 años de edad con la cual habita en vivienda humilde pero propia desde hace 31 años, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con un lugar propia donde vivir, además se siente muy orgullosa de estar sacando adelante a su hija como madre soltera. Keni siempre busca la manera de ganarse la vida, es por ello que desde hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su domicilio. Keni tiene el deseo de construir un  muro de retención en su vivienda, el cual le permita dar mayor protección a su vivienda, tomando en cuenta que solo vive con su hija, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un muro de retención en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Keni, 31, is a woman who always gives the best of herself so she can get ahead with her 16-year-old daughter, who lives with her in the house she has lived in for 31 years.  It's a modest house, but it's her own, and she's happy to have a place of her own to live.  Also, as a single mother, she's very proud of getting her daughter ahead.

Keni always tries to find ways to earn a living, so for two years she has worked making and selling tortillas at home.

Keni wants to build a retention wall around her house so it's safer, keeping in mind that she lives only with her daughter.  Consequently, she decided to ask FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a retention wall around her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to build a retention wall around her house

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 37-year-old married woman. She began a ‘tandoor’ business (clay oven used for cooking in North India and Pakistan) with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo.  

They bake chapati and naan for the people of their community and also take orders from nearby hotels. With this business they are able to earn enough money to have a decent life. 

Abida is a mother of 5 and is motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with a good education, food, and clothing. 

Abida has been able to improve her business so that she is now meeting the day-to-day expenses of life. This is Abida's sixth year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with their support. 

Now, Abida has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase sacks of flour and packages of salt and oil so she can cater to more customers.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour and packages of salt and oil to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Noralma

texts.es:
Recinto Amanecer Campesino un lugar hermoso de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos en este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Noralma una mujer luchadora de 34 años de edad ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos el primero tiene 17 años el cual ya trabaja y estudia por su cuenta y la última tiene 7 años de edad, ella es una mujer humilde y trabajadora la cual día a día lucha y se esfuerza mucho para darles los mejor posible a sus hijos, ella trabaja un promedio de 9 horas diarias su negocio de venta comidas rápidas, de la misma que aprendió por iniciativa propia. 
En su vida ha tenido muchos obstáculos pero el más fuerte fue la mala relación que llevo con su esposo lo cual los llevo a la separación, desde ese momento tuvo que trabajar mucho y muy fuerte para salir adelante con sus hijos por lo que no tiene mucho tiempo libre para compartir con ellos.
La señora Noralma tiene muchos sueños futuros uno de ellos y el que más le gustaría obtener es construir su propia casa, este préstamo ayudara a Noralma a mejorar su calidad vida ya que lo invertirá en la ampliación y arreglos del negocio para obtener mayor clientela,  agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la ayuda y la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Amanecer Campesino Precinct is a beautiful place with a warm, humid climate.  It is full of friendly, hard-working people and is located in the north-west of Pichincha Province, San Miguel de los Bancos Canton.  
Señora Noralma lives and has her business in the Canton.  She is a 34-year old, hard-working woman who is the single mother of three children.  The eldest is 17-years old and works and studies on her own.  The youngest is 7-years old.  Señora Noralma is a humble, hard-working woman who puts forth a great effort each day to give her children the best.  She works about nine hours a day in her business selling fast food.  She learned the business on her own initiative. 
Señora Noralma has had many obstacles in her life.  Her greatest obstacle was the bad relationship she had with her husband, which lead to them separating.  From that moment, Señora Noralma had to work a lot and very hard to get ahead with her children.  As such, she doesn't have a lot of free time to spend with them.
Señora Noralma has a lot of  hopes for her future.  One of her hopes, and the one she would most like to see happen, is to build her own house.  This loan will help Noralma to improve her quality of life, as she will invest it in expanding and fixing up her business.  That way, she will gain a larger clientele.  Señora Noralma is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for their help and for the opportunity to improve her own quality of life along with that of her children.

loans.use: to expand and fix-up her business, which will help her to improve her quality of life and to later build a home for herself and her children.

loans.name: Haxverdi

texts.en:
Haxverdi is a 48-year-old refugee. He is married and has five sons. His wife is a housekeeper and they live in an IDP settlement. 

Haxverdi is a gardener and has grown seasonal fruit (apple, cherry, pears, etc) and vegetables for 22 years. He sells his harvest at the local bazaar and gets 220 AZN for this monthly.

Gardening is in high demand in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for fresh fruit and vegetables. They use fruit to make fresh juice and use vegetables to cook national dishes.

Haxverdi’s income doesn’t cover the family’s requirements and he applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to purchase new kinds of fruit trees and cultivate them. He wants to expand his assortment of groceries and increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase new kinds of fruit trees and cultivate them

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 33 years old and is married with three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business in Kisumu town for the past seven years. This is his first loan cycle with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to use it to service his motorcycle and improve his transport business. His future hopes is to grow his business to great heights and have several transport motorcycles and employ young men to run them.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and improve his transport business

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 16 años, 14 años, 9 años y 3 años de edad. María se dedica a la crianza y venta de pescado y pollos de engorde desde hace mucho tiempo. María desea mejorar las condiciones del piso del corredor de su  vivienda dado que actualmente es de tierra y cuando llueve el agua se filtra.  Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de  cemento, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora del piso lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 37-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their four children who are 16-, 14-, 9-, and 3-years old respectively.  María has made her living raising and selling fish and broiler chickens for a long time.  She wants to improve the condition of the hallway floor in her home.  It is earthen, and when it rains, the water leaks through.  Because of that, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI so she can invest in the purchase of cement, sand and gravel.  She hopes she can count on this financing so she can start her flooring project as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and gravel to pour a cement floor in her home's hallway.

loans.name: Irma Graciela

texts.es:
Recinto la Armenia un lugar tranquilo de clima frío seco, rodeado de gente amable y trabajadora que tradicionalmente realizan las festividades en honor a la fundación del recinto, realizan encuentros deportivos y bailes generales, el mismo se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha. 
En este recinto vive y tiene el negocio la señora Irma una mujer luchadora, ella es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 10 años por el que día a día lucha y se esfuerza para darle un mejor futuro y sea un profesional, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir  por catálogo aprendió de esta actividad junto con una amiga a quien le ayudaba a entregar pedidos, a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 6 horas por día, también tiene un empleo en una hostería del sector solicita el crédito para invertir en el negocio comprando más mercadería por temporada, con esta nueva inversión mejora su calidad de vida ya que tendrá un mejor ingreso económico.
La señora Irma agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
The neighborhood of Armenia is a quiet place with a cold, dry climate. It is surrounded by friendly and hardworking people who traditionally performed  festivities in honor of the founding of the site, perform dances and engage in sporting events.  It is located northwest of the province of Pichincha.

In this neighborhood, Irma lives and works. Irma a fighter.  She is a single mother of a 10-year old child and day to day struggles and strives to provide a better future and be a professional.  She works at selling clothing via catalogs.  She learned from this activity with a friend who helped her prepare orders.

She devotes an average of 6 hours per day to this work.  Also she has a job in a local shop and is requesting a loan to invest in the business by buying more seasonal merchandise.  With this new investment, she can improve the quality of her life as she will have a better income.  Irma thanks Alternative Foundation and Kiva for the support and the opportunities provided.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise, thus improve her quality of life and that of her son.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of both the Kashf Foundation and Kiva lenders. 

Currently Aziz supplies a good number of customers and makes good earnings which she contributes to the family's income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva lenders, she was able to expand her business. Now Aziz is on her 7th loan cycle. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another cow. 

This loan will enable Aziz to expand her milk sales to more cities and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: George Alexander

texts.es:
George es un joven muy emprendedor y responsable, actualmente se dedica a brindar servicios de vigilancia en su ciudad natal, Rupa Rupa. Por falta de recursos económicos en su casa no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, por ello se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo para apoyar a su familia. Él cree que le está yendo bien porque siempre se esfuerza mucho para poder realizar un buen trabajo y sobre todo porque actúa de manera correcta.
George está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá cubrir sus gastos de movilidad de su vivienda hasta su centro laboral que está un poco lejos, con esto él no tendrá ningún inconveniente y realizará su labor de manera tranquila. Más adelante espera poder abrir su propio negocio de venta de ropas.
texts.en:
George is an industrious and responsible young man. He currently makes a living providing security services in his home city, Rupa Rupa. Due to a lack of economic resources at home, he was not able to study for a professional career, so he needed to find a job to support his family. He believes that it is going well for him as he always makes an effort to do a good job and because he always acts appropriately.

George is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help that they have given him, he can cover his transportation costs to his place of work, which is a bit far away. With this help, he won't have any problems and will be able to work peacefully. In the future, he hopes to start his own business selling clothing.

loans.use: pay for transportation costs from his home to place of work

loans.name: Elmer Julian

texts.es:
Elmer es un padre de familia muy dedicado, tiene 37 años y vive en Aguaytia junto a su maravillosa familia. Desde hace muchos años se dedica a brindar servicios de limpieza en las chacras y terrenos agrícolas, el trabajo que realiza es de poda de plantas, deshierbo, entre otros. Con el fruto de su trabajo está sacando adelante a sus hijos quienes son su mayor motivación en la vida y a quienes quiere brindarles todo lo mejor porque quiere que tengan un futuro diferente, ya que él no pudo terminar el colegio debido a la baja economía que había en su hogar cuando era pequeño.
Elmer tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual siembra cacao, y precisamente piensa utilizar el crédito para poder realizar el mantenimiento y abonamiento de sus cultivos para obtener una mejor producción. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que gracias a esto podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer, 37, is a very devoted father to his family.  He lives in Aguaytia with his wonderful family.

For many years, Elmer has earned a living offering weeding services on farms and agricultural fields.  He prunes plants, weeds, and performs other tasks.  He's getting his children ahead with the fruit of his labor.  They are his biggest motivation in life, and he wants to give them all the best.  He wants them to have a different future, because he wasn't able to finish school because of the low income in his household when he was young.

Elmer has a small plot of land where he grows cacao.  He plans to use the loan specifically to take care of the land and apply soil amendments to his fields to get a better crop.

He's very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity.  He wants them to know that he'll be able to improve his family's quality of life thanks to their help.

loans.use: to apply soil amendments and to take care of his cacao crop

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and clothes, and good health. 

Rabia has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house for many years. The man shown in this picture is her husband; he also assists her by purchasing stock from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Rabia wants to grow her business but her greatest obstacle is to have sufficient capital to increase her sales and obtain better earnings. She requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to buy packs of oil, flour, sugar, salt and beverages to cope with the increasing demand in her store. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy packs of oil, flour, sugar, salt and beverages to cope with the increasing demand in her store.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 48-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business selling garments. Balqees has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality material in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently Balqees is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a selection of new kinds of ladies’ and gents’ clothes. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of new kinds of ladies’ and gents’ clothes.

loans.name: Abdurahman

texts.en:
Abdurahman is 61 years old with a daughter and two sons. His wife is a farmer and raises seasonal vegetables and fruits. He is a pensioner and his   monthly income is 180 AZN. Unfortunately, this income isn't enough to cover his big family's demands.
Abdurahman's house was in bad condition and they have repaired it. Now, he needs to repair old water pipes which have been spoiled during the last severe winter. He needs it because without water, his wife won't be able to raise fruits and vegetable and family's income will go down.
Abdurahman applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to buy high quality materials for new water pipes and be able to support the family's income.

loans.use: to repair old water pipes.

loans.name: Jose Trancito

texts.es: José tiene 56 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijas de 5 años, 8 años, 10 años y 12 años de edad. Él es un hombre caracterizado por ser muy responsable y trabajador. Se dedica a la prestación de servicios de albañilería y además, es agricultor. De esta forma junto al apoyo de su esposa quien es comerciante mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pared en su vivienda dado que es de adobe y se encuentra en mal estado y no es muy segura. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro, etc.
texts.en: José is 56-years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their four children who are 5-, 8-, 10-, and 12-years old respectively.  José is a man known for being very responsible and a hard worker.  He makes his living offering brick-laying services and as a farmer.  In this way, he and his wife, who is a shopkeeper, maintain the household finances.  The desire to improve his living conditions has lead José to request a loan from FUSAI.  He will invest in building a wall for his home.  The wall currently in place is made of adobe, is in disrepair and is not very safe.  With the requested sum, José will purchase cement, sand, brick, iron etc.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, brick, iron etc. to build a wall for his house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 58 year old hardworking widow, blessed with one child and has been a farmer for a period of ten years earning herself an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Grace is now servicing her 8th loan of KES. 40,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy more farm inputs, seedlings and fertilizers.

Grace plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to her child and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta 2°grado de educación básica, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios.  Está soltero, vive junto con un sobrino en su casa,  su sobrino tiene en negocio de venta de verduras y él le ayuda.

José posee 12 años de experiencia en la venta de verduras, de dedicarse a este trabajo, antes se dedicaba a cultivar hortalizas y luego las vendía, fue así como decidió dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que se dio cuenta que a través de este negocio, obtiene sus ingresos para ayudarles a sus padres con la alimentación. Aunque no vive con ellos, les apoya con la alimentación.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar verduras y frutas  para revender en el municipio donde él vive. Así dispondrá de más mercadería y podrá ayudar a su sobrino con sus estudios. 

Sus sueños son tener a corto plazo un buen negocio establecido que día con día le permita generar sus ingresos, además las ganancias  las utilizará para ayudarle a sus padres, ya que estos ya están ancianos.
texts.en:
José, 41 years old, studied until the 2nd grade of basic education.  Due to scarce economic resources, he could not continue with his studies.  He is single and he lives with a nephew in his house.  His nephew has a business selling vegetables, and he helps him.

José has 12 years of experience in selling vegetables and of working this job.  Previously, he used to grow vegetables and later he would sell them.  This was how he decided to pursue this job; since he realized that through this business, he obtains his income to help his parents with food.  Although he does not live with them, he supports them with food.

The loan that he is requesting is to buy vegetables and fruits to resell in the town where he lives.  Therefore, he will have more merchandise and will be able to help his nephew with his studies.

His short term dreams are to have a good business established that day by day permit him to generate his income.  He will use the profits to help his parents, as they are already elderly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to resell in the town where he lives.  Therefore, he will have more merchandise and will be able to help his nephew with his studies.

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is 29 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the city outskirts in Kampala. He operates a milk processing and selling business. Through UGAFODE he obtained the capital to start his own business, which has been doing well. Farouk has been doubling his output as he perfects his processing.

He has requested another loan which he will use to purchase additional raw ingredients and equipment needed for his milk processing business. The loan will help him increase production and supply stocks in stores as well. He has maximized his profits and keeps pursuing his goals for the good of his family. He hopes that his business will grow and benefit his family and community.

loans.use: To buy milk and preservatives

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 48 years old and is married with 3 children. 

Mercedita is in the agricultural business, rearing pigs in the Philippines. Mercedita has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Mercedita has been in the pig rearing business for 5 years now, and she has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF in order to sustain her practice.

In the future, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 44-year-old married woman. She sells cloth for her livelihood. She buys a collection of cloth from the market and then sells them to the people of her locality. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

She is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth to expand her inventory and attract more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth to expand her inventory and attract more customers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 34 years old and married with four children aged between eight years and six months. She will use the loan to increase the stock level of her retail shop. 

This is her 4th loan cycle with VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes are to increase income and be able to pay school fees for all of her children.

loans.use: to increase stock for the shop.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Juliet is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Juliet has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Juliet has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Juliet has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Gina requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business, which she has been in for 9 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 38-year-old female married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Grace has operated a retail shop since 2000. She also owns a transport business and sells passion fruit juice. Grace has a dream of building a residential house and expanding her business. Limited capital and competition are her major challenges. 

Grace is a hard-working woman who wants money to buy soap, millet flour, cassava flour, books, pens and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, millet flour, cassava flour, books, pens and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio
